Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Bridlewood
Reviews.Content: We always stay at this hotel when doing business in Toronto. They absolutely knock themselves out to accommodate our business needs. I have arrived long before check-in time and they have found a room for me so that I could get settled before my meetings. They have also let me have a very late check-outs so that I could participate on conference calls in the quiet of my room. The furnishings are very new and the beds are great. I also like that you can open the windows to get the air circulating. The buffet breakfast, which is included with some packages, is absolutely excellent. For a quicker breakfast there is a snack area which serves Starbucks. The pool is small and rather dimly lit but a really nice feature in a downtown hotel. For a downtown hotel, the price is great. Also, parking is conveniently located (across a small street but close) in a secure garage where they actually roll down a locking door late at night. I just don't bother to look for another hotel because the service is so consistently good here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Service and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Alisa15
Reviews.Content: We went a few weeks ago on a wagjag to the this hotel and found it to be a great weekend getaway for the kids. They upgraded us to a suite and the rooms were very clean a bit outdated but clean. Close to Royal Ontario Museum. What was the best was the customer service. Everyone was very helpful at the front desk enough for me to take special notice. They were all really very very nice! We also liked that they had a lounge area with tvs in some booths so my husband and I could come down for a drink in the evening and keep the kids entertained for a bit. Only down fall I did not like is there are not a lot of restaurants other than sushi or korean in this neighbourhood. We looked and looked but really nothing around as far a restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cubabound2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and had a fine stay. The room was a good side, a bit dated, but clean. It was surprisingly quiet at night given it's location right on Younge Street. The hotel is in a great location, close to lots of restaurants, the Eaton Centre, and the ROM. We didn't eat on site but for the oatmeal in the morning...Would recommend walking to a near by Starbucks instead for a better deal. The staff were pleasant and answered any questions that we had. Would stay here again. Got a great gov. rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- great location”
Reviews.Author: eagle167
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this location twice now, both for business once in 2010 and once in 2011. both times far exceeded my expectations.. Quiet, comfortable and clean. Couldnt ask for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa G
Reviews.Content: Very nice location. The room was very clean and fresh. The gym is very well equiped and the pool/spa area is well kept. Staff was friendly and helpful. Only thing I didn't like in the room is that you have the shower and toilet in the bathroom but the sink and mirror next to the closet...though it is efficient when you are two people it still bugged me a little. But overall very nice stay and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: BruceHToronto
Reviews.Content: Had nothing planned for the weekend, so decided to throw in a cheap bid on PriceLine and see what would come up. We got this place. From start to finish everything was ideal. Easy access , easy parking , checked in 4 hours early , huge clean room and a 2 minute walk to the subway , so easy to get around the city. I would stay here again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Kathy M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights for business. Parking was very expensive $30/day plus HST - but the room rate made up for it. Rooms had a nice clean, crisp look and feel; 2 queen beds, flat screen TV, chair, desk with chair and small bar fridge with coffee pot and bottled water for a charge. Bathroom had toilet with tub/shower and the makeup area with sink was separate. Closet with safe, large enough for laptop. Breakfast was included in room rate and was a nice surprise! Huge buffet with chef preparing omelets or eggs your choice, bacon/sausage, french toast, home fries, baked beans, tomatoes, fresh fruit, hot and cold cereal, huge selection of breads and pastries, waitress provide beverages, complimentary newspaper. Location was excellent only 2 minutes to subway at the corner of college or a short walk down to the Eaton's center. Lots of shopping right there and numerous restaurants, drug store and liquor store within east walk. Good value for location and would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Location works”
Reviews.Author: maltyone
Reviews.Content: Pretty much what you would expect in a basic Marriott. Functional sums it up. Free wireless. Close to the subway. Rooms dated but ok. Starbucks etc across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: 12FTW
Reviews.Content: I was here for business from Feb 20-24 and it has been a great stay. Rooms are quiet and clean, location is central to everything, and it had everything I needed for work. Plus it was the best value for what I got as well. I highly recommend staying here if you are in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, inexpensive, and great rooms right downtown!”
Reviews.Author: StephenBarb
Reviews.Content: Staff are exceptionally pleasant and helpful, right from the check-in clerks, the bar and restaurant staff, concierge, maintenance and room maids. The rooms are very nice, with my particular preference being a balcony room in the old section, since the washroom and bathroom are down a hallway in the suite, which means, when in the middle of the night your partner gets up to use the facilities, you are not awakened by the brilliant light shining in your eyes and the sounds of flushing toilets. Food and service in the restaurant and bistro are superb, as well as room service, with reasonable prices and varied menu, and with waiters who treat you like a valued person. Although the pool and health centre is small, it is nonetheless, quite adequate, well equipped, and well maintained. The location on Yonge Street, next to the former Maple Leaf Gardens Hockey Arena, is a key attraction. Excellent shopping, touring and eating is clustered within walking distance and just steps away from the underground subway, and, the hotel is just around the corner of the world-famous Gay Village, theatres and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: farm2099
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the hotel in February 2012. The hotel is very close to a subway station and next to Yonge street. The check-in was done very smoothly even though I did arrive way too early, they were able to find me a room right away. The room itself is very average but not dirty. I had a King size room and the room was big.The furniture looks outdated , especially the sofa and the chair for the desk. There is no fridge in the room which is weird since the room is big enough to have more furniture. I didnt use the restaurant so I cannot comment on it. The wireless internet is very good quality and it is FREE. I would stay at this hotel again for sure. The inside of the hotel looks very professional, they have done a good job.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Super_Scotty
Reviews.Content: Good location, OK rooms. There was construction going on in the hotel, which woke me up in the am... kinda annoying. Good central location, but some sketchy street people were always hanging around outside.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, pretty standard stay”
Reviews.Author: MontyK
Reviews.Content: This is a very good location, steps to Yonge street, the Eaton Centre and a quick few steps to the subway and everything else Toronto has to offer. We stayed on a Friday night for a quick getaway (we live only an hour or so away) and just wanted a night right downtown. The room is pretty standard, clean, HD TV, free Wifi, nothing fancy. I like having the valet parking service ($30/day) and we got a food voucher worth $50 that was eaten up quickly by two buffet breakfasts ($21/person). We didn't sample the bar or the pool so I can't speak to that, but if you're looking for a reliable, clean, central hotel, at a pretty decent rate, you can't do much better. I'll probably try the Sheraton next time, just for variety (and their outdoor pool - even in winter!). Pi Tom restaurant is right across the street for easy and good Thai fare (we dined in while watching a movie)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: brainguy
Reviews.Content: Easy checking in-clean rooms-service in restaurant was excellent-enjoyed winterlicious meal on menu! Close to subway station-easy access to any part of city. Great for the price. My choice for staying in Toronto on any trip.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Hassle-Free”
Reviews.Author: Keith_Montgomery
Reviews.Content: Efficient check-in and check-out. Free internet. Comfortable bed. No objections to my request for a late check-out. Appreciated being able to print out my boarding pass in the lobby - a great service that more hotels should offer.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean - a nice surprise, for the money”
Reviews.Author: Debby68
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference, was a little nervous about the location based on reviews that described the location as noisy. I am very concerned with cleanliness - this hotel was quiet and clean - definitely would be back.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: ech_zed
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night while in TO for a wedding. I found the staff very kind and accommodating. When I asked them for recommendations they were knowledgeable and very kind. I has the buffet breakfast, the food was salty but fresh. Next time I will try the plated breakfast but other then that I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice courtyard”
Reviews.Author: mjd50
Reviews.Content: Great location in downtown Toronto. The south tower has a decent view of Yonge St. I believe we had an upgraded room with sofa and table, so lots of space. Small fridge under the sink. Parking is expensive, $30 a day but they are very quick to retrieve your car. The bistro is ridiculous, which a lot of courtyards have nowadays. $2.25 for a banana?!??!?!? There is a restaurant on the lobby level but did not try it. Gym is large and well equipped. Bed was very comfortable and A/C-heater was quiet and kept the temperature steady. Internet was free and fast enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rate, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AceOttawa
Reviews.Content: Room well-appointed, seemed to be recently renovated, totally clean, top-quality beds (but do not need 5 pillows!), very quiet (12th floor), check-in and check-out smooth,other guests friendly, courteous staff, 5 minute walk to subway (College Station) and major food store (Metro), lots of restaurants nearby, price of room quite reasonable (actually,very good!), now our favourite choice of downtown hotel in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “A top-tier Courtyard property”
Reviews.Author: Jason M
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the hotel, you realize this is no ordinary Courtyard - it is spacious! From the lobby, cafe, and dining area to the surprisingly large rooms you feel comfortable - like you can stretch, relax and stay for a while. The neighborhood has multiple coffee shops, unique dining, and a 24 hour pharmacy across the street. All said this is a convenient property that offers a good value for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Has everything you need”
Reviews.Author: Skittle54
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night while in town on business. Easy location, just off of College subway station. Check in and check out was easy. Friendly staff. Room was clean, decent, has everything you need. Free wireless. Easy to catch a cab from the hotel and it looked like they had a via rail train station shuttle. Only complaint was telephones in the room did not work. Hotel has restaurants and cafes within it. Overall, a good stay. Would consider staying here again next time I'm in Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel.... Dated”
Reviews.Author: netgeek
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference through work. The hotel lobby is very modern and trendy, but this is where it ends. The rooms themselves are dated and in need of a reno. The bed was simply OK. The bedding was again OK... would of been nice to have a duvet. The view from the room overlooked a run down apartment building. Overall, the room was clean. I heard a lot of banging from other rooms which was annoying as I tried to sleep. Location was perfect! Close to the subway and Eaton Centre. Staff were OK. The guy that checked me in was a bit of a mess. Would I stay here at my own expense?? Probably not... unless they update the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Det bliver ikke bedre til denne pris”
Reviews.Author: Windfeld-C
Reviews.Content: It has been a while since I stayed here for a family holiday. But I forgot to tell all of you out there about it! Shame on me... At first we experienced some problems. I had booked a triple room with two double beds but we were given a double room with a roll-away bed. For one night I don't mind a roll-away, but for five nights...? No thanks! The staff apologized for this and as compensation we received free breakfast for the entire stay. What a generous way to make us happy. And on the second day we were moved to the correct room. Free breakfast is what it is. But this was a marvellous breakfast with fantastic omelets and a huge buffet with everything on your mind. The room we were given was large with a view to the north along Yonge Street. The hotel even has a pool! I thought of this hotel more like a Marriott rather than a Courtyard Marriott. Incredible staff. Really nice rooms. And the perfect location in a fantastic city. I'm not just being nice. I'm not over exaggerating. This is truly a nice hotel. I expected a three star hotel but it went all the way for me. Thank you for making this a memorable stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ems1339
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after taking our daughter to see Disney Live. The location was awesome, the staff are very friendly and the room was very clean. Nice and central to most things. Plenty of places to eat nearby. All and all a good place to stay if you are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in a great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: wallybat
Reviews.Content: The last time i was here in 2010 the room i was in was a little grungy. This time it seemed like they'd redecorated or at least repainted and refreshed the rooms. The lobby is fun and has a nice casual bar and the restaurant has a great breakfast buffet. Great for when i need to get to work but also need a hot meal fast to make it through the day. my room was quiet, the temperature was comfortable and the valets were helpful. i like this location since i don't get a rental car, i can walk to restaurants or shopping in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Feels Like Home”
Reviews.Author: dominicanfriend
Reviews.Content: I just discovered the Courtyard by Marriott Toronto Downtown on here and although this is my first review, I've been a loyal customer of theirs for over ten years now. For many years, I stayed there every second week for ten of the twelve months a year. My decision lied initially with the prompt decision making of a young woman at the front desk in 2003 when I had to suddenly return home due to a family emergency. The customer service at this hotel is second to none and for those who have to be away from home a lot it feels a bit like home. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. From the front desk to the lobby bar to the restaurant including housekeeping staff go above and beyond. I would not hesitate to recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Casinoboy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and really enjoyed it because of the location. You will could not ask for anything better then this particular hotel for that reason alone. Overall my stay was excellent! I booked a package called cars eat free which included the valet parking plus $25 gift card for each night stayed for gas. My only issues with this hotel were things that were not really in the control of the management. The noise from Yonge Street due to sirens as the hotel is located almost directly in front of a fire station and from people in the halls yelling and screaming. I do think the hotel could have reacted a bit more quickly to those individuals who were causing a disturbance at 5am.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: Piast_PL
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to write a review on this hotel since I stayed here last year in March for a Model United Nations Conference I attended at Queens Park hosted by York University. Well here it is finally! I can only attest to what I saw and what facilities I used but I hope this review is helpful nonetheless. Let me start off by saying the hotel lobby is really nice and clean. Very welcoming! Reception was very quick and prompt whenever I had a request for extra things like soap etc. (I was sharing a room with 4 students bear in mind). I also enjoyed each morning my free edition of the National Post :) no complaints here on that end. The room itself was very basic and had a very weird stench to it. The maid did do our bed every morning but she forget twice out of our 3 days to change the towels, that was not fun at all! The basic rooms you pay for aren't amazing in any way so don't expect much. The bathroom we had was very small and the curtain was pretty lousy in keeping the water out. I've seen better bathrooms in Cuba to be honest :S Also, the elevators take forever to make their way through the floors and are very small, your better off taking the stairs if you are in a rush! I never took advantage of the bar or ate any of the food there, I was always going out to eat because I figured it would be cheaper. However, I did use the gym and pool and I can vouch that both these facilities were very small for a hotel this large. I was not impressed to be honest. Then again you get what you pay for. Finally, there were a lot of students using this hotel on the weekends I found to go clubbing and partying. Adults, depending what floor your on don't be surprised if you hear screaming and yelling party goers at 2am or 3am stumbling to their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value, good location”
Reviews.Author: shellyb007
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a stay at this hotel for three nights. The location is nice, just one short block from the College Park subway stop and about a 10 minute walk from the Eaton Centre Mall. The location also has lots of ethnic restaurants in the area, with many open late. The lobby is very spacious and inviting and there is free coffee in the morning along with a free to guests computer area. Wifi is free. The room was spacious and the bed very comfortable. The water in the shower was hit or miss, sometimes very cool. The toiolet paper in my room was positioned a far reach away behind the door. The people at the front desk were very professional and prompt in their service. We did notice trash in the elevator and on a common table in the hall on our floor that was there for two days.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing quality, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: mkbnj
Reviews.Content: This property does a disservice to the Marriott Courtyard name. While the lobby is practical but inviting, the room is a grand disappointment. From plastic shower walls and moldy shower curtains, to broken drawers in the dresser, ancient air conditioner and a too-soft bed, I was disappointed. Internet access was good, the small fitness center was useful with newer equipment, and the pool/jacuzzi were a pleasant extra. The staff I interacted with were very helpful, but the property, at this price point, needs a makeover, badly.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, courteous”
Reviews.Author: Amazinggrace018
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard in November 2011, and it was a pleasant stay. The room was newly renovated. There was other renovation going on in the hotel, but it was well marked and did not interfere with service. The dining room menu had lots to choose from, and everyone at the table was satisfied with their dinner. I had a room on Yonge Street but did not experience much street noise. Our firm books rooms at another large downtown hotel, but I will choose the Marriott of the other choice any day. Check in/out was done so well. Coffee in the lobby was a wonderful treat.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but Shabby”
Reviews.Author: Jenaia M
Reviews.Content: The water runs hot and cold, making showering miserable, the sheets are clean but rough, the skirts on the beds are dirty and torn, and the mattresses sagging. There is also dust all along the edges of the floorboards and under the beds. Clearly the cleaning is superficial. Oh, and I could hear my neighbors, making sleep a bit difficult. It's a little disappointing since the rooms are spacious and the staff friendly. This has the potential to be a really good hotel. I really wanted to like it, but...Oh and if you are thinking of booking a room here because there is a "lap" pool, forget it. It's more like a wading pool. If you are a swimmer like me, you will do a flip turn, push off, and be at the other end. Very disappointed in that.

Reviews.Title: “Very average city centre hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Duststorm
Reviews.Content: The outlook when first entering the hotel was very positive as you are greeted by a smart, professional looking reception area and lounge. The rooms however are very average for a 'value' city centre hotel with not a huge number of luxuries (appreciating however that Courtyard is at the lower end of the Marriott chain), however our room in all fairness was clean and reasonable comfortable. However, our room was on a lower floor overlooking Yonge street, and as a result of that there was a lot of noise during the day (however with due respect, there were roadworks being completed in the area during the time I was staying), and in addition, noise from the outside was still audible at night while trying to sleep (I have no clue if rooms on the higher floors would be as bad). The pool area was reasonable which also had a nice hot tub, in addition, there is a small computer suite in the reception area with access to the internet which was free for guests to use which was a great bonus. For me, one big disadvantage to this hotel is it is not best situated for two reasons, firstly it is a reasonable walk away from the majority of the downtown nightlife (bars . restauraunts etc) and it is also in one of the least tidy areas of the downtown area. However it is approximately a 15 minute walk from the Eaton Centre. To summarise, I would suggest this hotel is best suited to those staying on the city on business. If you are holidaying in Toronto and looking for a hotel, there are a number of hotels at the same level as the Courtyard in better positions.

Reviews.Title: “What you can expect but with much more”
Reviews.Author: Lucie-and-David
Reviews.Content: I am a transportation employee and must stay at hotels more often than not. When in Toronto, we are being lodged at the Marriott Courtyard downtown. Ok, usually, when hotels/taxis/other services fares are negotiated by third parties, the customer is the victim. Horror stories abound, but don't apply here. Which is a great relief. From the very beginning of our contract years ago, and up until now and still going, the staff made us feel welcome. We are not given tiny closet-size room, as I don't believe exist in this hotel. The smaller ones are yet roomy, with a big enough bathroom and sometimes a balcony. Granted, sometimes the bathroom is weirdly arranged, making a midnight trip to the bathroom quite the experience, but who cares when it's clean and functional? Furniture is basic, don't expect anything too too recent, tvs are fine but the cable service sometimes has issues, but ultimately, the pros are outdoing the cons. The location is also important. It is near fast food joints, but also a walking distance from better eateries near Bloor. Shopping is also walking distance with the Eaton center nearby, there is a subway station a block away and a good movie theater. The only downside really is the disappearance of the nice and quiet bar, the Fireside, for the starbuck cafe behind which the new bar hides. Too bad because Peter, their best-by-far bartender was always a pleasure to deal with (when he's mixing, try his margarita! Just make sure HE is doing it, otherwise it'll be a plain, cardboard tasting beverage). I'm pretty sure the new cafe is fine, but I miss the atmosphere of a hotel bar, and I miss my margaritas. And I am pretty sure that Peter is bored out of his mind in his unattended sort-of bar that looks like a starbuck because it is. Please Marriott Courtyard manager, give us back a real bar! With sofas! I warmly recommend this hotel for your stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and overall great experience!”
Reviews.Author: thunderup
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several Marriot hotels in the past and this one ranks right up there in terms of service, rooms, and experience. The hotel is situated among many fast food and dine-in restaurants, shopping centre, and shops. The "balcony" room was spacious and clean but the balcony was more of a cityview but it was nice to be able to get fresh air without stepping out of the hotel. I had booked this last minute and they were able to accomodate for a high floor which is appreciated. All in all, a great experience and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: sharkfin
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our little Downtown Toronto getaway over the holidays. We have stayed at this hotel before, and really like it. It is so close to the TTC - literally just steps away from the door, so everything in the city is accessable. If the weather cooperates, then you can have a lovely walk down Yonge St to the Eaton Centre or anywhere else your feet will take you. There are good restaurants close by, movie theatres and shopping etc.... The hotel is super clean and we had no problems. The pool is small, but clean. We enjoyed some time to just relax in the hot tub - the upside is it is a quiet pool area, so we had the place to ourselves. We will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “BED BUG Alert!!!”
Reviews.Author: N L
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed this isn't what you would expect from a Marriott... Stayed there for one night and had bugs crawling all over me and my boyfriend... Supervisor on duty didn't wanna refund our stay whatsoever until my boyfriend spoke up about it... Good thing a man was around because I would have been forced to stay the night, the way front desk treated me!! NEVER EVER going back there. I'd stay away unless you like bed bugs!!

Reviews.Title: “Always feels like home and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Carole382
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard by Marriott hotel was the first hotel we stayed at on our first trip to Toronto and was our first stay in Canada in May 2001 and always felt it was like a home from home. We have always found the hotel to be clean, safe and the staff very helpful and accomodating. In the latter years we have been able to chose our room on the 17th floor. We have stayed at this hotel 6 times and have no negative comments to make. We have stayed once at the Holiday Inn on King and the Delta Chelsea, but have not enjoyed our stays there. We were actually booked to stay at the Fairmont Royal York this trip, but there were so many negative, worrying reviews that we changed to the Marriott, so glad we did. Thank you for a wonderful Christmas. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “5th time staying at this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: PabloPicano
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Toronto, but now book a room at this hotel if I want to stay over on the weekends. My reasons? LOCATION - right near the subway/ major hub in Toronto. PRICE - the cheapest cleaenest hotel I can find that has an updated look. ROOMS - the rooms are by far the largest and most spacious that you will find in Toronto at this price. STAFF - simply amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what to say...”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveler1944
Reviews.Content: I hate to have to give this hotel such a low review because I really hoped it would be better. I stayed here Dec 30 and Dec 31... security was good, hotel is nicely designed, but truth is that unless you are attending something in the nearby gay community of Toronto there isn't much reason to stay here.... The neighborhood at Yonge and Carleton/College is just too sleazy for words and although I took a one bedroom suite the furniture in the living room must have been made by some 'stickman' or someone with a fused spine, or intended for same because not one piece of the furniture.... sofa, two arm chairs, and desk chair had a back on it that didn't feel like a piece of wood with padding.... just really bad... On the positive side the staff are nice, the overall ambience of the hotel is nice and the rate was a good one... But I think I'll use some other hotel in the future when staying downtown and won't be recommending this one to friends... (I live in Toronto, and remember when this used to be the great Westbury Hotel, so thought I'd stay here for New Year's .... but, no, not again.)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl181747
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about 2 blocks North of the main shopping attraction in Toronto - the Eaton Centre. It is a good location but if you are on foot, you have to walk past some poorly lit areas - especially on the east side of Yonge. If you stay on the west side, you will feel more comfortable! The hotel is clean and the staff are friendly. Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel... awesome location”
Reviews.Author: mkalra
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed for one night. This is an awesome location for shipping since Eaton Centre is about 10min walking distance. It is a little far from night life, so you will definitely need to cab it. The rooms were small and I definitely did not get THAT view from the picture above. This was a good price however for the location. I liked the cafe on the lobby level, which served to go foods and Starbucks coffee. We also ate at the breakfast buffet at the hotel Restaurant, which was pricey, but the food was really good. There was an omlette station! Overall, a nice place to stay in the city for a couple nights.

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel - nothing outstanding. OK”
Reviews.Author: simonaccra
Reviews.Content: You get what Courtyard usually offer - reasonable rooms, reasonable service. Rooms a bit dated. My toilet blocked after one use and the light fitting fell on my head in the bathroom (the incidents were not connected) but rectified quickly enough with a nice personalised apology. Good wifi (free I think). Gave late check out (at cost) despite saying hotel was full. Overall an OK experience. Building works in progress but not noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: redtrouble2
Reviews.Content: I was in Toronto for business. My truck was too tall for parking - wasn't too big of a deal but is an issue when traveling to the city. The hotel was clean and quiet. Had everything I needed. Short walk to all kinds of stores and pubs. The pool and hot tub were okay. Wifi in the room was awesome. The bar in the lobby seemed very inviting - but I didn't have time to stop for a drink. The only thing that would have been nice is a fridge in the room, other than that it was good.

Reviews.Title: “BLAZING WIFI - Very Good Service”
Reviews.Author: dyarger
Reviews.Content: The minute you walk into this Courtyard you are greeted by at least three people. They always have staff out helping guests. Even though they were doing construction while I was there it never disturbed my stay. The bellman are great, always helpful for getting direction or a cab that will accept AmEx. Wifi moves compared to most major chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good rates and great location”
Reviews.Author: edemec
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard Marriott on Yonge is our annual office holiday party overnight spot. It is 2 blocks away from the party and consistently good. They recently renovated the lobby which has given it a more modern look. Staff at check-in were courteous and everything was as reserved. Our room was comfortable and spacious, clean and had a very strong smell of Febreze. I assume it was either just cleaned or someone had smoked in it and they were deodorizing. Either way, it didn't bother us and the room served as the crash pad it was intended to be. The McD's right across the street makes for a quick easy breakfast too! We'll be back again next December.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but noisy room”
Reviews.Author: Ellie_M_B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well maintained and in a great location for downtown Toronto. We stayed on the 11th floor and it was so noisy I couldn't sleep at all. The furnace/fan clicked all night and you could hear all the street noise. I must say the front desk check in was great. Quick and helpful. We were upgraded to a suite which was a large room but the bed was incredibly uncomfortable. I don't think I would stay there again. Not if I plan on sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service (as usual)”
Reviews.Author: SWCTmom
Reviews.Content: I equate the word "Marriott" with "safe bet" when it comes to hotels, and this one was no exception. All of the staff were friendly and courteous, room was clean and all common areas were neat as a pin (even as renovations are going on). This hotel is super-convenient for business travel, just a half a block from the subway and about a 5 minute subway ride to the train station and convention center. Street noise is the only issue; we were able to hear occaisional car horns, sirens and people yelling from our 8th floor room. Luckily the hotel is in a nice part of town so they were not constant noises at all.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect city stay”
Reviews.Author: Bettina1705
Reviews.Content: I used to work in the hotel business so I am pretty critical when it comes to hotels. But the Courtyard Marriott had everything I needed: the room was really spacious, super clean and comfy. Hotel staff was really friendly and helpful and the location is pretty good, too. When I returned back home I realized I had forgotten something. Within a day they had located the item and within less than 2 weeks it had been returned to my via mail (from Toronto to Europe, so that's pretty prompt service). All interactions with staff were positive, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and can recommend it without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Business”
Reviews.Author: Kaacky
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in 2010 during a business trip. Accommodations were quite clean and tidy, with ample space. The hotel seems to be more suited to business travel than leisure. Room was quite comfortable and had all amenities needed for a short stay. Food throughout the hotel was well prepared with a good menu selection.

Reviews.Title: “One Step Up from the YMCA”
Reviews.Author: sarahej
Reviews.Content: I last stayed at this hotel 2 years ago for annual work function. It was so bad that I swore never again but in the season of cheer and foregiveness I thought I would give it a try this year. The lobby is heavily under construction but that's the least of my gripes -- the construction is contained and the area is cleaner than my actual hotel room. I was awarded a king room on an upper floor and I shudder to think what is being served up on floors closer to the street. It's a big enough room but words escape me.....The pull out sofa looks like it was dragged from a dumpster. The plethora of pillows are really just cotton balls stuffed in white bags. On the bright side I have found multiple old newspapers under the bed for my reading pleasure. There is something resembling a chemical spill on the tiles of the bathroom. The heating/ac system is inoperable. Pray for me. I have two more nights to suffer in this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Safari1957
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems to be an effective business hotel with a very busy lobby area. During my stay some renovation work was going on around the lift area. This does ofcourse not look nice but I did not notice any disturbing noice from this work.No complimentary breakfast offered by this hotel, but if you do not want to eat in the hotel there are many alternatives not far from the hotel. Decent gym, but pool not all that imressive.Very efficive and friendly staff both at the reception and the valet personell outside.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichaelLondon_ON
Reviews.Content: Recently attending a medical conference in Toronto it was held at this hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful in every aspect from arrival to departure. Being a somewaht older hotel the rooms were fairly large and the beds comfortable. The dining facilities are not luxurious, but the food was good and very reasonably priced. No fancy linens here, but if you want high end dining, the hotel is within a short cab ride from many of Toronto's finer eateries. The hotel is located downtown close to most of the shopping and dining facilities as well as the sports and cultural activities, the only slight drawback is it's being on lower Yonge Street which is somewaht seedy. If you need a good hotel to stay for business purposes, then I can highly recommend this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: rondi3
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel at least twice a year. They renovated the lobby and dining room last year and they are now working on the elevator lobby and bar area in the south tower. The renovations have really modernized the main lobby and it is now very pleasant and stylish. The rooms are good and comfortable, The maids are helpful and friendly. Checkin is quick. The wi-fi works well. The best part of the hotel is its location: close to U of T and Ryerson, one block from a Yonge St subway stop and streetcars on College. There are good restaurants on Elm Street and Church Street, and for breakfast, there are places on Carleton, Fran's on College, and a Second Cup in the building itself. A MacD's is across Yonge from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel fine, management sucks”
Reviews.Author: Belgo
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott Elite customer and normally I should have been put in a high floor and a quiet room. I was put on a low floor right outside the ice machine. I complained, management refused to move me that day as they said the hotel was full. They offered me points in compensation (not much compensation when all you want is sleep but ok I am not one to knock back some extra points). Guess what, even after I reminded them of it, they still haven't bothered to give me the points. I also wanted to rent a meeting room for a one hour business meeting. Nope, had to rent it for the entire day. I saw that the room wasn't used that day so they got no income from the room when they could have had some money out of me (oh yes and they wanted to charge me 100 bucks for Internet access during my meeting which is a joke as it was free everywhere else in the hotel). The hotel for the rest is as you would expect a downtown Courtyard to be. Hope they change the management soon though. No commitment to customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: cedars52
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed one night recently for a high school reunion. We got the CAA rate which includes 2 buffet brunches. The hotel is underging some upgrading/renos but it had little impact on us. The room was nicely furnished with 2 queen beds, a desk -free internet, and a bathroom with makeup mirror outside the bathroom which we found convenient. The beds were comfortable. The hotel is centrally located-walking distance to Bloor and Yorkville and a short subway ride to the Eaton Centre (or longer walk). Brunch is very good and a nice treat.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about.....”
Reviews.Author: HandyMommy
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel with renovations going on in a lobby during my week long stay there. Rooms very spacious but boring and "cold" with no personality and in a need of an update. If you get a room on Yonge Street side, try to get higher floors. I was on the ffith floor and heard all the noise from the street. It kept waking me up at night. No complimentary breakfast offered at this location. Decent gym, but I was not crazy about the lap pool. Housekeeping bangs on your door at 8:20 in the morning and if you refuse housekeeping and leave "DO NOT DISTURB" sign on your door, they will call your room to push housekeeping on you???? I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Natasha S
Reviews.Content: I would definitely go back to this hotel. Great price, fabulous location, and great staff. The room is very clean and comfortable. The Eaton Centre is just a 10min walk away, Second cup is next to the hotel, there is a cinema just around the corner, and a 30min walk to the CN Tower and the Air Canada Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good but slightly disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Sebastien O
Reviews.Content: I will start with my only complaint, I booked a King Suite with the understanding that it would be on the highest floor available, it turns out that we only got a room on the 4th floor. I was told on the phone that the King Suite was on the highest floors, when I arrived I was told they only go up to the 8th floor. All in all it was a great hotel, great location, great price. It is worth getting the valet parking.Clean rooms, good service.One thing i found out on the last day of trip was double decker sightseeing bus tours of Toronto and one of the stops is the Courtyard... could have saved tons of money on cab fares.

Reviews.Title: “10-11 November 2011”
Reviews.Author: MisrEmiri
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at this hotel because I got an excellent deal through the Marriott web-site, plus it was within walking distance of 1, Dundas Street West where I had a class to attend. The breakfast buffet was doubtlessly the best part of staying at this hotel. The food was delicious and there was quite a large selection. The room was basic but quite clean and the bed very comfortable. The hotel is just above the Dundas subway station. The area is very lively with numerous shops and restaurants. Don't miss the College Park Mall located in a very beautifully restored former Eaton's department store. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/price”
Reviews.Author: boatingman_ny
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very convenient downtown location,, just a block from the subway, so very easy to get around the city! I stayed in the north wing, and although the room was a bit on the small side, it was clean and I got the room from a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: BTownMiss
Reviews.Content: I live in the Toronto area and have stayed at many hotels in the downtown core, and for the price this hotel is definitely a gem if you are looking for a nice clean and spacious hotel in a convenient location. I payed only a little over $100 for a 2 queen room and there was so much space to move around as well as a sitting area near the window. This time we were there for a halloween party, and friends of ours got ready in our room so it was nice to have so much space for everyone to get ready in. We've done this before at a more expensive hotel down the road and there was barely room to walk around the beds without brushing up against the wall. The lobby is updated and modern and there was construction starting up in the morning when we were checking out, so I'm assuming they are in the process of a makeover. The rooms themselves are nothing fancy, but very clean, and the beds are very comfortable. We never did get down to the pool and gym but based on what I saw from the pictures it would be ok for a quick dip or soak in the hot tub as long as there weren't a lot of people down there, the pool is very small and narrow. It's located about a block away from Young and Dundas, so you're right in the heart of the city. Theres all kinds of different restaurants right outside the door that are open late so you wont have to wonder far for a late night snake if you need to. There is also a shoppers drugmart next door which is very convenient. We checking in and out in and out in a matter of seconds and were well taken care of by a friendly staff the entire time. I would definitely reccomend this hotel to a friend, and hope plan to stay there again int he future.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel undergoing a makeover”
Reviews.Author: dsj247
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a one night business trip to Toronto. Situated on Yonge and within walking distance of Bloor Street, you have late night takeaways and tattoo parlours mixing with high end shops. Staff were excellent and very helpful. The hotel is being refurbished, to give it a business feel, with meeting areas, coffee lounge and restaurant. I enjoyed my stay and would go back if I need to be in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, great central location”
Reviews.Author: renrenren
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on Yonge street where all the action happens in Toronto. The lobby is newly renovated. Rooms are clean and well appointed. Beds are very comfortable and the free internet is a great addition. I stay here a few times a year and have always had good service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: michiganmarlon
Reviews.Content: Amid the bustling, cheesy and slightly sleazy circus that is central Yonge Street in downtown Toronto sits the Courtyard by Marriott, a pleasant base from which to enjoy one of North America's great cities. The main porte cochere entrance to the hotel is actually off Wood St. The Yonge Street entrance is usually closed. The lobby is usually very busy, but its earth tones and modern furnishings are soothing. The check-in staff was quick, efficient and pleasant. My room, a king single, was spacious, but with a quirk. Not only was the faucet separated from the shower & toilet, it was on the other side of the room, next to the clothes closet. Irritating, but not a major gripe. The room was comfortable if fairly generic, with the typical taupe color scheme and a couple of loungers and a work desk (which unfortunately didn't face the TV). The bed was very comfy, with just the right balance of firm/soft. Elevators in the south tower, where I stayed, tended to be slow at times. The hotel featured a restaurant, pool and fitness center - none of which I sampled on a fast & fun weekend in T.O. There were computers for use free of charge in the lobby, and WiFi was free. The Courtyard is in a great spot - smack dab in the middle of downtown Toronto. The stretch of Yonge Street where it sits has a carnival midway atmosphere to it - shwarma and pizza stands, tacky souvenir and electronics shops, budget eateries, adult video stores and lots of flashing signs. It's a fun place to soak up atmosphere and people-watch. The hotel is around the corner from the College subway station and the College Street streetcar, allowing for easy use of Toronto's vast public transit network. The Eaton Centre is a short walk away,. And with a $60 a night rate on Priceline, this place was a steal.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and value, great location”
Reviews.Author: RichardH100
Reviews.Content: We had not stayed in Toronto before and originally wanted to stay near the harbour. We ended up at the Marriott, almost by mistake. We were so glad we did as the room (or rather a suite) was fabulous. The staff couldn't have been more helpful. There is free coffee and a newpaper in the morning and free safety deposit box at reception. Great value for what we got. The hotel is a 2 minute walk from the College Metro station which is very cheap to use. Even the hop on - hop off bus stops outside the hotel. The local area is vibrant with plenty of shops and restaurants and alot cheaper than downtown. Less than a mile easy walk to the main downtown area but as you pass plenty of shops and Dundas Square, it seems no time at all. We would definiltely go back to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but get a room far away from the elevator.”
Reviews.Author: Eliette_B
Reviews.Content: Location is great. you can walk everywhere and there is plenty to see and do. Room is average. Especially after you have walked through the lobby. The hotel has a new renovated lobby which is really nice. But the rooms are not renovated so not quite what you would expect. We had a room just across the elevator, which is something you want to avoid. You can hear the elevator doors opening and closing all evening. Fortunately it gets less during the night but earplugs do help. Great is the free Wifi in the room. Guy at the check out had a rough morning I think. Very grumpy. not something you would expect at hotel front desk But still I can recommend the hotel as the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: curioustravelor
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel great staff greeting, not the usual "oh you bought this online" cold reception for us priceline or hotwire customers. Unexpected coffe and treats in the lobby in the morning, comp paper, let us late check out for no charge - No complaints, I would recomend the place no problem, I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for the location....”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyC12
Reviews.Content: ....But the accomodations are dated. Big, clean rooms, free internet, valet parking, decent lobby bar. We spent a night here to see a concert in the Big Smoke and the price was great for a $20 cab ride to and from the event. Check in was quick and the clerk gave some food recommendations that were not chains. The Valet staff was also helpful with recommendations for wandering around the city. Would stay again for a quick overnight visit

Reviews.Title: “Honest staff”
Reviews.Author: oosak
Reviews.Content: I stay at the court yard every time I go to Toronto. My love affair with this hotel began some time back. I am in Toronto 5-9 times per year on business. Some time ago I stayed at the hotel. When I got to the airport after checking out I realised I forgot my i-pod. U can imagine my panic! I telephoned the hotel right away and they said they would get back to me within 24 hours. When I returned home from the airport I had a message on my machine telling me they had it at the front desk. When I called they offered to send it to me via mail. They were honest and helpful, thanks Marriot!

Reviews.Title: “Still a great bargain”
Reviews.Author: WindsorTenor
Reviews.Content: Of course the location hasn't changed since my last trip, so it continues to be a reason for me to book here. A block away from the subway makes this hotel a great choice for easy movement around the city. The lobby has been "redone" and makes for a great first impression. Check in was both quick and pleasant. The room was clean and spacious with all the "normal" amenities to be expected. We prebooked and prepaid to get a good price which made check out even easier. Still my first choice for value and location while visiting downtown Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, once again.”
Reviews.Author: kvaruni
Reviews.Content: I have visited this hotel twice: once in May, 2010 and the last time in October, 2011. Both times I stayed for an extended period, just short over a week. Both times I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the accomodations and the service. First and foremost: it seems as if Marriott has tackled each and every gripe I had when I last visited the hotel. Nowadays the internet access is fast, you have easy means to print boarding passes and other stuff and the lobby has been opened up to reveal the restaurant more prominently and to highlight the newly added bar. If anything, the pool still needs a renovation, but I would be hard-pressed to find any other problems with this hotel. The remainder of this review will focus on the stay in October, 2011. I arrived quite late, but the room was not ready. The person at the check-in, Chris, was picky as to which room he would give me as I was there for an extended stay. I agreed to wait a few more hours so that he could get me in a nice and comfy room. He immediately started inquiring as to what I had planned that evening and helped figuring out ways in which he could make my evening more enjoyable. He suggested a few restaurants in the neighbourhood and I tried one of his selections. The restaurant itself was in a side street and would have been easy to miss, yet the food was more than excellent. After a few hours and after a very nice dinner I was back at the hotel and Chris was waiting for me. A few moments later and the room was all set up and I had the keys in my hand. Just as on my earlier visit, I was once again amazed at the size of the room. These rooms are huge and the beds are very comfortable. The sofa, TV, cabinets and bathroom may be a bit Spartan, but they are clean, easy to use and in good working order, so no complaints there. I slept like a baby each and every night and I am quite picky when it comes to noises and light falling into the room. The room attendants were very thoughful, the staff at the lobby was knowledgeable and very helpful and everything went as smoothly as it could have gone. Someone in my party was arriving late: no problem. She picked up the room key when she arrived and could come straight up to the room. We wanted to do some laundry: no problem. A complimentary laundromat is available and even the washing detergent was complimentary. We made a couple of phone calls fronm the room and these were neatly added to our final statement, which was slipped under the door the day we left, making check-out a breeze. Yet there was one thing that stood out. When I checked in, I mentioned to Chris at the lobby that my wife was having her birthday during our stay. I enquired whether there was anything special that they could do and he promised to look into it. And he certainly did! On the day of her birthday, we received a complimentary room service dessert along with a birthday card for my wife, signed by all the people working at the reception. Such a small gesture, yet my wife could hardly believe her eyes. I would once again like to thank Chris, as these small gestures are what makes the difference between good and great, and he certainly delivered and made things great! Such small gestures make Courtyard by Marriott a most wonderful place to visit and I am certain that I will be back. It speaks for itself that this hotel comes highly recommended. Not only is it in the middle of the fun in Toronto, the rooms prove to be wonderful time and again and the serivce and commodities have only gotten better over time!

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired but some nice touches”
Reviews.Author: LPNSW
Reviews.Content: The room was a bit tired, and the staff also, but this hotel is in a good position to downtown (and the University of Toronto). There were some nice touches-for example, free internet, free printing in the business centre, free guest laundry and starbucks on site. Unfortunately, we were situated with an ice machine at the front door, so we were plagued with people fillling ice buckets all night. The doors need to be sound proofed so it won't be a problem. We were also next to the lift, which was noisy all night. Again, sound proofing needed. The breakfast buffet was great, though, with lots of healthy choices along with the obligatorily over sugared, over salted North American fare. The weirdest thing was there was no fridge in the room, so we couldn't bring any doggy bags home or keep our water cold. (Thus the high use of ice I guess). Overall, a pleasant stay, though.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located”
Reviews.Author: Rhona123
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Toronto we spend our first 2 days in the Courtyard. We found the hotel very well located within easy reach of the main shopping area and the other tourist locations. But a word of warning. There were four in our party and we arrived shortly after 7pm so we checked in and freshened up and decided to go for dinner. After walking a short distance we went into the Hard Rock Cafe, after being seated, placing our order and then receiving our drinks I went to get my glasses out of my handbag which was at my feet, to discover that my bag had been opened and my purse taken (I knew imediately what had happened as I was aware of people sitting very close behind me and now they were gone without placing an order or being served). Both of our driving lincences and credit cards were taken along with a large sum of cash. The management were very helpful and assisted me in calling home to cancel our credit cards and call the police. Even though I had cancelled my cards within 15 mins of being stolen they had already been used in the Apple store in the Eaton Centre across from the restaurant to the value of Can$1,479. So be very careful and make use of the safety security boxes provided which lucklily we had put our passports and most of our cash in just as we left the hotel. If not we would have had nothing for the rest of our trip as this happened within an hour of landing in Toronto. Another thing to watch for is making international phone calls. I had to call Ireland to try and get copies of our driving licences so that we could still collect the car we had hired and lucklily they emailed us the documents we needed but when I asked the hotel about the cost they said we owed Can$160 for two calls to Ireland and a few local calls to the police and the Embassy. I spoke to a few managers about this and explained what had happened and apart from our circumstances I expressed my outrage at the fees as I could not see how they could justify those charges. After speaking to another manager they waived the full cost. Another footnote was when we went for breakfast the next morning across to McDonalds we had just gotten our food and sat down to eat when we were evacuated from the restaurant as there was a fire. We could not believe it as we had still not been in Toronto 24 hours and already we were robbed and evacuated because of fire. We think it was only smoke damage in the kitchen and as far as we know there was not much damage. But at this stage we thought things could only improve and indeed they did. We went on to have a great time in Canada. But be very careful with your valuables and documents.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LexiedogHouston
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here on a biz trip. The hotel is on Yonge St., just literally around the corner from the College subway station. From Pearson airport, it only cost $3 to take a bus to Kipling Station and then catch the subway from there. The hotel, while not luxurious, is very nice, with a huge lobby, efficient check-in personnel, free computers to use, onsite restaurant, etc. I did not eat the restaurant, as I like more local eateries, and I can generally find something better (and cheaper). It's also a handy location to catch buses, taxis, or trolleys in most any direction. There is also a nice (and large) movie theatre right around the corner. My room was large and although it faced Yonge, I heard absolutely no street noise. The location is the top point here; would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but poor service”
Reviews.Author: AKR78
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights. It's in a pretty good location and the rooms and facilities are quite good. However on the last night there, me and a friend were woken at half past three in the morning by a CO2 detector/alarm (like a fire alarm in noise) in our room. We had to get the maintenance guy to come and fix it and it was pretty disruptive to a good night's sleep. On checking out in the morning I mentioned this to the front desk (which has next to it a sign about their service promise) and was met with an indifferent 'sorry about that'. A sincere apology or some explanation of why they have presumably faulty alarms in their rooms would have been nice. It put a dampener on what would have otherwise been a good hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Sophie0811
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with ewxcellent staff. We requested a room on higher floor in South Tower, as we were aware that the evening could get noisy during La Nuit Blanche. Comfortable bed, spacious room, good fitness room. What I especially liked was that the pool was open from 6am until 11pm, fitness centre 24 hours/day. We got a very good value through Priceline. To have 2 computers with a printer for printing your boarding passes was an additional bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: BandBCuties
Reviews.Content: For a trip to Toronto where you plan on doing some sightseeing this would be a nice hotel to stay at. The location makes it walkable to many of the cities attractions. Also there are a handful of restaurants to eat at within the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and location, but awful night staff!”
Reviews.Author: Satella
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel to stay at, Checking in tho wasn't! Checked in at 6pm hoping it was not busy but it was busy loads of coach busses were coming in... CONS: Customer Service Staff weren't as friendly they were pouting as i was when they were overwhelmed with customers. As a customer i was upset due to the long waits and the no space whatsoever in the reception area. But if i was an employee i should be happy that business is booming. Not so friendly staff took my name and my request for a room with 2 beds. The Wifi is very laggy on the 14th floor South Tower! Try not to get room 1421 the washroom well toilet in paticular had problems all day and night long. Plumbing only came once to remedy the problem, but it came back. Night shift staff was very rude when requesting a late checkout he was more negotiating our late checkout times when i stayed here countless times late checkouts are 1:00pm not 12:15,12:30 or even 12:45 thats ridiculous night staff need to be trained more!!! At the end he did say okay with a rude nudge. Next day forward i awake to a big slam on the door followed by knocks, when opened to my disammay the cleaning lady requests that i leave immediately for her to clean my room it was 12:00pm.. I told her i requested for a late check out and there was a Do not Disturb sign placed on the door knob outside! Very rudely she told me to call Front Desk and let them configure it out. I called and Front Desk was more than happy to give me the late checkout and confirmed with House services this. I wasn't a happy camper!! Wifi internet very laggy! PROS: All in all okay service if you do not require late checkouts and don't interact with Night Shift Staff. Beds are very comfortable, Rooms are quite big and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: sabrinacat6
Reviews.Content: We stayed there two nights and the location was wonderful for shopping and close to several restauraunts. The room was nice, clean and large. We will stay there again. The breakfast bufftet was wonderful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for short holiday”
Reviews.Author: PickleyBear
Reviews.Content: An excellent base for seeing everything in Toronto. We stayed for a week while visiting family and booked via Thomas Cook. From the cheaper hotels this one was recommended by them and didn't disappoint. Good points: -Good value for money -Amazingly comfy beds- huge beds and really soft, bigger than any bed I've ever slept in. For a twin room I was expecting two single beds but they were queen size. -Helpful staff -Location 2 mins walk to subway, also walkable to the Harbour front, Queen's Park and other sights such as the Skydome, CN tower, Royal Ontario Museum etc we walked to all of these. -Excellent tour assistants organised an unforgetable trip for us to Niagara Falls- we were picked up from the hotel and the tour included an outstanding tour guide, wine tasting at a vineyard, maid of the mist boat trip, a massive buffet lunch and several other stops. -Walking distance or subway stops to the Gotransit buses- we got one out to Hamilton to visit family and it was very easy to do. -Cheap places to eat nearby- try the lebanese place just a minutes walk down Yonge street, it looks a little scruffy but if you want a cheap dinner without going to a restaurant then try this, serves falafel, chips, chicken kebabs etc. Bad points: -Next door left his plates in the corridor and they stayed there for a while -Perhaps in need of a little updating in North Tower but to be honest I'm being picky. Places I'd recommend you go to as a tourist- an icrecream parlour such as Marble Slab on Yonge Street you can literally have any topping ever, the Royal Ontario Museum, Niagara Falls day trip, CN tower, Skydome (aka Rogers Centre), Steam Whistle brewery, Toronto islands on the ferry. Or get out of Toronto on the Gotransit and go for a mountain walk with waterfalls in Hamilton or if you're brave enough look up the local buses and go to Black Creek Pioneer Village from Jane Street station- it takes about an hour on the public bus and locals say its only for school groups but i'm 23 and we had a great time there, it was really interesting and gets you out of the city a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Toronto Hotel on Yonge Street”
Reviews.Author: OnTraveler_8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on a September weekend. The hotel was clean and very comfortable. The bedding was typical of Marriot chain -- above average in quality. I spent quite a bit of time in my room working on a presentation and found the internet connection speed to be pretty good for a hotel. I also used their business center to print out the presentation (complimentary). On Sunday morning, I had breakfast at the counter service area in the lobby. It was quite good and represented fair value. Check-in was at 4 PM and I had phoned ahead to see if I could drop off my luggage early as I was arriving by train around noon. They said yes, but I was pleasantly surprised to find my room ready when I arrived shortly after noon. They also stored my luggage for me for a few hours after checkout. Very convenient. I tip my hat to them for their helpfulness. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard by Marriot, Toronto”
Reviews.Author: BernieHants
Reviews.Content: First class hotel, good service, clean, modern. Rooms well equipped. Stayed twice at same hotel, no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Good Hotel in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: MunnyMan
Reviews.Content: Convenient $30 a night parking whether self or valet. Located on Yonge Street (longest street in the world) about midway between Bloor and Dundas, with lots of fast foods, tattoo & piercing places, small ethnic restaurants...kind of a lower class part of downtown Yonge. Not the best area for upscale shopping or dining. McDonalds right across the street. Good area if you're visiting someone in hospitals nearby. We were on a Marriott elite bonus stay night up to a category 4 hotel but were upgraded to a luxury king which was a large room with lots of space but sparse furnishings. I heard the corner rooms were better, but we didn't get one. The view wasn't that great...hi rise condos and offices everywhere, like in NYC. The washroom facilities are tiny with a separate toilet/bathtub room and the smallest wash basin/closet area I've ever seen. They should have used some room space to give the bath facilities more room. Bed was fine although not the 'standard' Revive bedding luxury of Marriott hotels. They have a dining room and room service for dinner time only...very different from the 'normal' Courtyard. TV widescreen, but very small (32inches) for the room size. We watched a movie on it for $16...and ordered dinner room service ($65 for two) which was prompt and good. Local phone calls $1. Was a Best Western before Marriott, and before that it was the Westbury Hotel for many, many years which had the greatest piano bar in the city for years...no longer. Taxi station just outside the door.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Fun, not so good for Business”
Reviews.Author: chardecara
Reviews.Content: I've recently stayed here for 4 nights in Sep 2011. The location is great if you're looking for fun: several restaurants and bars on a walking distance or friendly cab fare. Just be aware Toronto's downtown is a very mixed zone and there are several gay friendly bars in the neighborhood. I enjoy diversity so I loved it but I'm aware not everyone thinks like me. The dowside for the location is if you're on Business and not in this area you might get a little Gardiner Expw dependant and its traffic jam on rush hours is not good at all. No good or bad surprises considering the hotel in overall

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special but great location”
Reviews.Author: Mimi1791
Reviews.Content: Nothing terrible but a general unfriendliness, room was probably not their best, no information was given about the hotel, neighborhood, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but needs some TLC”
Reviews.Author: flyboy55
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard is in a great location in downtown Toronto, but the rooms are showing their age and while Marriott has invested in a new, modern lobby, where do guests spend more time - the guest room or the lobby? It is time Marriott invested in renovating the rooms to make them inviting and fresh. Our room was stale smelling and very boring. Other than a newer plasma TV, the room was quite dated. The hotel gym, in the basement beside the pool, is surprisingly a decent size and well equipped with lots of cardio equipment and free weights, as well as some machines.

Reviews.Title: “Ok location, rooms severely need updating”
Reviews.Author: MaggieM94
Reviews.Content: I feel as though I was mislead by the hotel's website. Pictures of the updated lobby led me to believe that this hotel was recently updated...definitely not the case with the rooms! The location was a reasonable walking distance to Eaton and other popular destinations, but not as close to the Air Canada Center as I had hoped. Overall, I would not consider this a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Small but cosy”
Reviews.Author: Leanne M
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard Marriott on Yonge Street is in an excellent location with pretty much anything you need within a short walk. We were there during TIFF so it was pretty busy in the lobby, but the staff were moving quickly and very helpful. The view of Yonge Street was entertaining, excellent for people watching. We could also see the CN tower, which is really nice at night. The king size bed was comfortable and the room was nice and quiet, even if a little on the small side. The bathroom was split up with the toilet and tub on one side and then the sink and mirror on the other side by the closet. Different, but not really a big deal. Cleaning staff did a great job also. A mini fridge would have been appreciated though. The restaurant was closed the night we went to eat there, so we just ate in the Bistro which was actually pretty decent. The gentleman working there was lovely and there was a nice atmosphere. Overall a nice hotel in the heart of Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been extremely good...except....”
Reviews.Author: Chuck45
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite nice. It is clean and has friendly staff. The pool is a bit small (long and narrow, basically a lap pool), but we found it to be reasonable. The exercise room is very good. The decor and atmosphere of the hotel are quite nice as well. The bell staff are very helpful and polite. Unfortunately, the room air conditioning was very weak. On full blast, it keeps the room just a bit uncomfortable (too hot). And when we stayed in August, it was warm out but by no means as hot as it gets in Toronto. The ice machine was out of order on our floor (15th) for the entire week's stay. The newspaper was sometimes not deliverred to the room. They seemed to be on the conservative side with replacing bathroom tissue etc. The floor lamp did not work. A little more attention to detail (and maybe some feedback from the housekeepers to the management) would have improved this hotel enough to get a fantastic review. However, it only gets three out of five, because that is all it currently deserves.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: g0neaway
Reviews.Content: Great hotel if you're looking for somewhere close to stay to downtown. Rooms were clean and spacious. Free internet. Convenient breakfast in main lobby area. Within walking distance to subway and downtown shopping. Lots of restaurants close to hotel. Friendly staff. My husband and I stayed here from Wed- Sun. It was close to catch the subway to get to Rogers Centre and well within walking distance to Eaton Centre and lots of shopping and attractions. Would recommend this hotel and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: xavier16
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights during the last week of August. The service was excellent. We weren't able to check in early as we requested but it was fine. The hotel seems always packed but price was very reasonable considering its location. Parking is extra. I believe we paid $30 per night for valet parking. Very expensive indeed. The rooms were surprisingly very large considering this is a hotel in the middle of downtown. I expected rooms to be tiny (comparing it to hotels in New York.) but they were very spacious. There was free internet in the room and the signal was strong even though we were in a high floor. Rooms were nothing fancy but always kept clean and presentable. As mentioned in previous reviews, the sink is separated from the bathroom. It's located near the front door. It was a weird setup but it didn't bother us. I could not be happier with the location of the hotel. It's in Yonge Street, maybe an 8-10 minute walk from Eaton Centre. College Subway is like a block away and street cars run in Carlton street, which is a block from Marriott. Also, taxi cabs are available day and night outside the hotel. There are a lot of food options just outside the hotel, and there are more in Dundas Square/Easton Centre. There is also a 24 hour mini-grocery open very near the hotel. I felt very safe here, even walking very late at night. Toronto is a very clean and safe city. It is easy to get around because of the subway and streetcars. If I do come back, I will definitely stay at Courtyard Marriott. It was very good value for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: meg58
Reviews.Content: was not expecting much from this hotel but was pleasantly surprised. The buffet breakfast which was included with my room was amazing. Housekeeping staff were so friendly and did an excellent job on my room my whole stay. Only complaint was the lobby was always very busy and sometimes hard to get through with so many people checking in/out and milling about.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tomcat4
Reviews.Content: First stayed at this hotel in 2002 and have returned to it on almost every trip to Toronto in the last ten years. The front desk staff are always friendly and this trip was no exception. The hotel is close to everything I need and transportation is just steps away. The room is always clean and the hotel is overall very quite for a large building. If I have one complaint from this visit it was the excessive heat in the elevators â€¦it wasnâ€™t just me as everyone I road with in my four days usually passed a comment on it. I was in the south tower so I not sure if the same issue affected the north tower. This minor issue will not stop me from returning to an otherwise flawless establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly better than average”
Reviews.Author: BrianArabsky
Reviews.Content: After the rudest check-in ever, our business trip was off and running - (it seems that I was stupid in not knowing that they brought a fridge to your room!). All others in the hotel/coffee shop extremely friendly and helpful. It is nice and close to downtown and the rooms are nice and clean. The actual square footage is tiny, but makes up for it in location. Close to everything for downtown business. I was confused on booking as I thought breakfast was included, but was informed when I arrived that I had not booked that package. Maybe double check before booking as it was a nice spread. All in all not a bad place to stay if you avoid the night clerk from hell.

Reviews.Title: “Take it from a seasoned traveler - this is a great city hotel”
Reviews.Author: newjerseyfamily
Reviews.Content: We also stayed at this Marriott over the Labor Day weekend, and had a much different impression than the previous posts. We had a great stay. Having stayed at several downtown Toronto hotels over the past 10 years, this one has by far the largest room for a moderately priced hotel. The location is perfect. The only place to be is on Yonge and it makes getting to underground transportation or shopping easy. Toronto is best enjoyed parking the car and not seeing it again until you leave. Our room was quite clean. The bathroom is a little small, but the sink outside the bathroom is pretty handy. We had a difference in opinion on the mattresses - I found the beds fine. I certainly had no trouble sleeping and enjoyed the pillows of various firmness. My son can sleep anywhere. My husband didn't sleep as well as he felt the mattress was worn. TV was up-to-date, the view from our window quite nice, and our room was very quiet. The air conditioning could be better - it was barely cool and we had it turned to the max. We were greeted upon arrival with quick check in, and from a clerk who located a room away from the elevators for a quieter stay. The hotel is well equipped with a convenience store, a bar, a nicely designed area for internet access, an area to print out airline boarding passes, lots of couches for comfortable seating in the lobby, and a great restaurant for breakfast. The breakfast buffet is not included, and can be pricey ($20). If you are a AAA member, check out their deal with two free breakfasts per night. The front desk was very accomodating as we were a party of three. We received vouchers we could use in any combination we wanted on any day - so for us, staying 4 days, we enjoyed the buffet breakfast three of them (just paying for one breakfast) and ate out one morning nearby. The buffet is extensive, and you'll find everything from omlets made to order, waffles, eggs, bacon, sausage, all kinds of cereals, rolls, danish, fruit - I'm hungry just writing about it. You'll also find a Second Cup downstairs and a Tim Hortons nearby for other breakfast options. This was the first stay at any hotel where a fire alarm went off. This happened at 4:30 in the morning.
