At that hour, your trying to get your head together as to what to do. Luckily their alarm system did advise with a speaker in the room to stay where we were, and then let us know that all was clear. We did learn from a flight attendant that this can happen several times a month at this location. I cannot comment further on this, except to say that the alarm system does work. We would definitely stay here again. If your a family of three or more, you'll find the room size to be what you need in this city. Service was great from the staff. The location really can't be beat, and you'll love your stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Business Busy & Nice”
Reviews.Author: ripme2
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of action in downtown Toronto. Clean and inviting, with a friendly staff, from checkin to their restaurant and bar. Must try - their breakfast buffet, can be expensive @ $20/head but can be included in their room rate, especially if you are a AAA/CAA member. Have a great stay !

Reviews.Title: “No Third Chances”
Reviews.Author: TorontoJamaican
Reviews.Content: Mind you, Internet is free at this propety, and yes, the upgrades are nice, but service stinks. Imagine having your room being cleaned at 3pm everyday, right after you return from your meetings. Shouldn't this be done when you are not around. My towlels weren't changed, I had to request it. Naw, I don't think I will be returning to this property. For the price they charge, I think i'll go to the sheraton or the Ritz next.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great staff, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Malcky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights as part of a 7day Eastern Canada coach journey tour and it was as good as the other Marriotts we have stayed in. The rooms we had were on 7th floor for the 1st 2 nights which was nice and quiet and our last night was on the 2nd floor which was slightly noisy but did not cause us any major problems. The rooms were both identical with two queens beds in each and a separate bathroom, very spacious and lovely comfortable beds also with a new large widescreen TV. No mini fridge was provided which is always a nice thing to have but most hotels are doing away with this option but the free Wireless Internet which was excellent and was available in the room via a code which is easily available from the reception desk. We had breakfast in the hotel and this was excellent with lots of space, it had the same format as all the Marriott Hotel chain, lots of choices and availability of freshly made omelettes/eggs and waffles. We got to the hotel via a taxi from Toronto airport which had a set price of 55 dollars which we thought was reasonable as the bus was only slightly cheaper for 2 people and that would have dropped us off 2 blocks away, we also went back the same way by asking the reception to get us a taxi. Did go on the subway which was very easy to use. The hotel is situated on Yonge Street and in a good location for the subway 1 block away, Eaton shopping centre a 5 minute walk away and the CN tower was about a 20/25 minute walk as well. there was also a Sightseeing bus stop point right outside the hotel on the main street which was very convienent . The hotel was surrounded by such food chains such as Second Cup, Starbucks, Tim Hortons, Wendys and McDonalds. We ate at the the Irish pub and Franks in College Street and they were very good and also value for money, also ate in Swiss Chalet and Marche which is unusual but good for the family if they all want differnet things as the choice is varied and very good. We done the Yellow Sightseeing open top bus tour which includes a boat ride/tour of the harbour/islands and its great value for money as you can use it for a few days. We went on the afternoon free shopping coach shuttle to the Vaughan Mills shopping outlet centre, this is picked up from Union station in the morning or afternoon but it is preferrable to book tickets in advance. We booked our tickets in the morning then visited the CN Tower (5 minutes walk away) and then went on 13.00pm shuttle. Visited Chinatown, other attractions but our favorites was Casa Loma, CN Tower and the Distillery District.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dannypickett
Reviews.Content: I stayied in the Yonge Street Courtyard for approximately 10 days each month in 2010. The hotel is perfectly located, close to great, reasonably priced restaurants. A short 3 minute walk to the action on Church Street. And right on Yonge street, with all the great eateries. 10 minutes to walk to the Eaton Centre, and only 3 minutes walk to the subway. and streetcar line. My only complaint is that check in could get quite busy if a tour bus was arriving, but that is to be expected in this sort of location. I miss my trips to Toronto, and I will stay here again when I have the opportunity to return.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: castletown1
Reviews.Content: my husband, my daughter, and I went to Toronto, to see our son, who emigrated to Toronto in January of this year. So we decided to go and see him, Oh my God, if you want to go to Toronto stay in the Courtyard by marriott hotel the food is lovely, the staff are so helpful, and the rooms are nice, and clean, and the bed so comfortable, I will definitley be going to Toronto again as I loved it so much the people were so friendly and helpful, and I will stay in the courtyard by marriott. The courtyard provide free laundry room and washing powder for residents . only fault the pool too small

Reviews.Title: “Love it! Great location plus huge room!”
Reviews.Author: MichelleTravelsRev
Reviews.Content: Stay for 5 days and we (with my husband) enjoyed it very much Great location with lots of eating places. Public transportation is close by and there is a 24hrs supermarket down the road. The room was great as well. Clean, huge and very clean. Hotel staffs were really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A great location”
Reviews.Author: VincenViv
Reviews.Content: Right downtown. All forms of transportation within walking distance. Restaurants all nearby. Can't beat the friendly & helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “central location and great choice with kids”
Reviews.Author: Memmett
Reviews.Content: My husband and son (age 7) took a trip to Toronto during a major heat wave and stayed in this hotel. This hotel was recommended by a friend who also traveled with their children to Toronto. It was in a very convenient location to the sites and also near the metro and the Hippo tour. They were able to travel around without the car and that was nice in an unfamiliar city. They especially liked the hotel restaurant because they were so exhausted at the end of each day from the heat it was a relief to be able to eat right at the hotel. The rooms were clean and attractive and the price was very good when compared to other Toronto hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not so keen on some of the changes made”
Reviews.Author: UnicornUDIC
Reviews.Content: Stayed over a weekend. Used to love this hotel but they have made some changes and to be honest, in this case, not all change is for the good. Courtyards in general have been undergoing revamps across the brand and at other places I quite like the new media pods, not that they appear to be introducing them here. I noted on the web site that they have changed check in from 3.00 p.m. to 4.00 p.m. So I sat there like a good girl with my suitcase to wait out the hour until I could check in. I noticed other people arriving and checking in and as I am an Elite Memeber thought I'd ask if I could maybe wait with a cup of tea or something. Pleasant guy, concierge maybe, then told me that provided the room was ready I could check in immediately. It was, and I was grateful, but it might have been nice to have been approached to see if I needed anything. What they have changed is the layout of the ground floor. There used to be a really nice bar/casual dining restaurant that I think was called the Fireside Lounge or something like that. From what I could see that has now been changed to a conference room and the restaurant is tacked onto the back of the area used to serve breakfast. The bar is now part of the lobby. I was traveling with my spouse but have often stayed at this hotel when traveling alone and I would certainly not feel very comfortable using the bar the way it is set up now. The lighting in the restaurant feels much more harsh and though I love people watching, it was one of the things I liked about the Fireside Lounge/bar, sitting by the window and watching people walk by, in the new location which now faces directly on to Yonge Street I felt more like a goldfish in a bowl as the passers-by looked at us. I understand the logic, if you walk past a restaurant and can see people eating, you are more likely to go in and as hotel restaurants have a harder time than most restaurants to compete for non-resident trade it makes sense to use us guests as a kind of lure, but I can't say I liked it much. The service is still good, we recognised the waiter, but the menu seems to tave taken a bit of a dive. The crab cakes are no where near as good as those served at the Marriott Eaton Centre. My main course lamb shank was excellent but my husband's steak was not really rare, more medium rare, and, sorry guys, more than a bit on the tough side. The room was OK, I've been in bedtter rooms in that particular hotel but the bedding etc. was up to the usual Marriott standards though the (few) pillows were too soft and flattened out as soon as our heads hit them. The bathroom floor had stains on it, the towels were the bare minimum and a bit on the rough side. The TV didn't work. When turned on it looked like a computer reboot from the old DOS 3.1 days. We phoned down and they sent an engineer who announced we had the wrong remote and that the TV had not been configured correctly. He gave us another remote which meant we could at least change the TV channels but never could get the TV Guide to appear nor any of the other usual menu options. The air conditioning was really noisy and struggled to keep up with the humidity but last weekend was particularly uncomfortable as there was some very severe weather approaching so let's give them the benefit of the doubt on that one. If you like to swim/use the gym then ask for a room in the South Tower so that you don't have to look like a wally walking through the lobby in drippy swimwear. If in the South Tower you just take the elevator to the ground floor and turn away from the lobby to a small flight of stairs to the basement to get to the pool. The exercise room is great, no weight scales I think but that's probably a good thing. The pool is great for laps. The hot tub is HOT! The elevator doors appear to have been put on steroids. You push the button and then struggle to check all the lights to figure out which one is going to open and you had better be really quick at figuring out which one and get in there before the doors close because believe me, it's milliseconds and whap! doors are closed and you've missed it. As is standard at Marriott's of all brands the staff are the real stars of the hotel, pleasant, polite, charming. The location is excellent for shopping and the theatre district.

Reviews.Title: “Cost effective choice at Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: utkana
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our first stop in a 2 week business/holiday trip to North America. Compared with the other hotels we stayed in big cities, Courtyard by Marriott Toronto Downtown had the best service/cost rate. Check in was flawless and the staff were extremely polite (receptionist left the dest for each customer to show the way to elevators). The hotel is accesible by public transport and within reach of metro, one can save 50 CAD by taking the bus-metro connection from the airport (Which was what we did although we had a heavy luggage). It is also close to the main attractions of Toronto and a 30 minute walk will take you to the lake side. Check out was also smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, large, clean, modern hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Eastwend
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location in the centre of town but for me' as a serious shopper, could of been a few hundred yards nearer the main shopping mall!! Other than that the staff were very polite & helpful, the rooms and hotel clean and inviting and had a good atmosphere. We especially liked the choice of having a small shop were you could purchase snacks and coffee, a 'cafe' which was always open for a quick breakfast, lunch, snack or supper, as well as the main restaurant which served a larger buffet breakfast or evening meals.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: LynneKnowlts
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Marriott for several years now, on our day trips into Toronto. Overall, I have loved the improvements that they have made to their front lobby/ restaurant area. The staff are friendly, but sometimes overly rushed. The rooms are in need of upgrading next. The front desk staff are excellent. Hopefully room reno's start soon. I think it would add to the overall look and feel of the hotel, and then we will give it a try again. I like the added bonus of having free wifi in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice place to be in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Luiz_Sobrinho
Reviews.Content: I could not not point something bad about this hotel. Fair fee / night, great location, clean an rooms plenty of space. Whenever I go back to Toronto, probably I will stay here again. As usual it's not included Breakfast and it costed around $20,00/pp

Reviews.Title: “Bargain, Nice, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: mblevine
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard location is centrally located in downtown Toronto on Yonge Street, the main north-south thoroughfare. It's a convenient location in easy walking distance to many of Toronto's attractions and neighborhoods. The lobby area was recently renovated and like most Courtyards, provides more than sufficient numbers of computer terminals in the main floor areas as well as complementary wireless access. We found the rooms adequate but a bit dated. The fitness center and pool areas were great, with sufficient numbers of machines so that there was never a wait. All machines also feature TV screens, which are great for exercising. Some maintenance problems were noted, e.g., in one of the two elevators (for the north tower), pressing any one floor button would give you two stops. Annoying but not serious. All-in-all, a great place at a reasonable price, centrally located in one of the world's great cities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff , great location.”
Reviews.Author: abyssinia01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the first week of August after visiting Niagra falls. We used all the reviews from TA and a suggestion from a friend who lives in Toronto, based on our budget and location need. It was a wise choice indeed. Check in was quick with all the information we asked for. The room was clean and good size. Two separate bathroom areas ,one for hand wash and T.brushing, another for shower, not too common but ok. Location was great to walk around down town (CN tower Harbour front, Eaton center), we even took a walk to the Harbour front, a good challenge. There are multiple restaurants and fast food chains around the hotel. I'm a fequent coffee drinker, and Starbucks is all over the city corner. One block south on Yonge st. there is a shooping mall at ground level with grocery and a small dinner where between 5pm-7pm, they have a buy one get one free dinner offer. nothing fancy, but good for a budget traveler. The staff at the hotel are excellent and very helpful. Parking is across the street for $25 a day. I used a parking garage located one block north at Church st. for $ 8/12h. The location of the swimming pool in the basement with out a window or any other view is not that great. In general, this is a nice mid level Hotel with a five star staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad choice for downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Toekook
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay downtown Toronto, this is not a bad choice. Just a few blocks from Dunda, it is easy to access by car and has some nice restaurants. Not the newest edition around, but this will work if you just stay a few days. A tad too expensive for what you get, but the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Experience to forget”
Reviews.Author: jermaine80
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in downtown but in the evening the area is more like the Bronx. Homeless and drunks are the most frequently encountered. Despite the reservation was done 20 days before, the room was located at 3 floor , next to the ice machine and overlooking the engines of the a/c. We immediately asked for a change of room and we were told that there was only one left at the 2 ^ floor (hotel counts 17 floors and 550 rooms...), away from the ice machine but always with the engines of the a/c in front of the nose, dark and with an incredible smell of smoke (windows cannot be open...) We didn't have other choice and we have accepted. Moral of the tale: to sleep we have bought some earplugs and to breathe a fresher air I sprayed perfume all over the room. It is always unpleasant to give some negative judgments, but the state of the rooms doesn't leave possibility of best judgments.

Reviews.Title: “Average at Best...Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Zebra11
Reviews.Content: The hotel overall was just average. The rooms were clean, but the furnishings need to be updated. The breakfast buffet was ok and nothing special. We did have problems with the shower draining properly, and the problem was fixed promptly. The check-in and check-out process took at least 15 minutes each time. The staff was friendly, but the check-in person acted as if this was the first time that she checked somebody in. She did ask for help and after about 15 minutes, we were checked in. Checking out was another fiasco. Apparently, the two members of the staff who checked us in did not complete the transaction properly. As a result, the Assistant General Manger had to re-do the check-in process and then checked us out. Again, she was very pleasant. However, that process took at least 15 minutes to complete. Overall, the hotel was just ok. For the price, I expected better overall accommodations. I probably would not stay here again since I don't feel I got what I expected or what I paid for. Nice staff, not very proficient, and the hotel could use some updating.

Reviews.Title: “Needs refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: mspuzzles
Reviews.Content: Excellent position, good room size but 2 separate areas for bath (sink is outside shower and toilette area) a little disappointing for european !! Rooms need refurbishment but maybe it was only our room. The price is worth the place only because of the position close to underground station and shopping area

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vardaman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel twice while we were in Canada. The hotel is officially on Younge Street which is a bustling avenue, but the actual entryway is off of the busy street and on the side, which is quite serene. When we arrived they did not have a room with a King bed like we had reserved so they upgraded us to a Suite at no extra charge. Everything in the hotel is very clean and snazzy. All of the carpet seems brand new. They have a bar right near the front desk, a coffee shop and a nice waiting area with sofas and a flat screen TV. They have an exercise room and a pool as well. In the morning it isn't even necessary to pay for coffee from the chain coffee shop because there are pots of free coffee near the TV in the lobby, it's good too. The restaurant is good, at least the breakfast is, but it is twenty dollars for the buffet, so be forewarned. It can get loud on the weekend on one of the side streets for there is a gay theater that seems to be a fairly big draw.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible value”
Reviews.Author: stevefranco2219
Reviews.Content: For whatever reason there wasn't much available on-line at the reasonable prices I had been getting in the weeks prior for Toronto. In any case, needed a room downtown so figured a Marriott hotel would be a safe bet. Not so much. Yes, I know courtyard is the lower level of the chain but come-on!! The website is TOTALLY MISLEADING! Let's start with the lobby that was hot as heck, so hot in fact the girl checking me in looked like she needed an ambulance, so I will not hold her less than friendly attitude against her or the line that I waited in for 25min to check in b/c there were only 2 clerks on. Than the elevator gets stuck with 6 of us and there didn't seem to be any urgency to get us out! Onto the room -- nothing like the website. Dated scratched up furniture, stained carpet, bathroom shower had a broken shower-head that sprayed all over the floor. Called down to the front desk to be advised they had no other rooms available. Really? How about the people checking in? Where are they going? And are they too getting a room that looks like this? I was there for two nights, they never fixed my shower - called about it 3X. My internet connection never got working either - never got a call back about that. Ok, so maybe the worst part of my stay was the smashed window I got in the parking lot next to the hotel that I was told after isn't really part of the hotel, it just services the hotel (huh?) A smashed window for the change in my ashtray, crazy! I will say the valet guys were really nice about helping me clean up my car. Reported it to the police, made an insurance claim, hassle though. Police told me outside lots like these are targets for vagrants overnight. Yeah, I wasn't impressed with the near $200/night price I paid for this type of hotel and service considering I had stayed at other really decent hotels in the weeks prior for 1/2 the price. Yes, I get that it was a busy couple of days in Toronto and that's why I wound up here in the first place, but how can a hotel charging this type of rate not ramp up their staffing in advance ? If you do wind up staying here, MAKE SURE YOU DON'T GET A LOW FLOOR FACING THE STREET -- you will not sleep -- the traffic noise never dies. I bought ear plugs. NO JOKE. live n learn.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel ...great location & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bernieone
Reviews.Content: From the minute we drove up to the entrance and was greeted by the Valet parking person we knew we had chosen the right hotel. We had a AAA rate which included breakfast which was one of the best all inclusive breakfast deals anywhere. There is nothing missing on this breakfast buffet. Freshly cooked eggs the way you want them, bacon, waffles, many types of pastry & breads, pancakes,muffins and yes lots of fresh fruit, yogort & cereal, coffee,tea,juice & milk. Room was spacious and spotless. We had dinner in the Restaurant one night and the food was delicious plus our waiter Terry was excellent. Our granddaughter is on a glutin free diet and when she ordered and asked for no bread or wheat and would like extra lettuce he knew what the problem was. When he brought the buns to our table he had some warm special wheat free buns just for her. Her comment was He made me feel special not a problem. This is a older renovated hotel with many updates, excellent shower heads, good beds, nice carpeting, flat screen TV, wireless internet and nice furniture. Truly Marriott quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, and 'warm' service for a big chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: antibes
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights and was impressed from start to finish. I paid $137 a night including taxes using Otel.com This is a large chain hotel, and yet they manage to provide a personal and warm touch through the helpfulness of their staff. Check in was quick and easy, and i was given a late check out time for my last day free of charge due to my very late evening flight which i had mentioned on check-in. The check-in guy also gave excellent restaurant suggestions, (Donatello's on Elm Street was great) I asked for a quiet room, so i was given the top floor, and was even shown a floor diagram so i could pick my preferred location (so i could see where the elevators / ice machine was etc) I've never been given so much information and help chosing my room! There were 3 elevators, and i found them to be so quick, i hardly ever had to wait considering i was on the 17th floor. There was free wi-fi! How impressed i was with such a large, 'proper' chain hotel offering free wi-fi. Also there were 2 computers with free internet in the large reception / lounge area, as well as another 2 computers linked to a printer so people could check in online for their flights and print out boarding passes. I loved all these handy details. Also, on my last morning i'm sure i saw a free coffee / tea area in the reception / lounge that everyone was helping themselves too, i was in a rush so didn't have chance to investigate. All members of staff i dealt with were friendly and enthusiastic. The room itself was just huge, with 2 queen sized beds, a little sitting room area, and desk area. The bed was very comfortable. The a/c was incredibly effective, if a little noisy on full setting (it was 39 degree heat wave in Toronto) The bathroom was also split into 2 areas, so the bath/shower and toilet was in 1 room, then in a separate enclave area was the sink, this meant that one person could be using the toilet, whilst another was brushing their teeth or whatever, which again i thought was really handy. The location was 2 blocks from the subway, so i easily got there from the train station via the metro. It was a the top end of Downtown, so about 10 mins walk from the Eaton centre, so i thought a great location, though a little bit more eclectic and seedier than lower Downtown, a lot more dollar shops / tattoo shops / pizza takeaways etc, but i never felt uncomfortable. If you walked another 2 blocks north you got to the very upscale Yorkville area, so overall i thought the location on Yonge street was spot on. 2 stops on the tube and you were at the waterfront area. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to see Toronto, very nice hotel, and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: apapapa
Reviews.Content: Let's start from the great location: downtown, on Yonge str. and next to College subway allows you to move anywhere in Toronto very quickly by subway, bus or street-car.. Rooms: standard Courtyard, we had a big room on an upper floor with a great view of the high-rise buildings towards Bloor. Breakfast: a great selection, well prepared (but guys can you turn the a/c down, it is freezing in the morning) Room service: very, very quick and decently priced, but also there is a variety of fast-food round the corner. Hick-ups: the cleaning staff in our floor seemed overworked and a couple of times the rooms were not made-up before 5 or 6pm, but the ladies were courteous. The swimming pool has way too much chlorine, be sure to wash this out carefully

Reviews.Title: “They made us feel like we were home"”
Reviews.Author: Sunset2b
Reviews.Content: Everyone on the staff, from the Desk Clerks to the Bellmen to the Cafe Barristas made us feel special and seemed genuinely interested in our comfort. They provided advice on what to see, directions, coupons for dining discounts at restaurants within walking distance, and they even found my camera when I misplaced it. Excellent price for a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation, Still The Same Good Service”
Reviews.Author: brendastarlet
Reviews.Content: The hotel's lobby and restaurant have undergone a facelift. The check-in process seems much more efficient, and there are food and drink choices right off the main lobby now, making it much more convenient for late-arriving guests. The hotel staff remains accommodating. I visited during one of the hottest weeks of the summer, and the A/C worked perfectly. The valets are prompt, efficient and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: QF_Fan
Reviews.Content: Once you get past the crowds and traffic of Yonge St. and the constant buzz of activity in the lobby, this is actually a surprisingly quiet hotel. It's a well-run property -- clean and well-maintained, and run by a friendly staff. It's well located within downtown Toronto, being only a block away from the nearest subway line ($10 day passes are available from a pharmacy at College and Bay Sts.) It's also within a fairly easy 10-minute walk of the Eaton Centre and Queen's Park, and a 15-minute walk of Bloor St. or City Hall. The location might be less than ideal for those looking to be close to the Entertainment District (25-30 mins. on foot) or the CN Tower or the Rogers Centre (40 minutes on foot). It's also well connected to Toronto's Pearson Airport, as this is one of several downtown hotels served by the Airport Express shuttle service. Skip the pricey hotel breakfast and go to Cora's on Carlton St. instead, where you'll get just as much food for $5-$10 less per person. Hero Burgers is also worth a visit for lunch or dinner, as are the area's ethnic restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “good location and modern looking hotel”
Reviews.Author: kgreen12
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 3 nights with my husband and his friend, the hotel is in a good location close to malls and stores and resturants and within walking distance , we did have a car rental and parking was 25 bucks a night and it was across the street in a parkade with a really high slope drive way, the hotel was clean and professional rooms were clean and roomy and served its need , overall a good hotel int he middle of the city for a good rate compared to some high named hotels i would save my money and stay at a bargain hotel the courtyard as it is a marriott property and held up to marriott standards

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: lolalolitaCanada
Reviews.Content: This is a good business hotel, especially if you get the business plan. I stayed there for 2 nights and everything just seemed easy from the valet parking to the desk staff. If you need anything, ask Nabeel at reception. He is a good reference for the area. Valet parking is 30$, just 5$ more expensive than self-parking which you have to do across the street. And it takes them just 5-10 minutes to bring the car around in the morning. The rooms are fine and decently clean and the wi-fi is at a good speed. Breakfast in the morning at the buffet is plentiful. They even have someone to make you an omelette but he / she was often MIA during my stay. There is also a coffee-shop type of eatery right in the lobby of the hotel. There are 2 good Asian restos (Japanese and Thai) on the quiet side-street on the north side of the hotel and a whole slew of fast-food joints just a few seconds walk up and down Yonge. And most importantly, a Starbucks on the corner, across the street from an indoor mall. In general, downtown Toronto is a huge hassle. This hotel made it easier to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of all the action on Yonge Street”
Reviews.Author: PDS63
Reviews.Content: Freshly renovated, this is a great hotel in Downtown Toronto, right at the middle of all the action on Yonge Street. Spacious rooms, reasonable rates and great restaurant serving superb breakfast every morning. Rooms are nice, the ones at higher level have wonderful views of the downtown. The housekeeping staff can be a bit intrusive, so make sure you have the DND sign up if you do not want to be disturbed. The lobby is spacious and also has a bar to hang out with friends. The Market has a good supplies to day to day stuff one tends to forget to pack and also ready to eat stuff if you check in too late. Unfortunately, the restaurant shuts at 10pm, but there are many dining options right outside the hotel, including a wonderful Thai Diner right outside. Highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but services spoiled trip”
Reviews.Author: jjiam
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms for 2 nights. Rooms maintenance definitely need to be improved! 1st room TV did not worked even after numerous complaints and 2nd room toilet floor leaked for 2 days. Rooms were clean and nice. Location was convenient for walking around downtown. Consolation was management offer of free breakfast after much complaints.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Courtyards I've stayed. Definitely recommended!”
Reviews.Author: marqoos_pl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed two nights in Courtyard by Marriott Toronto Downtown during my short trip to Canada. I've chosen this hotel because of the convenient location and great price offered. I was not disappointed at all - more: I was really happy with that choice. Hotel is located few minutes walk from Downtown tourist spots and open-top sightseeing bus stops, so it's really good idea if you're visiting Toronto and have limited time. Gay Village is just steps away, so that was even better for me. There is parking nearby, but hotel has as well their own valet car park service (reasonable priced). I was quite amazed with the spacious lobby and speed of service. There were few members of staff and check-in process was quick and hassle-free. I loved, that all of them were professional, efficient and with natural smile. Our room was allocated as booked, with two comfortable Queen Beds. Room was quite large, absolutely clean and fresh. All amenities you may expect to have in 4* hotel to make your stay enjoyable and relaxing. Bathroom was bright, clean and some basic (good quality) toiletries were provided. Next time visiting Toronto I'm sure that would be my 1st choice again. I had really pleasant two nights in this hotel and definitely can recommend to my friends and clients (I'm a travel consultant).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dougaln13
Reviews.Content: I loved this place great location easy walk to subway. The rooms are very nice. Only bad thing the elevator was slow. Had to wait while because one or two were out of order. Close to the gay area just one block over. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravelxo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! We arrived and there were many staff members around and not just standing around but being busy and helping guests. The price was great we paid $120.00CND a night, our room was an average room clean and spacious! We called a couple days before and requested a fridge for medical reasons and was told it was no problem and no cost. We arrived at our room and there was no fridge I called down and got a apologie and the fridge was in our room within five mins. The only down fall we had was our toilet kept running until you wiggled the handle and the shower was far from great but I wasn't expeting the $300 four seasons I was expecting the courtyard and I was very pleased. The first day we were there I left a tip on the night stand, we returned and it was still there so everyday I needed to leave a note that said TIP! and I always returned to a cute "thank you :)", I was very happy to know that the maids were trustworthy. The day we left they let us keep our leggage with the bell hop till our train departed, when we picked up our luggage we waited a bit in the lobby before departing and there was tons of staff once agian not standing around but helping guests and giving guests waiting in the lobby lemonaid! Great hotel over all! Oh and if you need help getting anywhere or need help finding something the employees at the desk were more then willing to help!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: RitaEric
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at the Yonge Street, a perfect location to start sightseeing the city if you like walking. A lot of restaurant choices in walking distance. Service was perfect with some problems we had. Parking fee is quite expensive, but I guess it is normal in a city. Fitness facilities and computers in the lobby are availble. You can book trips at the hotel as well. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it used to be”
Reviews.Author: BandDW
Reviews.Content: I booked my aunt into the Courtyard Marriott for a few days to attend a wedding. While she has stayed here before, it was not nearly as nice as it once was. The lounge is gone and replaced with a bistro/bar in the hallway between the two towers. Very uncomfortable place to have a drink, and the prices are ridiculously high, so it is better to go elsewhere. If you want tea or coffee in anything other than a PAPER CUP, forget it. All you get here are paper cups and stir sticks. I also found the lobby very crowded with too much furniture, which makes entry a bit tricky. The rooms, while spacious, have very noisy air conditioners which make sleeping a bit difficult. Some of the staff is pleasant enough, but others are not. I have checked out the Holiday Inn across the street and that seems like a better option in the future/

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: tigon
Reviews.Content: My friend booked the hotel as we were looking for a place which is at the heart of the city. The location and the price were our priority and much to our delight, the hotel met our expectations. The hotel is right in the heart of downtown Toronto along Yonge St. It is close to everything which means to say that you have access to food and all other amenities 24 hours a day. The price was not bad either. I was told that because we booked early, we got a reasonably priced room rate. I think we paid $139CAD per night which is not bad considering the location. There was only one problem in an otherwise perfect hotel stay, we got locked from inside. The door malfunctioned and it took them more than 15 minutes to send someone to unlock the door from outside. It could have been acceptable if we were not running late for the theater. Anyway, I would still go back and use this hotel in the future when I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: echo218
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our trip to Toronto and overall we were pleased with the hotel. The only negative was that our room was not ready when we arrived after 4pm and after hours in the car that was not something we wanted to hear...we received a $20 restaurant credit for our troubles and the stay was trouble-free after that. The room was spacious, clean and the staff very helpful. The subway is near the hotel and it is easy to use. Attractions like Casa Loma., the Distillery District , CN Tower are a far walk so use mass transit. We ate at the restaurant in the hotel one night because we were to tired to go out and the food was good .

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved it and would recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: winnie1918
Reviews.Content: Having written my first every hotel review for the Hudson, New York (horrendous - don't do it!)! thought it only fair to write a little on the other hotels we stayed at during this holiday. Classy is the word I would use for the Courtyard Marriott - it just felt luxurious. Staff friendly. Basically can't fault it at all. Unfortunately, we only stopped one night, but if I was ever to go back to Toronto, would definately stay there again. Well situated - close to the Eaton shopping centre and the underground metro. Can not fault it at all.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will always stay here while in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Curtis329
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to everything. The staff are friendly. The rooms a large and very clean. It is very close to the Gay Village if you are interested in being close. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Nightmare..left me feeling ill”
Reviews.Author: eastytravel85
Reviews.Content: I should start by saying that I stay at this hotel every year. This year I booked the hotel July 2nd-3rd for one night so that my girlfriend and I could have a nice night in the city during pride celebrations. We do not live very far from downtown but opted to get a hotel for the night so we could enjoy ourselves and stay the night rather than drive. We were getting ready to leave for the night so we could avoid line ups when the nightmare began. We were the first ones in the elevator at which point 9 other adults and one child entered. Upon the elevator doors closing the elevator malfunctioned and the doors would not re-open. We re-counted to make sure we were not above capacity and confirmed that it said 12 persons and we were not above that. None of us were larger individuals, in fact several of us were under 140lbs. We contacted lobby staff through the emergency phone and received an unhelpful response. They did not seem to care and advised that they would be working on it. 40 minutes later and several rudely responded to phone calls they had not updated us on the situation. The elevator walls were dripping cause of the heat and all of us were soaked with sweat and I know my girlfriend and I were very light headed. 45 minutes from entering the elevator we were finally advised that they would be sending in an engineer from out of town and they did not know how long it would take. In fear to be stuck in this heat trap any longer we contacted the fire department. 50 minutes after entering this trap the fire department attended and we were set free from the elevator. I had a horrible head ache and felt sick. We spoke to management "Bruno B." about it who advised that it was our fault for having 11 adults and 1 child in the elevator when it said 12 persons capacity. I explained that we were therefore not at capacity at which point he became extremely rude. I also explained that I was the first person in and had no control over how many people came in after me. He advised that we shouldn't have put 12 people in since it says 12 people capacity. At this point I must admit I became very upset and told him then the elevator should say 9 or 10 people capacity. The result of this night... we were unable to go into any events cause now the line ups were too long..we were not re-funded any part of the evening..and we should have just taken a cab because it would've been cheaper and not as traumatizing. WILL NOT BE STAYING AT THIS HOTEL NEXT YEAR!

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: bjorn5555
Reviews.Content: They gave us a a "free" upgrade on our room and free breakfast. Didn't like downtown Toronto that well. The breakfast buffet was great. Normal price of $20. Fresh foods. great selection. We are Marriott rewards members. Parking was $30

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, just adequate”
Reviews.Author: heeler1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is adequate for business travel when in the area but I suspect there are many better options around for the frequent business traveller. The hotel is adequately appointed in the main spaces and, honestly, a little tired in the rooms. For the frequent business traveller looking for that little bit extra in comfort, this is a budget minded hotel and you should not expect more. On the plus side for this hotel, there is a very good gym on the lower floor of the South tower building. Equipment is modern, well kept and a decent variety. There are three treadmills and a couple of exercise bikes (all modern with TV's and a supply of earphones) and a couple of ellipticals so it can be busy in the early morning hours. There is a small area for weights and enough floor space for pushups and ab work. There are mats and more than one exercise ball. I did not use the pool or the change rooms. Staff were very friendly and accommodating, particularly at checkin. There is no shortage of taxis at the front of the hotel. Taxi to Eaton Centre was about 7 bucks and there are lots of transit options close by. Location seemed safe to walk in with lots of sidewalk activity so one never feels alone in a creepy area. Lots of local coffee shops. Location is good for some business interests in the area, but be aware there is a fire station on a very nearby corner. Downtown Toronto has a lot of fire calls and this station is no exception. Internet access, while free, was a bit of a hassle with an access code but a need to reenter the code at least daily and, in my experience, nearly every time I logged on to the net. This was variable and unpredictable. It seemed to not be linked to one's length of stay or any other sort of timing. Most frustrating was an internet crashout that required re login right in the middle of checking in on line for a crowded flight. Arrrgh. Beds are adequate but not outstanding by any means, linens are definitely on the budget side. Rooms are large enough but have a goofy arrangement of washrooms with "water closet and shower" on one side of the room and a sink and hair dryer on the other. This has benefits when travelling in pairs, but comes off as small and cheap looking. Bathroom linens have seen their best days and should be due for a refurb soon I think. Housekeeping was adequate but a little more attention to detail is definitely needed. My coffee pot was never washed out (not a big deal but just one of those things); on the first day of my stay a significant lack of in place linens (two towels and a face cloth in total). Fine for me as a single occupant, but would have been a call if there were two of us; it was back to normal on the next day without a request from me. Rooms are clean enough in the broad sense but they just don't feel sparkling somehow. My sink drained so slowly that it would be impossible not to notice while cleaning the sink, this should not require a guest request to be repaired. It would seem rooms should be sparkling since housekeeping trolleys were in the hallway virtually all hours of the day. The lobby has a small bar and cafe as well as the mandatory sundry shop. The food at the cafe was expensive and not great; selection was very limited. Much better to walk down to the grocery store a couple of blocks away, or hit one of the many fast food joints nearby. Hint, there is a terrific little Burrito place kitty corner from the hotel. Bar prices in the hotel lobby were 10 dollars a glass for mediocre wine and don't even think about a half litre at over 20 dollars. I did not eat in the hotel restaurant and it appeared that there was no room service but I did not try hard. Perhaps the most annoying thing is the in room air conditioner. One of those below the window jobbies with the controls on the unit (old school to be sure). It clunks and clangs and has a very loud fan. You think it's not doing much until you turn it off then you realize you must leave it on. The thing cycles on and off every 2-3 minutes: all day and all night. For best effect, the curtain above the thing had to be drawn back to allow air circulation that didn't simply go behind the sheers but you are still looking at an on off cycle every three minutes. Did I mention all night long.... I am an easy sleeper and seldom complain about sleep quality and that darn thing kept me awake virtually every night. I don't know about this hotel as a return stay, while I wasn't completely unhappy, I wasn't terribly impressed. Yet it seems busy. I'll be looking elsewhere for my next stay, I'm afraid.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a great location”
Reviews.Author: Othegraven
Reviews.Content: While this is not the most "crisp and cutting edge" hotel, it is clean, friendly and functional. The room was decent and bright. Being right on Yonge street, I skipped the rental car and just walked or used the subway (station is just 100m away). Also close to The Eaton Centre, Church St., and the University of Toronto. The breakfast Buffet was Excellent! I definitely recommend booking a package including breakfast, because you won't get a better value outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but below average room”
Reviews.Author: Tayva
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect for walking to the Eatons Centre or Yorkville and we felt safe. Check in was quick and pleasant. The rooms were below average in my opinion but probably acceptable for the price of a downtown hotel. Room was outdated, tired and worn. The toilet was clogged when we arrived, but housekeeping was quick to remedy. The bathroom floor had a huge hideous dark stain which made me walk around it even if it had been cleaned often. The thought of what caused the huge stain was not something I wanted to think about.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice Based on Location”
Reviews.Author: 1NicePerson
Reviews.Content: Once upon a time, Marriott introduced the Courtyard brand as being geared to business travelers. This hotel proves that is no longer the case. Although the guest information guide found in my room stated that both wired and wireless internet access was available, hotel staff advised that wired internet was disabled some time ago. While the wi-fi signal was decent, many company and government employees are required to use a wired LAN connection for reasons of security. As the buildings were already fully wired, the reasons for abandoning LAN access are hard to comprehend. Secondly there are NO IN-ROOM SAFES in this 475 room hotel. With laptop computers and the multitude of personal electronic devices travelers carry nowadays, lack of an in-room digital safe is a major drawback. Having to wait in line at the front desk to deposit and retrieve articles from the hotel safe is not an acceptable substitute. Otherwise, my room on the 14th floor South Tower was clean and comfortable. Very much standard Courtyard fare with dark green carpet and minimalist furnishings. The feeling generated is the opposite of cheerful . The view to the north overlooked the top of the shorter North Tower and was quite picturesque. Unfortunately plans are afoot to demolish the next block north on Yonge St however and construct two 58 story condominium towers, so enjoy the view while you can. With its proximity to The Village, the TTC College subway station and various other attractions, this large but lackluster hotel provides a good value for downtown Toronto. There are certainly better Marriott properties but the location of this Courtyard is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and satisfied”
Reviews.Author: global_footprinter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here cuz the location was perfect in downtown where we needed to go. The room was spacious and restaurant food was suprizingly good! The buffet breakfast was amazing too. I liked they had a pool even thuogh I didnt have chance to use it, as it seems to be rare in downtown hotels. The housekeeping service was ok; internet was slow (no wonder its free), but during our stay Waqar seemed to always be there & really helpful explaining and giving us tips around the city. Overall, good hotel and excellent food and friendly service

Reviews.Title: “Convenient downtown location”
Reviews.Author: steve-h132
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for a small group business meeting. The hotel was in a location convenient to the subway and short walk to most of downtown. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable; nice but not outstanding. We used one of the downstairs meeting rooms; the breakfast and lunch service food was very good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault it.”
Reviews.Author: keith47
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights before a tour of eastern cities, and 1 on our return. While a little away from the centre of town this is not a drawback. Only 2 blocks from the airport transfer bus stop at Delta/Chelsea hotel. A subway station is one block away ($10.00 ticket for 2 at weekends), and another block to Eaton shopping centre. CN Tower is 30 mins on foot and the rest of the attractions are near to it, including the ferry to the islands(another 10 mins) , not to be missed on a good day. This hotel has everything for the regular traveller, even cookies on the counter in the evenings. Breakfast consists of something of everything - do make your own waffles !

Reviews.Title: “second stay was not a charm”
Reviews.Author: nearnorthduo
Reviews.Content: This is the secon time in a year that I have stayed at this Mariott hotel. Last time it was under lobby renovation . this time the lobby looked nice but it was down hill from there. The first room was musty... air freshener is not a solution! Second room a bit better. Room service on each visit was TERRIBLE. Previous visit I found myself eating bits of the serving dish that were crumbling-Yuck!. This time round, pastry on the pot pie was not cooked and the dessert wasdisappointing. Further, the documents sent to the business office printer could not be printed due to an error code that no one seemed to know what to do with. The kind caretaker called in tried his best but it was very clear that this is not his area of expertise. I am glad that the documents were not sensitive... No one was able to cancel the print jobs either.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location; Great service”
Reviews.Author: Zann11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night and got an excellent deal with Expedia. I wasn't sure what to expect but was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the hotel amenities, the size of the room (bigger than most in Toronto) and the cleanliness. I've stayed in many downtown Toronto hotels and this is one I highly recommend. Location is great. Walking distance to everywhere, tons of food options within all price ranges. We were also pleased with the nice hotel bar/eatery, and quick and easy spot to grab something on the go before your day starts. One complaint only...the bed was not comfortable. Too hard for my liking. Also, not fond of the feather pillows and there were no other non-feather options in the room to grab. That was disappointing. Overall a great stay though.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ajoto57
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights in this hotel during our sight-seeing mini-vacation. We happened to stay during a busy week (lots of conferences going on in the meeting rooms), but the staff were unfailingly pleasant and attentive. We arrived sooner than expected, and they allowed us to check in hours early without notice, all with a smile. The lobby is very clean and attractive, and the little perks like free newspapers, free printing (of last-minute online ticket purchases) and free coffee were a nice, welcoming touch. Our room was also well-kept and had a fantastic view, the bed was comfy, and the shower water pressure was fantastic (something I look for in any hotel room). The location of the hotel cannot be beat. The weather happened to be beautiful so we took advantage of the attractions that are within walking distance. A large variety of restaurants and cafes are just steps away, and public transpo is also very close by. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay and have no complaints. We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not quite the luxury conveyed on the website”
Reviews.Author: cargoodrich
Reviews.Content: I'd first like to say that this was a pleasant hotel for my wife and I to stay at in the end, and the staff were incredibly polite and helpful and ensured we were happy with our stay in the end. We stayed here for two nights towards the end of our honeymoon and unfortunately, this hotel fell short of the luxury were hoping for. The hotel complex and the lobby looked nice enough, however we were terribly disappointed when we opened the door to our room. It was very very basic, the bathroom was one of the smallest bathrooms we'd ever experienced, and the room was of a "budget" standard rather than "luxury". The most disappointing part of our room was the view, which for us was something we were really looking forward to. For our honeymoon we'd specifically requested a high up room so we could take in the view of the city and hopefully capture a view of the CN Tower - not so. Our supposed "King Size Balcony with City View" room was a view from the back of the hotel building looking onto a block of shabby apartments that shielded 95% of any city view we may have received. My wife and I just sat and were gutted. As an experienced web developer, I realised that the image of a "King Guest Room" on the website was/is somewhat photoshopped to make it look a lot nicer than it actually is. The website only provides one image of a King Guest Room. My advice to anyone looking to stay here is to consider the likelihood that this image may not convey exactly what you will get. For us, the selling point of the hotel was the beautiful city view that is conveyed in that image - you will only get the lovely city view if the hotel staff place you in one of the highest rooms, provided of course you are in a room that is not facing towards some shabby apartments behind the hotel! Fortunately, the staff were incredibly helpful and one of the senior staff after hearing my sheer disappointment, kindly sought to find me a room more to our liking. I was shown three alternative rooms before finding one that I was satisfied with. The room and view we were eventually given was closer to what was shown on the website, however the view was still below what we expected - our view included McDonalds! Don't get me wrong, this hotel is not bad and the staff will do what they can to ensure you are happy with your stay. If you are on a tight budget, then you'll be happy with this. But for a 'Marriott' - we expected a lot more. If you're looking for a luxury stay in the city, you may want to consider other options. My advice to the hotel would be to arrange for a broader collection of photos on the website, particularly of the rooms. After seeing four different rooms, the difference between them are a lot considering they are all meant to be similar in specification. The website needs to show the variety of rooms as they are (i.e. without photoshopped lighting effects) so at least customers know what to expect. There should be an option for customers to be informed of exactly what view they are receiving upon booking, with an option to upgrade to guarantee a clearer view of the city landscape or for a higher up room.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location - it's got it.”
Reviews.Author: abgwin
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting Toronto and want to stay downtown, you have a lot of choices. The Four Seasons, the Fairmont Royal York, InterContinental - there's many. But they are expensive. Even the mainstream hotels like Marriott or Hilton can be pricey, especially if there's an event (and there usually is, outside of winter). That's where the Courtyard Downtown comes in. It's huge, by Courtyard standards - 17 floors. It feels like a recent remodel, but still suffers from a few problems like inadequate air conditioners and elevators that break down a little too often. But the rooms themselves are well sized, often with nice views, and you can walk to a ton of restaurants in the immediate area. And walking is your best option, since it's valet parking at $30 a night. The upside of that is that the valets are usually very quick, extremely nice and don't seem to expect tips (they always seemed surprised and grateful when I'd slip them even a twoony). That brings up to this hotel's secret weapon - their staff. Consistently pleasant, rarely anything but efficient, they really do seem to care. And that's tough, considering the volume of customers they deal with. If they could just replace the air conditioners, update the mattresses and room linens, they'd get five stars from me. Otherwise, they'll still remain on my shortlist, especially when I'm in town on personal time. P.S. If your destination is Church Street, this is your hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “It is ok but researched better value.”
Reviews.Author: africanblend
Reviews.Content: The location is great , service / value / price. Are average. Could be better priced or more services inclusive .

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: andrealantz
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Sunday, before Victoria Day monday. There was a line for checkin as it seems a guest had a problem. When I got seen, I was given the room cards, and he said "have a nice day.... next in line." I had to ask about parking, and he directed me to valet and said "I don't handle the parking." Okay. So out to the valet, we wanted to self park, so they directed us across the street to a public parkade. It was $12 for more than enough time to park, which was much better than the $30 valet fee. The garage is locked at 11pm though, so make sure you don't need your car at night! We were on the fourth floor. Room 406 - right at the end of the hall. Large window kept the room bright. Regular amenities, and the bed was comfortable. There are several restaurants in the area, and it's a 10 minute walk to Yonge/Dundas Sq, Eaton's Centre, and other shopping. It's also very close to the College Street subway station, but no need to take it to go shopping, as the walk was so short! The pool was very small. There were already 4 guests in it, and we didn't go in for long, we felt a little crowded. Lovely fitness room, and large hot tub though. On Monday, after check out, we were going to have lunch in the hotel restaurant, but we waited for about 5 minutes, and no one seated us. Several staff looked over, but no one came, so we left and went elsewhere. It looked like they had a great business centre. 4 computers, and a computer dedicated to boarding pass printing. Never had the opportunity to use them, but they must be great as it was very busy. Overall a nice hotel, would stay again for the location, but wished the service was better.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: David_Lawyer
Reviews.Content: Great location (dundas / younge) other then that, pretty decent hotel, breakfast buffett was good downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location To Explore Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Eneeray
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the absolute perfect location to see downtown Toronto. You can walk to so many places to eat and shop it's ridiculous. The subway is steps away which can take you to all the ethnic towns, which are a must see. There is also bus service and trolley service. Best of all each service transfers between each other. (People from the States, you can take your dog on the bus!) There is also a large amusement park that is accessible on the bus. We visited it and found it to be quite enjoyable. The hotel was clean and comfortable. The staff was accommodating when I wanted to extend my stay another day. Housekeeping was prompt yet unobtrusive. My sole complaint was that the television was confusing. We had to have someone up to assist and I work for a cable company so I can't imagine how it would flummox someone who wasn't "in the business". To sum up, Toronto was wonderful. It was the melting pot that the USA claims to be. There were so many things to do, from the amusement park to the museum. I highly recommend seeing it from this hotel because the first time I came I tried to save money and stay in Mississauga and that was horrible. Spend the extra money to stay at the Courtyard and actually BE in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for your weekend stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: sdali718
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this weekend, infact this review is being composed in the lobby. I was a bit sceptical considering some of the reviews on here but was pleasantly surprised. I would have no problem recommending this location to anyone for a weekend or even a weeks stay in Toronto. The location is perfectly placed for access to attractions with everything you need within walking distance. Parking is steep, as it is in all of Toronto, so think twice about needing a car. You really do not need one.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: k8ski
Reviews.Content: Easy check in, room was simple and comfortable enough. Close to shops and subway station. Finished up having their buffet type breakfast and it was very good! Will stay again ;)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with (paid) parking facility”
Reviews.Author: Ezechias
Reviews.Content: Hotel is near major shopping malls. $25 daily (24hr) self parking aside hotel, easily accessible. Check-in was quick, 3 mins; as I booked my room online. Only 1 lift was working on 4 available but did not cause us trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review. Accessible room warning but great location/staff.”
Reviews.Author: OttawaOscar
Reviews.Content: Right up front, in most cases this review is not for the vast majority of travelers out there. The review is based on our experience as travelers requiring a wheelchair accessible room. We spent three nights at this hotel and struggled with rating it from 2 to 5 stars. To be fair, it has some very positive attributes and a few (for us) significant shortcomings. Pros: -staff are genuinely friendly, helpful and knowledgeable; -very clean; -valet parking guys were impeccable when it came to speed of service and vehicle care; -the location canâ€™t be beat for dining, shopping and entertainment; -did we mention the staff and location, +++ Cons: -beds (mattresses) are a bit past prime; -dÃ©cor beyond the lobby is dated (carpet from 80â€™s) and hallways narrow; -ice and vending machines on each floor are exposed to the hallway; -ice machines on the three floors we checked were from the same era as the carpets and make a hell of a racket; -all wheelchair accessible rooms (floor number + 10, ex. 310) are located right beside the ice machines. After spending five minutes in our accessible room beside an ice machine, we switched to a non-accessible room. Time spent in the non-accessible room was a bit of a challenge, not what we expected or paid for, but we got by and enjoyed our stay. Bottom line, if you absolutely require an accessible room and are hard of hearing, go for it, itâ€™s a nice spot. If not, you may want to try another hotel in the area. If you donâ€™t require an accessible room and arenâ€™t hard of hearing, you might want to avoid rooms near the ice machines (floor number + 01; 03; 11, ex. 301;303;311). FWIW, we this review helps.

Reviews.Title: “Some Good, Some bad, overall just ok...”
Reviews.Author: janeausten168
Reviews.Content: I booked a King room for one night for my partner's birthday. I booked with my CAA membership card which allowed us a lower rate as well as buffet breakfast for two the next morning. First of all when booking the room I called the 1-800 number for reservations. The man I spoke with on the phone was very bored sounding and seemed like he didn't want to answer the few questions that I had. He then continually got information wrong that I repeated for him several times. My name is a fairly generic name that quite a few people have and he mispelled this three times as well as asked me to repeat my email address for confirmation three times and still got that wrong as well. I ended up having to call back twice to before the trip even started to fix reservation mistakes he had made. At this point I was getting a little worried about check in running smoothly. Check-in was actually a good experience. The front desk was very helpful and speedy despite it being quite busy in the lobby. There was also fresh fruit for the taking if you so choose. The lobby and first impression was also very nice and I was feeling like we had made a good decision in choosing this hotel. Also we choose self parking which is in a parking garage across the street. Easy to locate and we did not have any issues, however do remember to register your plate so as not to be charged by the ppl running the parking garage as it is not just the hotel. The room was ok, nothing special. It was very clean and was roomy. It was simple and standard budget hotel. This was fine as we choose the hotel for the location not for any fancy decor or amenities. The location was indeed very good! College stop on the ttc subway line is literally two minute walk from hotel and Eaton Centre, Dundas Square was a few blocks away as well. We took a cab from the Hockey Hall of Fame back to hotel and was only $8 so it was very convenient location. We also took advantage of the pool and hot tub. The pool is a somewhat small pool-typical lap pool. I believe the hours were 6am-11pm and the fitness room was open 24hours. Breakfast was a little dissapointing. It is in fact a buffet or you can order off of a menu. There is plenty of fruit, cereal, oatmeal, ham, bacon, sausage, home fries, etc as well as serve yourself waffle maker and also omlette station with chef. Our waiter never cleared our plates, we had to ask for drinks and barely saw him. The few times we did see him there was no smile or welcome or conversation. The chef for the omelette station dissapeared a lot and we had to hunt to find somebody to ask for syrup, etc as many things were empty. The food was just ok as well. It satisfied our needs but would definitely not have paid full price for it. Upon checking out beware of checking over your bill. We were charged for both valet service as well as self parking even though we were only there one night with one car and most definitely did not use both. The front desk was very quick to take the charge off when I brought it to their attention however. Check-out is at 12pm and you can leave your car parked there until 5pm. Overall it was an ok experience with a great location. If I was to book again I would stay at the Delta Chelsea which is quite close (you can see it upon heading to the Courtyard on Yonge st.) and as have stayed there before found it to be much superior with same good location. This was not bad for one night but would not have wanted to stay longer than that.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: vandycuse99
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this Courtyard about eight years ago and thought it needed some work then, so I had a bit of anxiety when I booked this hotel (I booked it based mostly on cost and location). I was very pleasantly surprised to see a very bright and updated lobby, with staff all over the place willing to help or answer a question. The valet was very easy and helpful (they do offer IN/OUT, which I wasn't sure about before we got there). We had a room with two queen beds, and were very surprised at how big the room actually was. One note: the layout of the hotel is a bit different. There are two towers of rooms, with the elevators in the middle of each tower. This leads to a "different" configuration of the floor, and some of the rooms. My father-in-law was at the other end fo the hall, in a king room. While Courtyard's usually have the detatched sink outside the bathroom, his were totally separated on opposite sides of a wall. The hotel is very close to the College subway station, and for small families, though it's never a dining goal for most, there are a variety of fast food joints nearby in case you need to satisfy picky, younger eaters or are tryng to maintain a bit of a budget.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: skimama74
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights here with my two teenage daughters. The area is great, the hotel was clean and comfortable and the rates were outstanding. We got a room with 2 doubles for $119 including a full buffet breakfast that includes just about everything you can imagine. Of course parking and taxes add some to the bill, but that is to be expected in a major metropolitan area. We used the pool and workout area and were pleased with both. I'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Tattered and worn... A budget hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: The_Budges
Reviews.Content: As my title states, the hotel is best described as a comfortable budget hotel, in a great location, moments from the shopping and theater district, right in the heart of downtown Toronto. If you are looking for a simple place to lay your head at night, this hotel might be worth looking into. We choose this hospital for its proximity to St. Michaelâ€™s hospital, a family member was undergoing a serious procedure, and being from out of town we wanted to stay somewhere close by. For the rate of $130 per night which included an amazing hot breakfast buffet (absolutely recommend the breakfast buffet, with the fresh baked croissants and made to order omelets) and complementary coffee/tea station, we were more then satisfied with our stay, however a few niggles are worthy of mention. Elevator issuesâ€¦ During our five day stay, the elevator (s) were continuously out of service, as one member of our party suffers from COPD, taking the stairs were not always an option, thankfully they allowed guests to use the service elevator. To be fair, I should mention we were compensated for the inconvenience by having our $30 per day Valet Parking charge removed from our final bill. Housekeepingâ€¦ Twice during the five day stay, we arrived back from the hospital to find our room had not been cleaned, completely missed by the house cleaning staff. After a very long day at the hospital, I truly didnâ€™t appreciate having to call down to the front desk to request our room to be cleaned, and to be honest, I was not impressed with the level of cleanliness when they did arrive, things like rinsing the glasses with cold water instead of replacing them with new clean glasses bothered me. Maintenance/Overall General Conditionâ€¦ Okay, so something that doesnâ€™t often bother me but worth notingâ€¦ The actual maintenance of the hotel needs to be ramped up. We actually had large areas of peeling paint on both the bathroom and bedroom ceilings, the carpets were worn, the drapery dirty, and in our opinion, the beds were very old, springy and quite uncomfortable. Although the front lobby was quite nice with a real urban chic feel, the actual rooms themselves and hotel walkways, felt more â€œghettoâ€�, then anything else. This is nothing that a bit of plaster, paint and a real good clean-up couldnâ€™t fix which is why I found it a bit frustrating. Pool/Work out roomâ€¦ Very, very small pool, which was overlooked by those using the gym. We were not at this hotel for entertainment purposes, however in hindsight, it would have been nice to jump into the pool and/or hot tub to relax for an hour or so in the evening, however, this pool area was not conducive to a spa/zen type experience, for that matter, the pool is so small I canâ€™t see it adding any work-out value either. Again, for the price point, we were happy with our stay, it served our purpose, and we really, really appreciated the HUGE breakfast (bacon, sausages, potatoes, eggs, waffles, fresh baked goods, fruit, cereal, yogurts), and complementary coffee each morning, and when faced with an issue (non working elevators), the front desk staff, did do their best to assist us. I would rate this hotel as a 3 star establishment with the ability to be so much more. All this hotel really needs is a more regimented maintenance program, room updates and maybe a new pool retrofit. I would consider coming back for a repeat visit. The Budges

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, amazing breakfast, perfect for a stay in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: bobomejor
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Toronto. Sadly, it was only for one night, but I got to visit a good friend and enjoy a lovely walk around the city in the evening. My friend recommended this hotel for its excellent location and service. She wasn't kidding. This hotel was really nice and comfortable. A few things you should know about this hotel: -- The room was comfy, had a nice a nice HDTV and plenty of space. The bed was comfortable and the space was quiet. All good things. -- My AAA rate included breakfast in the hotel's Yonge St. Grille. A server brought us beverages, and the buffet included quiche, eggs, made-to-order omelets, ham, bacon, sausage, yogurt, pastries, fresh fruit, several varieties of milk cartons, cereal, bagels, artisan breads, etc. I was really impressed. I only wished I could have eaten there more than one day. -- Complimentary Wi-Fi was somewhat slow in the room, but not terrible. I just plugged in via the included ethernet cord. It was fine for my needs. -- The hotel has two computers and a printer just off the lobby dedicated to printing out boarding passes (it actually says "BOARDING PASSES" in big silver letters on the wall above the computers). I used it to print some Google Maps... same difference. It was fast, free and awesome. Such a nice touch! -- Parking is $30 for full valet and $25 for self-parking. BUT... the hotel does NOT offer IN and OUT privileges. Bear that in mind when you park your car. The self-parking lot is right across the street (well, almost... it's across the street and down a few feet), so it's super convenient if you want quick access to your car. But, it's only open from 6 a.m.-11 p.m. So, be sure you won't need to take off between 11 p.m.-6 a.m. because your car is not accessible. It worked fine for me because I didn't need my car until 10 a.m. the next morning. -- There are complimentary, pre-packaged Otis Spunkmeyer cookies for the taking at the check-in desk. Yum! -- The location is great, within walking distance of so many restaurants, shops and public transportation. Toronto feels very safe in those surroundings and I enjoyed walking around getting to know the city. Bottom line: This is a great hotel in a fantastic city. Make sure you have breakfast in the restaurant at least once. It's that good.

Reviews.Title: “Heating problems, but still good for business travel.”
Reviews.Author: Flight_Planners
Reviews.Content: Besides the heating problem in my room - I just did not heat - it was ok. Wi-Fi internet was fast and efficient. The lobby is average but they are actually doing major renovations. The hotel location is practival if you arrive by train (10$ taxi).

Reviews.Title: “Love the location”
Reviews.Author: matsMontreal
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel, very good location, near subway station, restaurants, museum, shopping, everything is close and easy access. The staff was very friendly, everybody, the front desk, security, cleaning lady. The room are kind of old, they got new acl tv but that's it. The bed were ok, nothing special. The sink is not in the bathroom, kind of weird but it didn't bother us. The room was clean. The good feature about this hotel is the location and the price for Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel did not honour my guaranteed reservation for Queen Beds.”
Reviews.Author: Flybye61
Reviews.Content: Courtyard by Mariott Toronto Downtown did not give me what Iasked for which was 2 Queen Beds. They sold out of this room and gave me 1 King Bed instead with a roll away bed.. This is not acceptible when Travelovcity is advertising it and you book and pay for it on the spot. You should make sure your Hotels honour the booking including Beds.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money...great location”
Reviews.Author: suresh_2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on my second trip to Toronto in Jan 2011. The hotel is under renovation, so there was some activity ( and the smell of wet paint) going on. That being said, the lobby and the north tower were very clean and were not under renovation. The hotel was great value for money. The very happening Dundas Square and Eaton Center Mall are just 10 minutes walk from the hotel, and so is the subway station. Couple of discomforts - (i) there was some amount of lint flying around from the mattress and comforter - gave me a bit of an allergy (ii) although the hotel faces Yonge Street, the entrance is on a parallel road, so you have to walk around the block each time to enter the hotel.
