(iii) no complimentary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, will be back !!”
Reviews.Author: nowecantbringthedog
Reviews.Content: We were here for a Raptor - Bulls basketball game at the Air Canada Centre mid week. We got to check in early and the room I had requested was ready even though the hotel was fully booked the night before. Great job cleaning staff !! The room was very nice and the price was excellent. We come to Toronto fairly often and have stayed at the "best" hotels in the city, but their rates have gone through the roof. Our room was comfortable and clean with a nice flat screen TV with plenty of channels. You are right on the Yonge St. strip, but it was surprisingly quiet. The staff were pleasant on our arrival and departure. The only negative was that the water pressure in the shower was very low. It was like standing in a trickle. This is something that needs to be taken care of as I have read other reviewers comment on this also. You are close to Bloor St. with it's museums and upscale shops, Yorkville, and the Eatons Centre. If the weather is not the greatest, you can walk underground from the Eatons Centre right down to Front St. at the foot of Yonge with very nice shops and restaurants all the way along. I'm not sure that many visitors know about this. It's a very nice and safe way to get to Union Station, the ACC, the CN Tower and the Rogers Centre (Skydome). In a nutshell, I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mntscott
Reviews.Content: for business or a night on the town in TO. It's a typical Marriott and that's why I chose it. No surprises and I get my points too. Buffet breakfast is convenient when you are heading out to a meeting and don't want to take time for a leisurely one. I have spent a lot of time in Toronto over the years and this hotel and it's location are perfect for me for getting around without a car. (Parking is expensive).

Reviews.Title: “All good except the gouging for using the phone”
Reviews.Author: DuncanFM
Reviews.Content: Location was great, room was fine, staff were friendly, but what sticks in my craw was ther fact I was charged $32 for makiing one long distance call to New Brunswick. What is that, a 1200% markup? I was told by the person staffing the reception desk that it is based on a "complicated formula" and that he advises customers to use a calling card, information that would have been helpful had I received it earlier. For that matter I could have used my cell phone, so caveat emptor - don't assume the hotel charge for using their room phones for LD calls will be reasonable,at least not at this hotel. The guy at the desk told me one traveller was hit with a charge of over $600.

Reviews.Title: “dont take a room by the elevator”
Reviews.Author: johnnycalgary
Reviews.Content: - good location on Yonge st - we prepaid 3 months before the trip and were given a room right by the elevator, had a pretty bad sleep on that night with partyers coming in and out, shouting in the hallway -otherwise its OK

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service made the positives unmemorable”
Reviews.Author: Marnii
Reviews.Content: An average Marriot, there was nothing really special. The rooms were nice and clean, comfortable stay, nice property, great location. However one bad experience basically was all that was left in my memory of this hotel. My boyfriend's parents were in town staying at the Courtyard for New Years. We all went out for dinner and agreed to meet up at Nathan Phillips Square for the new years celebrations. However, we couldn't get a hold of them via cellphone and after celebrating decided to walk back to the hotel to find his parents. Upon arriving at the hotel we were told by a security guard at the elevator that he could not let us up to the room without a stamp and that we must go to the front desk to get one. These stamps were apparently a New Years policy that the hotel has. Upon check-in the person who made the reservation must register all guests staying in the room, and if you were not registered you could not go back up to your room. His father was not informed of this policy upon checkin, nor were we informed on the way out to dinner. My boyfriend had a room key, had photo ID with the last name of the registered guest (his father) and explained that we were going up to the room to wait for his parents. The unhelpful concierge told us that we should call up to the room to see if the guest was there. After calling with no answer, the concierge told us there was nothing he could do and that we would just have to wait. After waiting for half an hour, my boyfriend went back to complain that it was ridiculous he could not be allowed up into his room even though he was the son of the registered guest. After almost 20 minutes of arguing, we finally got these ridiculous stamps. We headed back to the elevator, told the security guard we had gotten our stamps (which could only be seen with a blacklight) only to have him not even check! Some policy... Another couple walked by (relativly older) and the guard did not ask to see their stamps. However, when two girls in their early teens came by, the guard ordered them to go to the front desk. Overall it was absolutely ridiculous that we were not allowed to go up to the room because of some policy that we were not even informed about at the time of checkin! Completely unproffesional to leave guests stranded because they did not take the time to tell them at check-in that all guests must be registered. Nice hotel...Just don't go during New Years.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but need renovations”
Reviews.Author: beauga01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one nignt and it is was ok. The room was one of the biggest size room we've been but the bathroom was not. It was the kind that he sink and the bath/toilet are separated and we do not find this very useful and practical. The paint on the ceiling on top of the bath was peeling. I'd reserved for 2 adults and 2 teenages and ask for complimentery breakfeast. At first it was not included for our childs, but the clerk, very polite, gave me two free coupons because of the misunderstanding. This is good customer service.There is a mandatory valet service parking and I do not understand why, maybe they should put in their price instead of us finding it over there.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you would expect from Mariott”
Reviews.Author: lukino6
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Courtyard by Mariott chain hotels before, so I knew what to expect. Mariott hotels are above average, but still affordable. This one in particular has a very good location on Yonge Street where everything can be found. There is small chemist that also seels food and many fast food chain restaurants. A subway station is just round the corner. The airport bus also has a stop nearby at Delta Chelsea from where it is only a 5 mins walk to the Mariott. The reception staff are nice and swift. I asked for a room on a higher floor which I received. A wifi password was given to me automatically at check-in. There are vending and icemaker machines on every floor. The room is of a very good size. The temparature can be adjusted with the aircon. The bathroom has a proper bath and basic toiletteries were provided. Business centre with computers and free internet access is avaliable on the ground floor. The internet there is rather slow though. A really handy printing machine that can accept prints over the wifi from your own computer can be used at no charge, which is ideal for printing maps or online boarding passes. I would definitely choose to stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “average hotel but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Delco63
Reviews.Content: We were booked into another hotel, but were transferred to this one due to renovations. Location is good, one block from the train. The rooms were fairly average - nothing bad to say about them but not as good as many we've stayed in. The laundry on site was a bonus after 6 weeks of travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Service could be better!”
Reviews.Author: leonardomrc
Reviews.Content: Good stay! The room was not so big big but it was comfortable enough! The room was clean but the toilet flush wasnâ€™t working when we arrived. It was clogged! We spent New Year's Eve at the city and the hotel staff were a little bit rude when explaining that we had to sign some contract to advice us that we had to use a special identification wrist otherwise we wouldn't be allowed to return to the hotel. They gave us the possibility of a late checkout at a price that was more expensive than the room rate that we've payed. They were very helpful on letting us left our luggage in a special room. The wi-fi signal wasnâ€™t strong enough so we had no access to the web. We had to use the free business center located in the lobby, which was uncomfortable. The location of the hotel is VERY good - only a few steps to College subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Rates, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mrc209
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here every time I've been in Toronto, most recently this past August. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance to most everything downtown and if your not in walking distance to your destination there is a subway station a block away. Even with road construction going on at night we couldn't hear any noise from the street below. Check in was a breeze and the valet service was always quick and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: imgoldie
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Toronto and we wanted a location that would allow us to do as much as possible in a weekend. This was it! We were able to walk to Chinatown, Kensington Market, downtown and Distillery District. There are plenty of restaurants and stores close to the hotel. The staff was very pleasant and accomodating and frequently checked with is to make sure our stay was going well. We are planning a longer trip this summer and will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy ventalation but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: pingoMontreal
Reviews.Content: Ventalation would never go off...restaurant and overall service was very good ...location was key

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: NSCanucks
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located hotel. Quiet - no street noise or from other quests. Nice lobby, but the rooms, elevator, etc are getting a bit tired. Wireless Internet really only works in the lobby not in the rooms. The cleaning of the rooms was average at best. There were hairs on the bathroom floor, the vacuuming Wong the edges hadn't been done in awhile - details were not done well.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: heldo99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well placed in Toronto and is close to the subway and many bars and restaurants are within a very short walk. The hotel was always well presented and clean and I could not fault our room at all and it was a spacious room. The free wi-fi is a great feature. On the down side we arrived at the hotel after 6pm at night and our room was not yet ready even though we arrived almost 2 hours after the estimated time I gave when booking. The staff were very apologetic and gave us free food and drinks in the bar while we waited but it was almost another hour before our room was ready. Overall though I liked the hotel and would stay there again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “The staff are the real stars.”
Reviews.Author: UnicornUDIC
Reviews.Content: Had stayed at the Toronto Courtyard Downtown previously a number of times but not in a while and had forgotten just how much I enjoy this hotel. Obviously it is what it is, towels are a bit ...'exfoliatingly brisk!' and pillows a bit saggy but what makes this hotel stellar is the staff. All of them (reception, valet parking, doormen, housekeeping, restaurant: special thanks to Terry, and room service). From check in to check out they are a real credit to the company and to this hotel in particular. There is a real feeling of community and pride. Like that. And the food is terrific which is not always so in hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at least 15 times and rate each stay A+++. Service,rooms,location super!”
Reviews.Author: kirklandLake
Reviews.Content: Have travelled with family and stayed here at least 15 times in the last 1 1/2 years and every room was great. Friendly service, very accommodating. Stayed in afew different hotels in this area, but after we stayed here once we return everytime we come to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You For Your Kindness”
Reviews.Author: Roxton16
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank the staff of the Courtyard Marriott for the kindness which was shown to my wife and I when we stayed there on December 7th. We were in Toronto for several doctors appointments that day and because of the timing of the appointments we asked for a late checkout (2pm) which the receptionist kindly provided us with. Unfortunately the second of our appointments took much longer than expected and by 1:30pm we realized that we would be unable to make it back to the hotel in time to check out. Since our bags were packed we called reception and explained our situation and asked if they could arrange to have our luggage collected and held at the front desk until we returned to check out. The receptionist told us this would not be a problem. By the time we were through with our appointment and returned to the Marriott it was after 3:30pm and both my wife and I were tired and stressed from a long day at the hospital. As I started to ask one of the receptionists for our luggage a large gentleman (Iâ€™m not sure what his position was) stepped in and in a very understanding manner advised us that, realizing we were there for medical reasons, the staff had left our luggage in our room as they felt we might need time to change, freshen up and rest for a while before we checked out. Needless to say that is exactly what we needed to hear. Given the stressful day that we both had experienced it is hard to convey how such a simple act of kindness can lift a persons spirits, which it certainly did. Once again thank you.

Reviews.Title: “A tired hotel that needs updating and more informed personnel”
Reviews.Author: Pennfield
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat--right near a TTA stop (even if the parking leaves a lot to be desired). However, this hotel has seen better days. Everything looks tired and tawdry. There are four elevators but only one ever comes (after a long wait). Our first night there the fire alarm went off four separate times. We didn't sleep much that night. The night desk clerk was clueless; he didn't even know the manager's name. The soap and shampoo are strictly downscale, what you would expect at a very cheap hotel. The halls are very narrow and there is no view from your room. The last time we were there, our room was not made up when we returned to it and a housekeeper got uppity with us, telling us we were delaying her going home. Marriott needs to refurbish and update this property and not increase room rates. The bathrooms are especially grey and grim. One bright spot is the restaurant. I have only ever had breakfast there, but it has always been excellent, and the restaurant staff is very nice, polite and professional. While in Toronto look elsewhere for accomodations. The top rating buttons on this website are not working so I would assign this property 2 dots for cleanliness, 5 for location, no dots for rooms, 1 dot for service, i dot for value and no dots for sleep quality.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Excellent”
Reviews.Author: bettylopez10
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel and we were given the Premier room because of our gold Marriot card. The room was quite huge(2 Queen size beds and a queen size sofa bed). I would say the best thing with this hotel is its location(right smack at the center of Yonge street). There are a lot of restaurants around(Mc Donalds,Tim Hortons, Wendys plus a number of sushi and pizza stores) where just infront and beside this hotel. Its also less than 15 minutes walk to Eaton Shopping Center and Dundas Square. The best place to stay for shopping and watching the Sta Claus Parade of Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but don't sleep too long :)”
Reviews.Author: TechGuy123
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of the city, we got the bus up from Buffalo and walked 3 blocks from the bus station to the hotel. A bit over-ambitious on reflection as I had managed to purchase most of Chicago before arriving and carrying two cases was brutal - even considering the short distance. The hotel was located just off the busy Yonge Street but lucky enough our room faced the back of the hotel entrance in the North Tower and only a little street noise was apparent in the morning - I think there may have been a fire station near by? The receptionist was welcoming and even had a sense of humour when he seen me struggling in with my bag. The room was large but first off we notice there wasn't a fridge nor a safe, and the bathroom was a little small in comparison to the room - it was actually split with the wash basin outside of the room with the shower and toilet within. There was plenty of room to unload our cases and enough storage space for all of our items. There was a small heater under the window but no air conditioning in the room although at this time of year we didn't need it. In the bathroom there was complimentary shampoo and conditioner but no shower gel. Instead a bar of soap was provided. Yuk! Also, there wasn't an extractor fan so having a shower soon turned the bathroom into a steam room and made the floor slippy for the next person. The bed was super comfy and came with a ridiculous amount of pillows - I felt sorry for the maid having to make the bed every day - but it meant we always had a comfortable nights sleep. Maid service itself was an experience! I was awoken one morning, not by my alarm clock, but to the sound of several maids screaming at each other in what I believe was Spanish and then proceeding to kick-the-living-daylights out of the beds in the adjoining rooms. The noise was so loud I initially thought there was a fight taking place. Each time they knocked on a door I expected to hear "DEA NO BODY MOVE" as people burst through the door with riot shields. Don't expect a long lie-in! It did become amusing after the second day - one of the cleaners broke into song. 8am? Seriously?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for bars/restaurants..Very nice staff!!”
Reviews.Author: vedaze
Reviews.Content: Was there one night as the halfway point to Ottawa. Interacted with three members of the hotel desk on separate occasions in the one day..ALL WERE SO NICE and accomodating! Place is in really good location, many bars/restaurants right across the street and within a few blocks. Place is clean. Valet parking is $30 but there is a self parking option at $25 apparently..saw the sign when we left. May want to inquire about it if you want to save $5/day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nickie41710
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Nov 4th thru the 8th. The hotel is very nice and the staff is great. They helped us with everything. The parking is a little expensive at $30 a day but worth it since you can walk or take public trans if you don't feel like walking far. The room was very nice. Great view of the city and CN tower. The room could use an update but it was still very nice. The only thing about the room that I didn't like was the location of the sink. It wasn't in the bathroom. It was totally on the other side of the room. Kinda weird. All in great hotel and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: BigMike5556
Reviews.Content: Hotel's location on Younge St is great. Close by to everything. Took me about 30 minutes to walk to the Hockey Hall Of Fame. TTC is a block away. Lobby of the hotel is nice and the staff was very friendly. My room was on the second floor facing the 24hr McDonalds. The street noise was bothersome at times. The room was cleaned daily. Seems the rooms could use a refresh on paint and decor. For the price, I was happy with the Courtyard. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is their strength!”
Reviews.Author: CanuckRedDeer_AB
Reviews.Content: Recently, my wife and I stayed at the Courtyard by Marriott Downtown Toronto while on a mixture of business and pleasure trip. We found the staff to be their best asset! We arrived at the Hotel at midnight and were first greeted by the Valet Parking staff. They were more than willing to help us. The Front Desk were accommodating to our special needs. Kola O., Assistant Front Office Manager saw to that. The restaurant servers that we encountered, whether they were the morning buffet breakfast servers or the lunch/dinner servers were attentive and knowledgeable. Agnes is a gem! They adapted their menu offerings to our special diet needs without fuss. (Hint: Select the CAA/AAA rates which give you reasonable rates as well as coupons for two people per day to their super Hot Breakfast Buffet, including eggs prepared to your liking. We meet a number of guests who came to the Buffet from other nearby Hotels. This is a $40.00 perk per day! One omission from the Younge Street Grill menu is that it lacks a chicken breast selection on the menu. All the staff that we encountered including maintenance and cleaning staff were smiling, helpful and hospitable. When our booked Limo for our return trip to the airport failed to show, the Concierge had a replacement Limo in 5 minutes and at a cheaper rate! The Hotel is clean and in good repair. It's bright and inviting. NO signs of the dreaded BB's! The meeting rooms and the lunches served suited our business purposes. The Hotel offers free Internet services in the rooms and has a small business centre with free pinter services for a reasonable amount of printing. Time on the Business Center is limited to 20 minutes per use. The Internet slows down considerable when all the computers are being used. The location of the hotel is excellent. Itâ€™s central to sporting, music, museum and theatre events and on the Younge Street Subway Line. It's located within easy walking distance to Eaton's Centre/Bay Shopping. Many good Restaurants, Bars and Clubs are nearby. Try The Pickle Barrel in the Atrium on Bay and Dundas (entrance from the Atrium or from Younge Street) or the Baton Rouge in the Eaton Centre for reasonably priced meals and good service. Extensive menus at both places. Get there early. They are very popular! All in all, my wife and I will certainly stay at the Courtyard by Marriott Downtown Toronto again!

Reviews.Title: “Staff were wonderful and helpful”
Reviews.Author: LSA2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and situated in a great location. What I want to write about though is the staff who have been outstanding. I had the unfortunate experience of having my wallet stolen with all my ID, money, and credit cards from my bag while sitting in a coffee shop (take note - apparently thefts are common here. I've traveled many places and never been robbed.) Every single person at the hotel from the front desk staff, the managers, to the security people have gone out of their way to help me file the necessary police reports and to make sure that I am OK and have what I need. Their concern has made a very stressful situation more bearable.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: Chuckelberry
Reviews.Content: Check in was smooth. I booked the hotel online and asked for a city view on a high floor and that's what we got! One of the elevators was broken so it was a bit annoying to wait and they were very small, could maybe fit 6 adults. We had a large room with a view of the CN Tower. The only downside was the dirty balcony. Since the front desk advised us there was no smoking in or outside the room, we were wondering why our balcony was covered in cigar and cigaret buds. The room was a good size but I wouldn't say they look like the rooms on the website, they could be updated a bit. Location was good, about a 15 min walk from yonge and dundas. They also had free wifi but didn't seem to work very well.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Muccimooch
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I go on an annual trip to somewhere fun and new each year. This year, we chose Toronto, and chose to stay at the Courtyard Marriott based upon the reviews. Everyone was RIGHT!! The location of this hotel is absolutely PERFECT. Located on Yonge Street, you are close to everything! Great restaurants, public transportation, and you are still located only a few blocks from the "Times Square"-ish shopping district. On our girl's trip, we always go to a spa, and this time we went to The Elmwood Spa, which was located only 3 (!!!) blocks from the hotel. The Elmwood Spa was nothing less than spectacular, and I would HIGHLY recommend this spa to ANYONE going to Toronto. Back to the Courtyard Marriott: the hotel is HUGE. The room was also very large. If I have any criticism, it would be that the room itself was dingy and needs a little bit of attention. However, the hotel room was large. It was also clean. It would be nice if Marriott invested a little more money into this hotel, and upped the ante on the quality of the room/furnishings, etc.. We ate breakfast every morning at the huge buffet, and it was excellent. I would definitely recommend this hotel to any of my friends want a great location and a good value, and are not expecting a luxurious room experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great service! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: JSWeb
Reviews.Content: My husband & I chose this hotel mostly based on reviews we had read, price, and location. We were not disappointed. We arrived just before check-in time. And, although, they couldn't get us in our room early, they offered to hold our luggage and allow us to freshen up. Just 20 minutes later and our room was ready - along with a free upgrade to a room with a balcony. Our room was very large including a long hallway which had the toilet and shower in one room and a vanity with sink in another. The bedroom had a king size bed, nice tv, and a full wall of glass - for the balcony - which let in great light. The bed was comfy and clean. I found one icky stain on a curtain as I opened it but that was my only icky find! The location was perfect!! If I had to name a few minor things that were disappointing, it would be that our wifi connection was spotty, forcing me to connect via a wire, and that $30/night for parking is a bit steep (although that is fairly common for larger cities). The reception staff and valet were very kind and helpful! It's nice getting cheery service!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: jrman66
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this hotel to add value? The location is amazing; close to tons of hip bars, restuarants, shops, the metro... Otherwise the rooms were clean, but nothing special. The lobby was sparce and the hotel bar was decent enough. Out of a 10 I would give this hotel a 7. At least I slept well. I know this is not a wonderful review, but I travel so much it takes something special for me to be that impressed with a Courtyard by Marriott. If I could be critical of one thing, it would be the need for this hotel to update its overall vibe. It almost seems to clash with its surroundings; which are very hip and trendy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Expensive Parking”
Reviews.Author: heritaghei
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Courtyard Marriott 475 Yonge St Oct 24. I didn't have any of the sleep issues that others have reported. I was in the North Tower and it was relatively quiet. This is a nice hotel with all of the amenities one expects in a big city downtown hotel. My greatest concern is bedbugs, and thankfully none were found. According to bedbugregistry.com many buildings in the area have bedbugs. I have no complaints about this hotel. $25 per day to park across the street and $30 for valet parking is a bit extreme.

Reviews.Title: “Good service but noisy and dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: qqsong
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Courtyard for a conference from Oct 12 to Oct 15. Since the hotel is booked for me I didn't bother to check on Tripadvisor which turned out to be a huge mistake. I was given a room on the 3rd floor facing Yonge Street and it was so noisy that I wasn't able to sleep at all. The problem had come up on Tripadvisor reviews and if I had read it I would have asked for a quieter room to start with. So please be aware of rooms at lower floors directly facing Yonge Street which is perhaps the busiest street in Canada! That said, I requested a room change the next morning and the request was met immediately by friendly staff and I was switched to the quiet corner on the other side up on 6th floor. I have talked with a few front-desk staffs and they are all very friendly, courteous and professional. After coming back from Europe and been a frequent traveler to both Europe and Asia, Canadian hotels are hopelessly boring of course. They in general lacks the luxury of Asian hotels and elegant and taste of European ones. The courtyard is in desperate need of an update. The stucco ceilings are cracked, the whole decor is very "blah" and the amenities look like they are from the last century (they probably are). There's dust on the alarm clock in my room and the toilette wasn't flushed when I came in. The location of the hotel is great of course for excursions in Downtown Toronto but you'll have to put us with the noise. I do love the express check-out. I also had a problem with the door man on the day of my departure. I asked for a Taxi and he insisted that I take an SUV Limo. I specifically said if the limo costs more I really would like just a normal taxi but the door man assured me that it costs the same. Turned out it did cost about $20 more and I had to have an uncomfortable conversation with the driver to lock the price down. This is completely unnecessary which make me think if the door man is taking any benefit from the Limo driver.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and Customer Service was superb”
Reviews.Author: dtf1215
Reviews.Content: Our stay began with wonderful service from the front desk. We arrived only 15 minutes prior to check in, but because the hotel was running late, they checked us in immediately with an upgrade to a larger room w/jacuzzi, which we did not use; however the gesture was nice. Arvin, the bellman, for the parking facility, was very helpful in giving us directions, suggestions and very personal attention throughout our stay of four nights. We soon took the attitude of "let's not spend time looking on the internet" and instead hope that Arvin was on duty to get information. He was our key to making the trip to Toronto most enjoyable. The hotel itself is fairly basic but with a great location, allowing us to travel easily by foot, metro or car to desired locations. The only drawback experienced involved the free internet that was sporadic at most. It kept going down and phone calls to the "help desk" proved to be long (almost one hour) and did not resolve the problem even when an "engineer" was sent to the room. This was obviously very frustrating but fortunately with the help of Arvin, we were able to get good directions and recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Bit disapointing.”
Reviews.Author: LondonColombo
Reviews.Content: Receptionist was quite unwelcoming on check-in. Requested a room with a view on the reservation but got room 311 which facese the north tower of the hotel also next to a ice dispencer. WiFi connection in the room is so slow. Nice large room but rooms are bit tired.

Reviews.Title: “Questionable....”
Reviews.Author: Ang1978
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a one night stay at this hotel. I stayed there for marathon weekend. The room wasn't very clean, the mirrors in the room had finger prints on them, there was a thick layer of dust on all the edges of the furniture, visible clumps of dust balls all over the headboard of the bed and around the bed and in the nightstand drawers. There was a large amount of white powdery substance around the the back and side of the bed which made me wonder if the room had been recently sprayed for bed bugs. There were a few small dead bugs in the back of the nightstand drawer. The balcony doors were completely filthy, a layer of dirty film and fingerprints all over them. The room was on the fifth floor and it is way too close to the street for it to be quiet at night. All you hear is honking of cars and sirens blaring. The rooms and hallways need some work and the furniture looks worn. Needless to say I won't be returning for another visit here.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommendable”
Reviews.Author: Party_W
Reviews.Content: Highly recommendable. Breakfast very good.Telephone reservation unacceptable. Will let you spell your grandfather's nickname.

Reviews.Title: “People at the service desk were...”
Reviews.Author: southamericandude
Reviews.Content: People at the service desk were extraordinary and location was good cause it was one block from subway station. Bad part was Internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: casper437
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a reasonably priced hotel in downtown Toronto to spend 2 or 3 nights. It was our first visit to Toronto. With no reservation we stopped around 11 a.m.and asked if they had any rooms. We mentioned that we were celebrating our anniversary. The friendly desk clerk gave us a large room on the top (17th) floor with a couch and a nice view of the city. We wouldn't have to wait for the room. She told us breakfast was included. The breakfasts were fabulous and saved us a lot of money. The concierge recommended a 2 day on/off bus tour of Toronto, which we took. We only wish she would have mentioned the senior rate discount. Also,the local transportation system is very good and the 2 day deal really isn't necessary. She also recommended a good, moderately priced place nearby for lunch or dinner called Fran's, that we ate at several times over the 3 days. Parking at the hotel cost $30/day with in/out privileges or you can self park for $25 at a nearby lot. The valet service was pretty fast so we paid the higher amount -- expensive, but everything in the city is as well. if ever in Toronto again we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “3 rooms to make it right”
Reviews.Author: A_white_cloud
Reviews.Content: Checked in @ 8pm to find all rooms gone, except for a room on 2nd floor, right @ corner of Yonge & College, with 3 huge ventilators right outside our window -- hardly slept a wink that night! Next morning, asked for a quiet room, away from all noises, but new room was still right @ corner of Yonge & College, albeit higher up on 6th floor -- didn't sleep much either, with all the traffic noise from the busy intersection. Another morning, another move, this time up to the 9th floor, to the back of the tower -- finally able to sleep. Parking is very expensive, $30 daily! Breakfast buffet $19.95, and not really worth it. Free hi-speed internet in room and @ business centre; never managed to get printer to work, despite various attempts

Reviews.Title: “extremely overpriced. good location. comfortable. good breakfast. most of the staff were very friendly.”
Reviews.Author: my41
Reviews.Content: extremely overpriced. good location. comfortable. good breakfast. most of the staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and value so-so”
Reviews.Author: SoJo16
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a basic room for a conference September 18-21 while the film festival was on. I agree that the location was great. I had a weird room on the 2nd floor with no view. I could hear the noise of footsteps on marble floors when I tried to sleep. The bed was extremely hard. The toilet and bathtub were on one side of the room and the sink was on the other side. The holtel was very busy, and the did a poor job with check-in...I had to check back four times to see if a room was available before I got settled. I made use of the business centre and fitness centre and they were both very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel-Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: mschneider
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Courtyard for seven nights, I was in the city for the famous film festival. I found the hotel excellent in all categories. I was given a large "Prestige" room on the 15th floor. Room appeared to be recently remodeled: new carpeting, freshly painted walls, new tiles in the bathroom, new flat screen TV. As much as I liked the hotel, I liked the location even better. It's located between Ryerson and Toronto Universities, so there are lots of cheap take away places open very late seven days a week. I'm not food tourist so this works well for me:) In addition there is a 24 hour pharmacy and the College subway station just one block away. The location also worked well for the film festival. The fest's largest venues are within walking distance: Ryerson, AMC Younge, Eligin, and Winter Garden. If I return to this vibrant city, I will not hesitate to return to the Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect for a stay in Central Toronto.”
Reviews.Author: CarrigeenYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed here five nights in June at the end of a long trip and found a great room, two large beds, every comfort, and everything we needed. (Note: you have to ask for a fridge to be supplied as not all rooms are supplied with one.)(no charge) . The air conditioning unit in window worked fine. There is a pool, gym, and laundry, internet office, etc. all free. Staff were excellent, and always took time to give us information about whatever we needed to know, despite it being a very busy popular business and conference centre. There is a tourist desk in the reception area, that will sort out tours for you, using buses that pick up at the door. This is very useful.The location was perfect for exploring Toronto on foot. Its quite a long walk from the sea front and harbour, but taxis and buses are cleap. We used the City tourist "hop on, and hop off" buses, which were great. Breakfast was an extra charge, but the dining room menus were excellent and varied. We ate out locally, which was very easy...great sushi places not far away, and a super corner grocery further up the street, if you wished to take back snacks to your room. All major stores and big names not far away , within a half mile or so. Shoppers paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Miserable staff, great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: nowzer
Reviews.Content: We couldn't check-in until well after 5pm because the room wasn't ready. Found out from one of the employees this is very common, because they allow to many late check-outs and housekeeping gets backed-up. Staff was very unhelpful. The pool is so small that my kids didn't even want to go in for a swim. Buffet breakfast was excellent but an additional $20 depending on which type of room is booked. Parking was an additional $30 ( which is common in Toronto). Great neighborhood, near the subway. Over all experience was OK.

Reviews.Title: “BEST DEAL IN DOWNTOWN TORONTO”
Reviews.Author: HOGG00007
Reviews.Content: The best deal in downtown Toronto. We booked it under the CAA rate and the room rate including buffet breakfast was far better than any other hotel. The location also was very nice and close to all downtown activities.

Reviews.Title: “Good & Bad”
Reviews.Author: nivinav
Reviews.Content: We got our booking in courtyard and were happy about its location and convenience.We also had a good time ,but it was only when we were departing ,we realized something was not right ..I and my brother were scratching our necks ..only to to realize we were bitten by bed bugs in the hotel...couldn't complain in the hotel since we already left the place and was late ...!!! So a vacation turned to be a nightmare and we have to come back and steam and wash all r bags and clothes :(

Reviews.Title: “Decent downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: SG1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the Courtyard in Toronto in August 2010. The hotel is located on Yonge street just a block from the College subway station. Dundas Square & Eaton Centre is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The location was good and made getting around the city on foot or subway quite easy. Our room on the 11th floor consisted of two queen beds & a sofa, it was very spacious. The bathroom was good, the sink was separate from the toilet & shower. We had great nights sleep as the beds were very comfortable and we did not hear any noise from other rooms or the street. All of the usual amenities were included such as iron, small fridge, flat screen tv. There was no room safe though. The breakfast at Yonge street grill was nice. There was plenty on offer both hot & cold, including omlettes made to order. The full buffet was CAD 19.50 per person plus taxes of 13% in Toronto! You need to be careful in restaurants as with the tax & tips the bill can be quite a bit more than expected. We had a great time in Toronto it is a very clean and safe big city. We will certainly return as there are many more sights to see.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly good”
Reviews.Author: Barrons
Reviews.Content: Our room was large with plenty of space for the 2 of us. It was typical Marriott -(linen, Pillows etc) and very comfortable. We liked the sink being separate to the shower etc as we could both get ready at the same time. Breakfast in the hotel was good - we were given 2 free (out of 4 nights stay), and as everyone else has said, for the price we paid, the location is good. The Pool is a little small - 4 people at one time made it feel crowded, but it was an extra as was the exercise room. If you catch the airport shuttle from the airport, the nearest hotel it stops at is the Delta Chelsea which is about a 5-6 minute walk from the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: mojarashe
Reviews.Content: Nice location in a popular area, quiet rooms. Able to walk to major shopping and restaurant areas. We found the front desk personnel nice but info provided not necessarily reliable (e.g. many questions asked about surrounding areas yielded inaccurate info). They are nice but do not know the area well. It was disconcerning when info received from front desk staff was not on target. The rooms are spacious and well kept. Beds quite comfy! Thanks for foam pillows! Parking is expensive and we are still unsure if in-out privileges are allowed for hotel guests. Keep in mind the "Tour" desk does not have a concierge, but is staffed by an agent selling a certain company's tours. Seek info on tours and things to do from this site, the local Info Centers, CAA, or others. PUT ALL NAMES ON RESERVATION! I arrived several hours before my husband into Toronto and could not check into our room. My name and contact info is the same as his and the room was reserved for two adults, but they would NOT let me check in. Additionally, my credit card was guaranteeing the room - the one in my name only, and the reservation was sent to my email address. This is a true catch-22 as the Marriott Corp will only allow one name on their rewards membership per family and if the reservation is NOT in that name, then you cannot earn points for the stay. Ridiculous rule and there was no warning, so lucky for me, three hours after I arrived, I caught my hubby waiting to change planes at O'Hare and he called the hotel to add my name. That cost us international calling minutes and was not a warm welcome for me. The breakfast buffet is a great beginning to each day (and the restaurant staff are outstanding), so try to obtain a rate which includes this nicety. It is also a real plus to have computers/internet available WITH PRINTING ACCESS.

Reviews.Title: “This Courtyard is all about Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: travelcityguy
Reviews.Content: While this Courtyard by Marriott could use some room/bed updating, this hotel is all about location, location, location! It is very convenient to subway, midtown, downtown, and the gay village. IT is conveniently located to almost everything in Toronto, plus the coffee shop contained in the building of the hotel is a very nice convenience. Overall it is an ok Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all...”
Reviews.Author: Freqtravellerperth
Reviews.Content: Partner and I visited Toronto in August 2010. Hotel is conveniently located, close to lots of restaurants and other facilities. Room layout is weird (as discussed by other contributors) but comfortable and quiet. No safe provided or fridge... but no big deal for us. All in all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Main Entrance !!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgesTannous
Reviews.Content: Rooms are more than clean , big and very organize however, their was no minibar in my room neither a safe box. the main entrance of the hotel is behind the main road in the yong street where you need to walk sometime to get into the hotel .

Reviews.Title: “No bargain, but a great location”
Reviews.Author: Barfota
Reviews.Content: Location is great. During our two days in Toronto we were able to walk to all places we wanted to visit. Our room in this big hotel looked just like it was presented on the internet. Quiet, clean and comfortable beds, but not much charm. Coming from Europe we enjoyed the selection of movies you could order, several of them were new to us. The breakfast was okey, but weâ€™ve had better for the price. Espcially the selection of bread was poor and there was no ham or sliced cheese, just cream cheese and jam. And the guy making eggs and omelettes vanished every now and then. My son enjoyed the tiny pool and the gym looked good, even though I wasnâ€™t able to try it. Most of the people working at the hotel were correct, but not very nice. There were exceptions of course, like one man at the breakfast restaurant who made us feel very welcome, his colleague at the bar was nice, and the men who worked with the valet parking gave us a smile. The hotel is not a bargain, but I would recommend it if you just need a comfortable bed for a short visit at a good lacation. If you want a cosy or romantic stay, you should go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL, CLEAN EXCELLANT START TO OUR HOLIDAY”
Reviews.Author: DerekMargaret
Reviews.Content: Rooms were big clean and well finished the staff were very helpful. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: rsa0
Reviews.Content: Situtated on the longest street in the world, Younge st. , the hotel is in the middle of the tourist district of Torronto. Fairly clean, pretty good breakfast and nice rooms. The staff is professional and available (usually). One thing you have to avaoid when booking a room, is a view towards Younge street. The noise is so overwhelming that you may forget sleeping at night without some serious pills. If you also have valet parking ( which by the way is about 35$/day) make sure that you call them in advance so you'll get the car in time. We almost lost the plane - it took that long to get a valet available at night. Overall is a good hotel, just a bit overpriced, but given the position in downtown, I guess is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but don't expect WiFi”
Reviews.Author: MaverickSMI
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a friends wedding in Toronto. Good location slightly uptown near Yonge and Dundas crossing, lots of good restaurants nearby and very close to Wellsley metro. Hotel itself was well kept and maintained - comfortable beds and fantastic gym and pool facilities downstairs. Room very well sized (twin room), lots of space Main gripe was the very very poor WiFi reception pretty much anywhere and at any time of the day - we were staying the South tower on the 7th floor. Tried with both smartphones and laptop and the result the same - friends also in the south tower on a different floor and spent much time having to speak to the hotel's IT dept...bit of a joke really. Only other small point was that the room didn't have a safe - which for the Marriott seems odd but really picking hairs now!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: bri5050
Reviews.Content: I went up to Toronto to do some sightseeing and catch a couple of Blue Jays' game. I chose this hotel because of its location on Yonge Street. This was my first time in Toronto, and I found it easy to get from the hotel to just about anywhere. There's a subway stop about a 3-minute walk away. Parking fees are sky-high, and the food at the hotel was expensive. But there are other options nearby where you can pop in for a reasonably-priced meal. Aside from that, I enjoyed my stay very much. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: SanFranExplorer
Reviews.Content: To begin with, this hotel is in a FANTASTIC location - right at the corner of Yonge and Wood St. Short walking distance to subway station (one block away), the "Village", loads of shops/restaurants and event he Airport Express shuttle bus pickup/drop-off point (Delta Chelsea hotel, roughly 1.5 block away). Even the heart of downtown - Dundas Square, is only a 10-15 min. walk away from the premise. You simply can't beat this location. Facility and service. This is definitely not a new hotel as decor and furniture of guest rooms do show some age. Nonetheless, rooms are still quite comfortable and considered well maintained. I was put in a room located at the South Tower on the 14th floor where I had a great south view of the city. Bed was extremely comfy, bathroom area was clean and there was no noise issue during my 4 days of stay there. Free use of business center is also great. The restaurant/bar inside the hotel looks pretty good thought I didn't bother to try as there are so many dining choices around the area. I paid a great price of 109 CAD per night with free internet included which is fantastic for a 3~4 star hotel in a great part of Toronto, and I was not disappointed at all! I agree with some reviews here this Courtyard is a wonderful base for touring around Toronto. I spent my last 4 days in Toronto at this good hotel and was very happy. Shall I visit Toronto again in the future, I will most definitely consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wrong place , Wrong time - My story at Courtyard!”
Reviews.Author: Abdul28
Reviews.Content: Well, Where do I start . I had so many ups and downs staying at this hotel . The busboy that greeted me in the entrance is by far the best thing as he noticed that I was missing some change for the Cab fare so he offered me a couple of dollars to pay the Taxi , truly thankful for him. I don't remember his name unfortunately . Nest Thing I noticed was the spacious reception; not fancy but nice and practical , the front-desk were very polite and friendly , they checked me in really fast so I'm glad for that. It was all good until that bad night when I woke up in the middle of the night in my bedroom to an old lady right beside my BED!! I was shocked and my first thoughts were that I was dreaming ! How could this lady be in my room, it was so weird and for some reason I went back to sleep , I guess I was in that phase were I'm not really awake and my senses were not that good . The next morning I was still convinced that It was a Bad/really vivid dream until ..... UNTIL I found a little blue card holder lying on the floor beside and knew it wasn't mine ?! I checked it out and found out that it wasn't a dream after all , that lady was really in my room at the middle of the night . Turns out she was a polish flight attendant checking-in from a really long trip , she was probably drunk or just dizzy! OK, So I ruched up to the phone and called reception and told them about what happened to me , the lady said they will investigate the issue further and they will call me back so I waited for about 2 hours to receive a call from the manager saying the hotel is deeply sorry for what happened to me and said it was a mistake done by one on the employees by giving that flight attendant the keys to my room ! The manager was very professional and really handled the problem well , she apologized , gave me new room and even sent me a written formal apology to my room with a complimentary free night voucher to redeem At any Courtyard by Marriott hotel in North America. Of all what happened to me and the fright that I got given the fact that I'm only 18 years old and was staying in a hotel room alone for the first time in my life , I would say the manager really made things better by being very professional an caring . Overall the rooms at the hotel were clean and the beds were comfy; Cant ask for more for a really good price.

Reviews.Title: “30 Dollar a night Balcony”
Reviews.Author: tommy079
Reviews.Content: Picked the Courtyard because of it's balcony after walking all day nice to relax on with drink balcony 3x10 not for sitting and relaxing on filthy dirty . Receptionist put us to the back of hotel because of noise to front but failed to tell us that the air conditioning machine was going 24-7 so being at back was of no use ,complained before paying bill they took of the extra 30 dollars a day off for balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - no soul”
Reviews.Author: Cibal
Reviews.Content: Arrival and departure operations are quite difficult, the hotel propose valet services to park your car (6 CAD/day) which comes on top of the 22.13 CAD/day parking costs. If you decide to park your car yourself it is Do not forget any question during checking, the personal is so busy that you will have to wait in a queue for any demand. They are however friendly and polite. Our room was quite strange the bathroom was cut in 2 area the one with the with the sink was without door. The breakfast was nice with a lot of choice. There are other Marriotts downtown Toronto. The Toronto Marriott Downtown Eaton Centre seems to be the right one.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!”
Reviews.Author: annaroseusa-va
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't expect a hotel of this caliber to be running a parking scam; but they are. The second I drove up, the hotel con-man was on us asking for $25 to "self-park". It turns out they wanted to charge $25 for a $4 off hotel spot next door. The internet was very slow, the room was poor, and the people were rude and running a scam.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality, good location”
Reviews.Author: LeVisitant
Reviews.Content: It's what you would expect from the Starwoods Marriott Group: functional rather than elegant, but I must recommend it highly for location. It's in the centre of the commercial part of Toronto...a few blocks from the vast Eaton Centre: think air-con in high summer, nice and warm in sub-zero winter temperatures. Good selection of restaurants nearby: I suggest Hornero pizzeria and Volo Italian. Hard Rock Cafe and that type of eatery also within a few blocks. Beds very comfortable but had one major quibble with room: bathroom sink and mirror was part of the room: toilet and bath were in a small ensuite. They were just behind a partition wall and it seemed a bit tacky. But rest of the room was impressive. Good breakfast buffet in the mornings - a large American style breakfast with hot and cold options. No real bar to speak of in the hotel however. We spent too long in Toronto - 3 or 4 nights will suffice for one to see all the sights and get to a show in the small theatre district. Having said that it's remarkably clean and safe for a big city

Reviews.Title: “Great location - standard accommodation”
Reviews.Author: ISMc
Reviews.Content: Happened to stay for the Saturday evening of the Gay Pride Festival so the neighbourhood was lively to say the least, in a positive sense. Cannot go wrong with this hotel if you want to be close to downtown as it is downtown! Room fine - nothing exceptional. Be prepared to pay the valet parking as extra to the room rate if you need to get rid of your car for the duration - as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Below expectations”
Reviews.Author: Aviron
Reviews.Content: What a strange experience. As others have said, the location is very good unless. Totally walkable to the museums, markets, malls, parks, subway and streetcars. The breakfast buffet is excellent and worth the extra cost. The reception staff was friendly and professional. The hotel was crowded on a busy holiday weekend (Canada Day/July Fourth/Toronto Pride). Some of our party had a hard time getting into their rooms as they were not ready (for some as late as 6PM). The rooms are not very nicely decorated. The bathrooms do not have a sink (or mirror) and just a small hook that doesn't hold anything larger or heavier than a T-shirt!!! You have to walk out and around to the other side of the room to wash your hands. The carpet is new and plush. The bed was very comfortable but the pillows were oddly small. No mini-fridge in the room, though one was provided when requested. No security box in the room, just on offer at the reception desk with the old double-key system. The staff was helpful when we needed access. It is just very inconvenient. Housekeeping was spotty. One day the room was not made up until after 6 PM, when there was a rap at the door and we were told if we wanted the room serviced we had to step out of the room NOW, because her shift was about up. The next morning (Saturday) there was a rap at the door BEFORE 9 AM and a different housekeeper was standing there and loudly told me to "put the sign on the door" but I pointed out that there was no (do not disturb) sign so she just walked away without apology or explanation (or paper sign) having obviously disturbed us on a holiday morning! And I heard her tapping on other doors that didn't have signs not to be disturbed. We are talking 8:50 on a Saturday morning!!! Housekeeping staff needs some attitude adjustment. They could be more generous with towels, especially since some are in the bath/shower room and some are at the sink. Soap and shampoo were fine. Furniture was dusty. There is a large and well-equipped exercise room, small pool, kiddy pool and whirlpool on the lower level. One time I went down and there were 10 teenage boys rough-housing in the pool and whirlpool with no adult in the area. I guess I could have called the manager, but didn't. Other guests also turned around and went out of the pool area to avoid the splashing and mayhem. Finally, the elevators are swift and internet is free. All this schizophrenia for the holiday rate of $250/night!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a bargain price”
Reviews.Author: Hellyb123red
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal, Â£105 for 4 sharing. So it was a bit of luxury for not a lot! Large room, clean and well maintained. Great looking reception area. Nice pool, hot tub and gym! Negatives: Had to pay for parking. No breakfast included No fridge in room Though they knew there would be 4 adults sharing; 3 towels, had to ask for more 2 mugs, had to ask for more 2 teabags / coffee sachets etc Hairdryer was broken - new one provided Had to request iron and ironing board Good location

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: raneflight
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a night at the end of May. The hotel is decent and we got a gigantic room (although the room was rather empty) The bathroom was small but the sink was outside of the room, it was kind of convenient since you don't have to wait for the bathroom just to wash your hands. Overall the place was really quiet and the bed was comfortable. One thing that was unsettling was the fact at around 6am the next morning of our stay, there was a knock on our door. There was apparently a hotel maintenance worker asking to coming to fix our toilet... We were sure whether it was a mistake (since this guy knocked on 3 different doors before getting the right one...) or a hoax, so we called the down to the front desk and it turned out that it was a hotel maintenance worker. Breakfast is not included in our stay, but since Courtyard Marriott is located in the center of Toronto on the busiest road, its not hard to find breakfast. If you want a full breakfast Cora's is just a block away. There is also free wifi and wired internet in the rooms. It took a while to get onto the network and also the wifi isn't the greatest in the room, nonetheless, it is still free. Overall, this is a pretty decent place to stay. The rooms are clean, bed is comfortable and location is key!

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent and unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: DamonV
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Downtown Toronto Courtyard Marriott on May 29th after a long day traveling. I had a reservation, but when I tried to check in I was told my room was not available, nor was there any other room for me. The desk clerk apologized but could or would not offer anything besides compensating breakfast, which is no help at all if you don't have a room. They told me to wait in case someone checked out. I left and returned a couple hours later, but nothing had changed. I asked the manager what they intended to do if they still had no room at 9pm? At midnight? No solution was offered. My request to arrange alternate accommodation was refused. I had no choice but to try and find a last-minute alternative late Saturday afternoon on a holiday weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Poor experience”
Reviews.Author: Rob075
Reviews.Content: Toilet was broken on check in. Told it would be fixed when returning from dinner and game. Didn't happen.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anikabella
Reviews.Content: We booked this room thru a discount website and had no issues. Upon request, they granted us with a room with two double beds instead of a room with a king bed. Although we were unable to check-in early, they did let us park in the hotel lot early at no extra cost. Our room was spacious enough and had everything you would expect in a normal hotel room. It was clean and the beds were comfortable. The area where the hotel is located is at about 15 minute walk to Dundas Squares/Eaton Centre. Many restaurant available on Yonge street, around the hotel, including a 24hr pharmacy. If you don't expect anything too fancy and get a good rate, this is a good option for you.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean, and efficient.”
Reviews.Author: godfather830
Reviews.Content: The hotel is everything you expect it to be with few surprises. The lobby area is nothing fancy and the choice of restaurants inside the hotel is very limited, but there are quite a few around in the neighborhood. Service was also quick and efficient. It took less than 5 minutes for me to have access to my room, which was also very clean and adequately soundproof. It offers free wireless internet and has a few computers for public use if you don't have your own laptop. Overall, the hotel offers good value for business travellers with a decent location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for a Dowtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vjv2007
Reviews.Content: Loved the location. Easy walking distance to all modes of transportation. Comfortable room. Loved that the window open for fresh air instead of listening to an airconditioner all night. Great breakfast buffet that had food choices for all nationalities. Slow internet access. Biggest draw back .....THE REDICULOUS PARKING FEES!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Downtown....”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_In_Dallas
Reviews.Content: I did a quick one-night stay here in May. I have actually stayed here a couple times but this is my first review of this hotel. Overall, great location. It is almost in the middle of the office complexes of "downtown" (Eaton Center/King Street/etc) and what I would call mid town (Bay Street, etc). It is also located two blocks in either direction of the subway station so you are perfectly located if you are doing business downtown. I was upgraded to a "balcony" room which, honestly, wasn't much of an upgrade. But still it was an OK room. Bed was comfortable while I will say that the duvet was a little on the light side when compared to what you find at the Marriott level hotels. Internet was acceptable in speed and I had no problems connecting. One thing I did find a tad annoying....but I am not sure if this exists in other rooms or just the corner room I was in...the sink and closet and separated from the shower and toilet. By separate I mean down the hall...they weren't side by side or across from one another. Not a deal breaker but still a very odd design. Also close by, if needed, was a Wendys, Pizza Pizza, Subway, Starucks and a few other places. But this is Younge Street so you are pretty much in the middle of everything :)

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: brendastarlet
Reviews.Content: Although I can afford to stay elsewhere, I've chosen this hotel twice now because of the combination of its location, the value and the friendly service. It's very convenient if you're driving to Toronto, because there's both self parking and valet parking. While Yonge Street is a tad grungy, you can walk a few blocks north to Yorkville and be as posh as you like. You are also just a block from the streetcar and two blocks from the subway. The staff is very nice and accommodating. Don't hesitate to ask for a fridge, and request a room with a view if you want one. Many film folks use this hotel during TIFF.

Reviews.Title: “Service was excellent”
Reviews.Author: noplacelikehome617
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay near the University of Toronto campus. We've stayed here once before. We had several problems with our room after we arrived, which shouldn't have been the case (toilet not working properly, wet spot on the carpet), but they were resolved immediately and with courtesy. The rooms are pretty average, not spacious but larger than many others we've stayed in. The bedding is always nice at Marriotts. The towels, however, were not - very thin. The bathrooms could use some sprucing up. There's a small separate room with the toilet and tub/shower, with the sink separate, which is convenient. Ask for a high floor if you can get it - there will be less street noise. The valet parking for guests is $30/night, which we thought was on the high side. The breakfast, which was included with our room, is better than average. Varied offerings, pastries were very fresh, not packaged.

Reviews.Title: “Free use of Y, free laundry machine, room needed vacuming!”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times. Last year I paid $89 weekend rate. This year they wanted $129. (I had a free night). So the recession (if Canada had one) is over. On the plus side: great downtown location, close to College Street TTC subway stop, near great shops and restaurants. Free use of YMCA while hotel pool under renovation. Property showing its age. Plus it is a busy convention hotel. You may want to try the new Holiday Inn across the street when it opens next month (the former Days Inn). Given the paucity of great affordable choices in Toronto, I recommend the Courtyard. The staff is the best. My room was quiet and faced the northside high rises (avoid rooms facing noisy Yonge Street). Not enough computers in the business center.Take the subway to the airport and then the 192 bus for just $3.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great location.”
Reviews.Author: VLBJhb
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was dated and the noise levels at night were high. It was not as clean as other hotels we stayed in but the room was a decent size. The hotel is located in downtown Toronto where a lot of the clubs and adult shops seem to be located. The area is not unsafe or dirty but I did not enjoy the vibe. People partying it up tended to keep me awake all hours of the night and morning! The hotel itself was also very noisy and we were constantly woken by banging and bashing?! It has quick access to the tube and to two large shopping centres located about three blocks down. The shopping centres were the highlights of the area. The staff were helpful & assisted in booking us tours to Niagra Falls, etc. However, the tour operator is not properly clued up as we arrived at our wine tasting on Good Friday only to discover the winery was closed. I expect my tour operator to check on the availability of the activities it offers. No discount was offered in spite of wasting over an hour of my time!

Reviews.Title: “Good for business and location”
Reviews.Author: oliveerpent
Reviews.Content: Good location on walking distance of the marina, CN tower, downtown, university but this hotel is probably beter for a business travel. We spent there 3 nights and the value was correct. Try the restaurant "Interior" on the same street but to the direction of the harbor, it's offer a nice place to eat and a large choice of wines. The hotels also offers a choice of trips in Toronto and Niagara falls.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay....good value!”
Reviews.Author: all4kicks
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel while on business. Thought the service, location was wonderful. The room was nice, maybe not for a long vacation but perfect for a 2-3 day stay. I think it's been said but the $30/day for valet is a bit steep considering it was about 30% of what I paid nightly.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MonicaP93
Reviews.Content: hotel was in the heart of Toronto making it walking distance to everything. The hotel was great; breakfast choices was plentiful with fresh fruits; staff helpful and pleasant; affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with kids for a quick stay”
Reviews.Author: jlrvs
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel last minute in downtown Toronto, and this fit the bill just fine. The location was great - walking distance to shops, restaurants and sightseeing. They did not have complimentary happy hour or breakfast like most Courtyards do - but they have a nice restaurant and a nice lounge off the lobby. Staff was polite, the rooms were clean (nothing fancy but clean!) and the common areas well-kept. The pool area was fine, a long narrow pool with a large hot tub and smaller 1 foot deep pool for little kids. Nice workout room, too. Overall a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for single night accomodations”
Reviews.Author: couver98662
Reviews.Content: Great locations in a nice neighborhood and close walking distance to food/botique shopping. My company contracts with this hotel for our accomodations and the service here is very good, however the comfort of the room and beds is below average when compaired to other Courtyard Marriotts. Rooms are a little quirky, and mostly of good size. The beds are old and if you stay here more that one night you might not be happy. AC and cooling systems are inefficient in the larger rooms and I found the rooms to be too warm for comfortable sleep. Noise level can be a little higher than one should expect and the maid staff can be quite noisy in the hallways. If you are staying a single night you probably will tolerate the property but if you are staying multiple nights you might find yourself cranky at the end of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good value, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: WindsorTenor
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at this property. Valet parking was quick and efficient. ($30.00 per day for valet, multiple in and out, $25.00 per day for self park) Front desk staff was friendly, accommodating (we requested 2 rooms side by side) and quick. The entire property is clean and very inviting. The room is a good size with a smaller than normal bathroom. The sink is separated from the toilet and tub. There was black mold on the interior shower curtain. When we contacted the front desk, the whole setup was removed and replaced with a new one. I would recommend that when requesting rooms, that you ask for one facing AWAY from the streets as the noise from the street can be very loud (and very early and very late). We had several drinks in the Fireside Lounge. Kudos to the staff! It was an excellent experience. Breakfast in the restaurant was quite expensive, but I am not used to eating in the hotel I am staying at, so this could be par for the course. Orange Juice was $3.50 for a medium size glass. They hotel offers a buffet breakfast for $19.50 or a continental buffet for $14.50. Overall a great experience and this will probably be our hotel of choice when we return. We have stayed at various hotels in the Downtown Toronto area and for this one definitely offered the best value for price paid.

Reviews.Title: “LIKE ARNOLD SAID, "I'LL BE BACK!"”
Reviews.Author: elewisOttawa_On
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and i have no complaints about this hotel. Awesome location and friendly staff. I'm coming back to Toronto in June and will give this hotel first priority!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: BicycleRob
Reviews.Content: I had a great weekend stay for less than I expected. The included buffet breakfast was tasty and filling. I also slept well. This wasn't a business trip, but I needed to print, sign, witness and fax an e-mailed document. The Business Centre had a printer with its 3 computers, and the front desk cheerily and efficiently handled the rest. The Courtyard is only a block away from the College TTC subway, facilitating my sightseeing and specialty shopping. A few blocks further, at Dundas, are TOTix.ca discount tickets, an Ontario Travel Information Centre, and the Toronto Eaton Centre. The Courtyard is near an ethnically diverse lower rent section of downtown Yonge Street, on the edge of Toronto's Gay district. Many nearby apartments display rainbow flags. Nearby is an incredible variety of specialty shops, services and restaurants of greatly varying quality - art supplies, dancing shoes, martial arts, "souvenir ID", the so-called World's Biggest Bookstore, and many used bookstores, several with adult sections. I'd recommend a virtual walk down Yonge Street with Google Street View or WalkScore.com. It is a great neighbourhood for open minded adults. I made quick visits to some nearby gentlemen's clubs, and paid $25 for My Mother's Lesbian Jewish Wiccan Wedding at Mirvish's Panasonic Theatre. However, the less adventurous can walk directly to the College TTC subway without seeing any of that.

Reviews.Title: “Not Marriott Standard Rooms, but large and nice enough.”
Reviews.Author: toomanyhotels365
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several Marriott's and have grown accustomed to their 'standard' style room decor. This room doesn't quite meet up to the same level and is missing the 'Plug & Play' TV features, which I love, but it is still a good hotel in the PERFECT location. The rooms are Very large, much bigger than standard hotel rooms. Sink is outside of the bathroom, which is useful if you are travelling with a number of people. No fridge or microwave but this wasn't advertised and therefore not expected. FREE INTERNET! Wow! What a treat! Being used to shelling out $15-$20 for a days internet access, free internet is awesome. It is slow to connect via wired or wireless, but once your on it's great. My only quip was the gentleman at check in. He had the aura of a manager, whether he was or not I don't know as he wasn't wearing a badge. In the middle of my check- in, he literally walks away from me to speak to a valet across the other end of the desk, then does some stuff on a separate computer station and then returns to me. It was so long that one of his colleagues asked me if she should help me. I told her it was fine, but come one. AND THEN, at check out, mid conversation he stops me to take a call on a cellphone. (I'm assuming it is work issued, likely to contact maintenance or the management team, but regardless.) It was pathetic and made me feel very unwanted. During check in, he also accused me of trying to sneak 2 adults into the room when I asked for a cot. It was 2 adults and a young child, that's why I asked for a cot. But way to go 'Spirit to Serve'. Otherwise, it is an excellent hotel. Cheap valet which is quick, nice pool, nice restaurant (hotel expensive, to be expected). I would recommend to anyone who doesn't want to blow the bank but still would like to stay at the world's largest Courtyard by Marriott. If you're a fan of Marriott as I am, please try the Marriott Downtown Eaton Centre. Much nicer facility and world class staff. PS: I am a Guest Relations Manager at a resort in Ontario, so I was lenient with the agent who checked me in and out. Granted, he may have had to double back in from the evening shift to the morning shift with only 6 or so hours sleep, but PLEASE, at least don't interrupt your guest or accuse them of lying. If I had more adults than was included in the rate, I would have told you...

Reviews.Title: “Solid”
Reviews.Author: giraffeoftruth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple of days at the start of our Canada trip. The location is excellent, just off Yonge street in the downtown area. It's a useful base for exploring. We had a room on the 27th floor which was nice and quiet and the beds were excellent in my opinion, very comfortable. The room was clean and reasonably spacious. My criticisms of the room were mainly that the complimentary Wi-Fi was flaky, connection weak and throughput variable. Maybe the room I was in (1714) was near the max range...The second fault I have is that there are no room safes, which I personally find strange when so many people carry laptops. I can either leave it unprotected in my room or locked away downstairs, which is less than convenient. The staff were friendly and helpful, no complaints there. Breakfast wasn't included in my deal, but we ate there a couple of times. Again it wasn't bad, perhaps a little expensive for what it offered. Overall, this was a solid stay from a big chain hotel, nothing special but perfectly pleasant

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but.......”
Reviews.Author: Wendigo1
Reviews.Content: For the overall service and the sleep I got I could have stayed at the Ho-Jo for less. We stayed 2 nights though we had only planned on one. I booked the first night through Expedia for a reduced rate and checked in only a few minutes later. The counter person was all smiles and receptive until he saw our rate and booking. Immediately his expression changed and his demeanor became haughty. We were, of course, placed in the worst room in the place. Beside the ice machine. The noise of people going for ice woke meat least 4 times through the night. Despite this we decided to extend our stay by one night and paid "rack" price. We dealt with the same counter person for booking the second night and his attitude was only slightly better. On check out though the person we dealt with was wonderful. The valet was impressive also! Overall this was a good stay. The room was clean for the most part. I noticed dirt in the same places I find in low quality hotels though. Corners, door handles and light switches. I did expect a bit more for the cost. The room was a very good size, the bed and pillows as well as the bedding were very comfortable and clean. I liked having the business center available for computer usage since I do not travel with a laptop. The hotel is lovely and I can handle attitude from people .
