IF I am planning another trip to TO I will look for deals at this hotel. I will also look at lower cost hotels though because I hate paying more than I need to for a place to rest my head overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Top Value in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: kingstonian99
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference and my wife accompanied me since she wanted to shop in downtown. This hotel was an unbelievable value. We stayed at a special promotional shopping weekend rate of $139 per night + taxes. For that rate, we were supposed to get a room with a king bed, free valet parking with in and out privileges and a $20 Eaton Centre gift card on checkout. Unfortunately, they ran out of gift cards but promptly took $20 off our bill before we had a chance to notice. The rest of the amenities were delivered as promised and proved to be very handy, especially the valet parking. This hotel is very well located in downtown Toronto. There are numerous fast food outlets nearby including a McDonalds, Pizza Pizza, Starbucks and a Tim Horton's. Eaton Centre is a 10 minute walk, College Park is even closer and Bloor Street is a little farther away. The subway station is 2 minutes away if you want to travel anywhere of distance and that makes it pretty easy to get to if you are using public transit to come from the airport or Union station. There are a number of other activities to do in the area within walking distance (20 - 30 minutes at the most) and we were able to afford it given the great rate. The hotel was larger than I thought and the room was clean and large. There were a number of businesses and airlines that put their employees here so it can't be that bad of a place. We didn't spend that much time in the hotel but the free internet was a great help when deciding what to do around the area. Overall, great value with excellent amenities. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: wiky_6hills
Reviews.Content: They were excellent and I will stay there again, from the front desk, valets, cleaning staff everyone was friendly and not snobby. I look unassuming and I am responsible for booking rooms for my office and recommend travel to other departments.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not great either”
Reviews.Author: Bunny7475
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a visit to the King Tut exhibit at the Art Gallery of Ontario. Room was not up to Marriott's standards of cleanliness. I was surprised there was no refridgerator or microwave in the room. Most Courtyards seem to have them these days. On a positive note, the location is great, the carpet was new and the t.v. was nice. Maybe I am just spoiled from staying in other Courtyards that were much nicer for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: vancouversolo
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Courtyard before. I use Marriott hotels quite a bit and this is an excellent example of what I think a Courtyard ought to be. If you can snag a good rate that includes breakfast it would be hard to beat. I eat the same basic breakfast wherever I am but I in this case I think I cheat myself. There is actually a chef present to make your eggs to order. For those who have to stay downtown in Toronto the location is very central.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: northwhale
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Marriot Courtyard, Toronto over New Year and are were very impressed with virtually every aspect of the hotel. The staff, rooms and service were excellent and the location is right in the downtown district of Toronto and a moments walk from the subway. We did not have a bed and breakfast deal and I think benefitted from having the flexibility as breakfast can be expensive in the hotel. I really can't fault the hotel, if I was to be really picky the elevators (or lifts to us Brits!) were faulty and we were trapped numerous times.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: stuartSydney
Reviews.Content: Very well located in Toronto. Rooms are a great size and very clean. Great wifi. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto Adventure”
Reviews.Author: DavidW6
Reviews.Content: Hotel was on Yonge and within easy walking distance of Toronto's attractions. Toronto is a great place to visit, we attended the Hot Docs festival to support our friends - Anvil. We were only there for a long weekend and wished we could had stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, excellent value, Large rooms”
Reviews.Author: MptFrenchguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed more than 2 weeks here for buisness. It was great: very clean, great staff, 10 min from eaton center, very large room and not so expensive, free internet. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, Great value”
Reviews.Author: jamesteroh
Reviews.Content: I go to Toronto several times a year and this is my preferred hotel. Location is perfect. I always take Via Rail and it's only a few subway stops from Union Station and the subway stop isn't even a block away. It is right downtown and you a simple 5 minute walk to the Eaton center for shopping and a short walk for most theaters. If you are a gay traveller, it is in the village and the church street bars are just one street over. Whenever I go to Toronto for gay pride, I stay here since the parade goes directly past the hotel. If you book a AAA rate breakfast is included and it honestly the best free breakfast I have ever had a hotel. There are made to order omlete, and all kinds of fresh fruit and they serve until at least 11 a.m. The only complaints I have are the pool and the wireless. The pool is small and the workout area isn't that great. But I can workout at home. The wireless can also be poor if you are in the south tower and have a higher up floor room. But all the room also have wired high speed which always works fine. The rooms are pretty up to date and a lot of times I can get a room with a balcony which is really nice in the warmer months. This hotel is the top choice for staying downtown for me.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Blessings4ever
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay in this hotel. It has friendly staff and smooth check in and out. The rooms are spacious and beds are comfty. The location is strategic!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and value”
Reviews.Author: mdemetro81
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for 2 nights at this hotel. The hotel is clean, affordable and in a great location. Valets are very helpful descriving types of parking options and where they are located. We opted to do valet and, when we left, our car was pulled up for us in about 2 minutes. Lobby is gorgeous and check-in was a breeze, even though we arrived at noon (check-in is at 3pm). Room is very confortable. Everything is very clean and, although our view was of Yonge Street, we didn't notice any overwhelming noise during the night. The flatscreen TV was great and offered many channels. Hotel is located in a perfect location for exploring the city. Our first afternoon, we walked all the way down to the CN Tower - about a 30 minute walk. However, there is a subway stop about 2 minutes from the hotel that could take you down to the CN tower in about 5 minutes. Another day, we walked up to Bloor Street and the University of Toronto and all the way back to Eaton Center. The hotel is really in a great location for walking places. We ate dinner at Jack Astors in Dundas Square (great food!) and at Wayne Gretsky's restaurant down by the CN tower (also good). Because we booked a AAA rate, we got free breakfast which was honestly one of the best hotel breakfast buffets I have ever had. Huge selection and everything was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: templowe
Reviews.Content: Booked the Marriott following a last minute switch from another hotel closer to the waterfront - and was I glad we did. The trip was a birthday treat for my wife and following a tip-off from me, the staff went out of their way to make it a special stay. Can't praise them highly enough. As for the hotel - bright spacious reception, good-sized rooms, comfortable beds - what more could you want? Some reviewers seemed to think the location was a little seedy but I would disagree - sure there are a few "adult" stores in the neighbourhood but their windows are generally no more shocking than an Anne Summers seen on many British high streets! The area has wide selection of bars, restaurants & coffee shops plus variety of smaller independent shops - think of Cambden in London and you get the idea. Anyway if you want a more upmarket shopping experience you are only 10 minute stroll from the huge Eaton centre. Would I go back? - You Bet - I've just booked for July2010!

Reviews.Title: “Very Fair Value”
Reviews.Author: PositiveThinking1
Reviews.Content: If you have sensitive hearing, request a room " not facing Yonge ". Our room was not on Yonge but we still heard a considerable amount of street noise. I know this is a trade-off with this great location though. There is ShoppersDrugMart next door and Second Cup on the ground floor in the same building. These " features " might come handy especially in winter.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Room & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shazzie_canuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night only on our first night in Toronto. I would happily stay there again. It's in a great location in the city centre, the room was clean and comfortable and the staff were friendly and helpful. There was a small fridge in the room which would be handy for longer stays, although there was no microwave.. but at least you could make tea with real milk! We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant - we had the buffet which was very good, complete with pancakes, sausages, french toast, maple syrup and a whole lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what happened?!”
Reviews.Author: designdrew
Reviews.Content: I used to LOVE this hotel. What sure what happened, but this place is becoming just "ok". I mean, its still a good hotel, but just not as good as two years ago. Here are reasons why I still like this hotel: - Great location - Friendly staff - Spacious room and big bed - Free Internet access - Clean Here are things that I am not sure happened to this hotel: - Bad bathroom products: Let me start with the shampoo! The shampoo was gluey and heavy! I felt like I actually put more products onto my hair after I took the shower. In fact, after I use the shampoo, I didn't even need to put hair gel, my hair was styled already because the shampoo is SO gluey and heavy..... I am not joking! I didn't use my hair gel for the two days that I was there and my hair looked spiky the whole time because of the shampoo. - The bed sheets smell like bleach way too much. This can be a good thing, because it means bed sheets are probably very clean. But the smell was very very strong. With the combination of gluey shampoo, I just wasn't feeling comfortable when sleeping. - The pool and jacuzzi. Two years ago, the jacuzzi was one of my favorite part of this hotel. But this time, they put too much chemical in jacuzzi too! My body stinks really bad after I use it. And the over-drying-your-body soap they have doesn't really wash the smell away. I smells like chlorine for two days after using the jacuzzi. Overall, I still like this hotel. I mean, its got "location", "service", "cleanliness" and the "spacious room". But I think its missing the "comfort" that I use to love when I was staying there two years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Location, Staff, and Food!”
Reviews.Author: sal1107
Reviews.Content: My mother and I were going to stay at another hotel selected by our travel agent but after reviewing that hotel on TripAdvisor, we decided to go with a hotel chain that we've always been happy with. It was the best decision! This was our first visit to Toronto and this hotel was a perfect downtown location. It was convenient for walking around the downtown area, catching the bus/subway/trolley, and getting on the hop-on/hop-off sightseeing bus which had a regular stop right outside the doors of the hotel. By the way, we didn't have a car. The hotel itself had clean rooms, friendly staff, and great breakfasts. As AAA members, we chose to go with a rate that included breakfast. The restaurant staff was attentive and kept the buffet area clean, neat, and adequately supplied with a large variety of food. We woke up each morning looking forward to starting our day with a hearty breakfast. My only suggestion is that the waiters/waitresses smile more and check on their tables more frequently. The front desk staff were friendly and very helpful with directions, restaurant suggestions, taking public transportation, Canadian/American currency exchange, sightseeing, and general conversation about Canadian culture and practices. I'm sorry we didn't everyone's name but we would like to sincerely thank Sirpa Ramjit, Asst. Front Office Manager and her excellent staff for being so friendly and informative. We would have no hesitation in staying at this hotel agaiin and recommending it to others. it's not the cheapest hotel but woth considering given all the other positives. We look forward to our next visit with Courtyard Marriott and will also share this information with our travel agent.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location, decent rooms.”
Reviews.Author: nocares67
Reviews.Content: The common areas were nicer than our room, which had some noticeable wear and tear, especially in the bathroom (peeling wallpaper, nicks on the walls, that sort of thing). However, the room was adequate - the linens were clean (to the point that they smelled strongly of detergent) and the bed was fairly comfortable. The room was very quiet; we didn't hear anyone around us coming or going. Wireless internet worked perfectly. A fridge/microwave would have been nice - I have gotten accustomed to them in hotel rooms lately, but my room at the Courtyard Toronto didn't have them. I tried a few times to eat at the hotel restaurant, but room service is not available 24 hours, and the restaurants close in between meals. There is a decent workout room, but the pool is absolutely tiny and they were low or out of towels every time we went. The location is excellent, with very easy access to public transportation and within walking distance to plenty of restaurants and things to do. Every single member of the staff was friendly and professional. All in all, this is not the nicest or most unique hotel in town, but I haven't seen a better price for a hotel of comparable quality, especially considering the convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard: A Great Toronto Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JerseyGirlz
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay here again! The hotel is located on the corner of a main street and residential side street. Safe, eclectic area with loads of stores and restaurants. Felt totally safe walking at night. Only a block from the College subway station; very convenient. Five minute walk to the University of Toronto and Parliament. I asked for and got a room on a high floor. The rooms are soundproof; the ice machine was outside our door and we didn't hear a thing. They are also a good size. Hotel is clean, attractive. The included buffet breakfast was fantastic! Omelets made to order, pastries, bacon, fruit, yogurt, french toast..delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for our first trip to Toronto”
Reviews.Author: kseitz
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here during our first visit to Toronto. We get a fantastic AAA rate at under $100 a night which included breakfast coupons for two people each day. My husband and our son took advantage of breakfast and enjoyed the buffet. The hotel's location is very convenient to the College train station and to Eaton Centre shopping. We walked the neighborhood around our hotel and found the old Maple Leaf Gardens (former home of the Toronto Maple Leafs) just a block from the hotel. The hotel is a pick up stop for the sightseeing buses and the concierge offers currency exchange during business hours. Check the rates on exchange, because they varied WIDELY while we were in Canada. We enjoyed relaxing in the hotel bar after our days of sightseeing and our son enjoyed the (smallish) indoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been a perfect stay, except...”
Reviews.Author: newjerseyfamily
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the Courtyard Marriott, though we have stayed in Toronto several times before. By far, this was the best hotel we had stayed at. The area is safe(yes, we've stayed in shadier locations before) and it is very convenient to the College subway stop. We were in town for the Canadian National Exhibition. The rooms were clean, large, and nicely appointed. The beds are very comfortable. Our room was right next to the ice and soda machine, but we didn't hear anything. The front desk staff was very personable, knowledgeable of the area, and quick to help. One small negative, though I suspect it is temporary, is that there is only one computer for internet access in the lobby of the hotel. This is a big hotel. I noticed they are working on a business room that wasn't finished yet, so this looks like it will improve. We had a great AAA rate that included 2 breakfast coupons each day for the buffet. The hotel allows you to use as many as you want each day. As we had three people, this worked out great - we had breakfast free for two days, one day we ate out, and the last day we just had to buy breakfast for one. The buffet was the best! Well laid out, fresh food, omlets made to order, waffles, pancakes, an excellent selection of fruit, danish, cereal - you'll love it!! It was so good, we were able to skip lunch. We didn't get a chance to use the pool on this trip. There was only one experience that was a real negative. We were informed with a letter under the door on a Thursday that the hotel would be testing their fire alarms the next day at noon. We were planning on checking out earlier in the morning, so we felt this wouldn't affect us. In fact, we were happy to see they were doing the testing (being married to a former fireman, we do take this stuff seriously). However, we had no idea that they would shut down the elevators at around 9:35 that morning. So here we were, with heavy luggage on the 8th floor, wondering why the elevators wouldn't work. We called down to the desk, was told that it was supposed to be noon but apparently started earlier, and no estimate as to how long. After waiting a while - facing an 11 hour ride home, we ended up dragging our luggage down 8 flights of stairs. Thank heavens a cleaning woman heard us and gave us a tip to go down a hallway to another stairwell so we could get to the lobby (apparently our stairwell would not have done so). My husband had already gone down a additional flight before he heard this. I can't say I was pleased. Proper warning, an estimate as to how long, or at least wait till 11:00 when people have checked out would have made a big difference. Other than this unfortunate experience, it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central”
Reviews.Author: DylanIreland
Reviews.Content: Great hotel,helpful staff and only about 10-15 minutes walh to Dundas Square and the Eaton Center(4th biggest in North America)! All in all a great Hotel!! 5 Stars!! Very helpful visitors desk ! only 5 minute subwayfrom Union Station which is right next to the CN Tower

Reviews.Title: “Staff was great, but the hotel was just fair”
Reviews.Author: donutsfamily
Reviews.Content: In a seedy part of Yunge Street...the room was large, but seemed a bit run down. The staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: ElaineT1
Reviews.Content: Hotel on Yonge Street and close to trains and the Path which will take you anywhere in Downtown. Not the best area, but a short walk takes you to shops and restaurants. Seems to be in a Gay area too if that bothers anyone? Parking charges are very high - almost as much as the daily rental of the car. Check in and out very good. Room clean and spacious - we had a suite with a fridge, microwave, sink etc. which came in handy as the restaurant in the hotel was expensive and so was the breakfasts. We did have breakfast included with our room and it was a very good buffet style. Pool and gym small but adequate. Flat screen t.v's in room. Toiletries were very basic and cheap. The towel delivery was patchy - some days no face cloths, some days no towels at all? But the hotel was quick to provide them as needed. Freindly staff. A little pricey for what you get, but I guess that's downtown costs.

Reviews.Title: “Would give it a miss next time”
Reviews.Author: fee57
Reviews.Content: Well after staying at the Sofitel in Montreal, this was a real let down. In Toronto for 2 nights and this was selected based on the location. There is absolutely no service. We had a room beside the ice machine and drinks vending machine. The entire 3rd floor sounded like a plane was getting ready for take off. Complained about it but no one looked at it. My sink was blocked...it is pretty obvious that whoever cleaned the room should have spotted it. The clock radio was covered with dust. There is no safe in the room. The plus is the free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location in the Big Smoke”
Reviews.Author: Wembleygal
Reviews.Content: While a slightly less luxurious option to its cousin, the Marriot Eaton Centre, this hotel canâ€™t be beat for location and value for money. As I paid under 100 dollars a night on a pre-buy (from a website called 1800hotels) -- I canâ€™t imagine a better deal in the downtown core. The 4 nights at this property were bliss. Check-in was a breeze. It was very close to lots of fast food outlets, restaurants, liquor stores, shopping, grocery stores and the TTC. The room was large and clean, and featured comfy beds and a flat-screen TV with lots of channels. The staff were friendly and accommodating and I felt very safe as a solo traveller. The free washer, dryer and detergent for guests is a great idea. I have never seen this before at a hotel. The Miss Canada and Miss Teen Canada competitions were being held at this hotel while I stayed here, along with an auditorâ€™s conference. The property was heaving with European, Australian and Canadian tourists enjoying a Toronto heat-wave. While it does not have many high-end bells and whistles, such as an in-room safe, giant towels, slippers, fridge, etc (that a 4-star or 5-star hotel might have), give this hotel a try. You wonâ€™t be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, and good location...”
Reviews.Author: Marle87
Reviews.Content: The pool was small but the room was big, clean and beautiful, also the location is really good, near to the Eaton Centre, college subway station....restaurants....everything! ahhh it has free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kcp5
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel in early August - mom, dad and 14-year-old son. Room was large enough that we didn't feel cramped. We requested a refrigerator upon check in and were glad one was available - it was small and placed under the vanity area, but was nice to have during this part of our summer vacation roadtrip. No charge for the use of it, they just said it depends if they have one available. They also have two washers and two dryers for guest use, and again no charge including the laundry detergent - again, a nice touch. We had the AAA package that included two breakfast buffets, so we paid about $16 for the third. They had fresh fruit, pastries, omlet station, belgian waffles, eggs, bacon, sausage, etc. - very nice. Room was very clean and we had no noise issues. Location was great, very close to a subway stop. We opted for valet parking ($30 daily) and the car was brought to us very quickly each time. I liked the hotel and would recommend it to others. I was not aware of a business section - just thought that all they had was the one computer in the lobby. For a hotel this large, there should be more than one computer available for guests to use for a short time. We asked the front desk to recommend a fish & chips place and a guest that was registering was kind enough to point us to Harbour Fish & Chip - my husband and son loved it - very small, unfancy place but really really good. A big thanks to that person who recommended it!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: p8patyger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a king suite which is reasonably roomy. Only complaint is the counterspace for the bathroom is quite small. Could be noisy at night from traffic on Yonge Street. Location is walkable to Eaton Centre and Bloor St. Breakfast buffet offers different varieties. The room rate includes breakfast which is a good value. Staff professional and courteous. Pool is very small and doesn't appeal to my kids.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & service.”
Reviews.Author: EB190
Reviews.Content: This was my 15th trip to Toronto but first time staying at the Courtyard by Marriott. We arrived late at night on 07/24/09 and checked out the morning of 07/26/09. I am a Marriott Rewards member and booked a room with a balcony. Upon check-in we received a balcony room on the 10th floor. Parking at the hotel is $30 a day for valet parking or $25 a day for self parking. Valet parking is in a secure underground garage with in/out privileges. Self parking is in a lot across the street from the hotel. If driving to the hotel, you must turn down either Wood St or Alexander St to get to hotel (even though it is on Yonge St). Our room was large enough for 2 persons although it was an L shape. The bath area had an odd layout. The tub and toilet were in a small room on one side of the entry way (close to the door to the room) and the sink/mirror/closet were on the opposite side and closer to the main part of the room. We had a king size bed in the room however the mattress left a lot to be desired. The bedding in this room was not what I expected to find in a Courtyard hotel. Have slept on worse beds, but also have slept on much better. Our room was on the south side of the building facing east, so from our balcony we only had views of the apartment building next door. If you get a balcony room at this hotel, request one facing Yonge Street or save your money and don't bother with the balcony. The location of the hotel was good. Just 1 block to the College subway station and the Carlton/College street cars. There is a 24 hour ShoppersMart pharmacy directly across the street from the hotel as well. Plenty of places to eat near the hotel as well. Our favorite place to eat while in Toronto is Richtree Market Restaurant at 42 Yonge St. On this trip we had breakfast & dinner there Saturday. The restaurant is setup like a market with many stations. Butcher shop, pasta bar, salad bar, sushi bar, fresh juice bar, and the list goes on. One thing that many people seem to have a problem with is find out how to get into this restaurant. You enter from Yonge St, but you must go thru the revolving door going into Brookfield Place. Once in there, you will find the entrance to the restaurant. Also on this trip we found a new place for breakfast/lunch called Cora's Breakfast & Lunch. This restaurant is only 1 block from the hotel at 27 Carlton St. Lot of healthy options and tons of wonderful fresh fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, Excellent Visit”
Reviews.Author: barefootgal88
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find, very centrally located. It was clean, and the staff was polite and responsive. We did have a little problem with the WiFi, but it was handled quickly and efficiently. The price seemed very fair for the area. The fitness center is good sized with a variety of equipment, each with a personal TV screen and complimentary ear buds. Nice touch. The business center was closed for renovations while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: NorskCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights mid-week. Staff were very helpful and because of our Marriott elite status we were upgraded to a suite. Very spacious and comfortable. Fresh cookies were available when we arrived, although they go quickly. Also free headphones in the nicely equipped fitness center. There is a free guest laundry with two washers and dryers (detergent provided) -- a nice touch. My only complaint was a problem with internet access. We both have Mac laptops that we have used all over the world, but we could not get reliable service (ethernet or wireless) in our room, despite long conversations with tech support. It worked, though, when we took our computers to the lobby. I think the wireless signal was too weak and the ethernet wasn't working in our room. Staff offered to move us to another room but we decided it would be too much of a hassle. We really liked the location, and the hotel was just the right size. A definite keeper!

Reviews.Title: “Fifth time here and truly enjoyed Our stay”
Reviews.Author: mayaluvr
Reviews.Content: We love coming here as it always provides Us with everything We want and need when visiting Toronto. We love being about two minutes from the subway and a ten minute walk from the Eaton Center/Dundas Square. Buffet Breakfast was included in Our package at a very reasonable price for downtown Toronto. Had a great sleep all three nights and noise was not a problem here. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Return!”
Reviews.Author: Roxii
Reviews.Content: I did not enjoy my stay at this hotel that I actually left after the first night and booked the Intercontinental Yorkville on Hotwire at an even BETTER rate. The location I wasn't thrilled about, however, it's not that far from bloor street, and starbucks was right up the street. The rooms were designed very oddly. My first room first off the air conditioning didn't' work, and so I had to wait so long for someone to fix it that I went downstairs myself with my luggage to switch rooms. Some rooms have the bathroom on one end of the room, while the sink is on the complete other end of the room. Who makes a bathroom with no sink?? and places a sink on the other side of the room?? VERY strange! It seemed like all rooms had their sinks outside the bathroom, but not always on the other end of the room. The bed was okay, nothing spectacular. I found the room also dirty, especially the bathroom. The curtain to the shower had brown and red stains on it. I also was able to hear my neighbors every time they spoke. The air conditioning unit was also SUPER loud that it would constantly wake me up. The good things-- Valet is efficient, front desk is alright. I didn't try the buffet/food. All in all, I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Ritzcee
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel mostly for location and price. It's not in the absolute HEART of downtown but is an easy walk to Eaton's Center and the subway. The room is clean and comfortable, and the service was pretty good. My boyfriend and I were satisfied. For its price, this is a great hotel to stay at!

Reviews.Title: “Very well-priced accomodations in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Grotshops
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel primarily for the price, and were very pleased. Room was large, the included breakfast was enormous and delicious, and service was good. I suggest asking for a room that does not face Yonge Street, however, unless your hobby is collecting audio recordings of emergency vehicle sirens.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, convenient, mid-level hotel”
Reviews.Author: MSMiller-author
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice and clean, typical of the Courtyard Marriotts. Pool was small but perfectly fun for my kids which range in age from 6 to 13. Location is very convenient with a parking garage right across the street for use by hotel guests. Toronto's sights are spread out so there isn't one location that I would say is the place to be. We found Toronto to be very drivable and just used the car to get to the different sections of the city. The commercial area around the hotel on Yonge street is a little seedier than ideal (cheap souvenir stores and a couple adult stores) but not enough to detract nor does it feel unsafe in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, not great, not bad”
Reviews.Author: MamaGrumpy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here June 23-25, 2009. Paid extra for a room on a higher floor to be away from city street noise. I requested extra towels when I made my reservation; towels weren't there when we checked in, but were delivered very quickly after I called the front desk. Room was clean, but needs to be updated. Wallpaper in bathroom was starting to show its age. No in-room safe, which surprised me. What really bothered me about the hotel was how small the elevators were! The 4 of us, each with 1 suitcase, were crammed into the elevator. No room for even one more person. (Great night view of the city in the elevator, though.) Can't beat the location - College subway station is only a block away, so you have access to the entire city. Cabs were plentiful outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: zerokarma
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel a number of times (Most recently May 17th). The hotel is in a great downtown location, easy access to pretty much anywhere you might want to go in downtown Toronto. The hotel is very clean, looks relatively new and contemporary, the rooms are always nice and I think represent good value for your money. We found the service was excellent especially the valet (if you are driving down), they may be busy at times but are quite quick to serve you. We didn't eat or hang around the hotel too much because we had many things to see and do but we did stop into the hotel bar/lounge once and it was pretty good, fast service and reasonable priced drinks, good place to hang out if you are waiting for someone. The only thing I can fault that hotel for is that the pool downstairs is pretty small but it does have a nice large hot tub. The exercise room is also a decent size with up to date equipment. Bottom line, if you want a quality place at a good downtown location but don't want to pay an arm and a leg then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A Clean, GLBT Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: YoungWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: Marriott has been offering great room discounts, and that was the main reason I booked. I paid 95 a night, however, in the past I have paid up to 150 for the same rooms. The location of this hotel, right on Yonge Street, is where the hotel begins to shine. A ten minute walk will put you right in the heart of the Gay Village on Church Street, where clubs, bars, and restaurants can set the scene for many nights of debauchery. Also, walking south on Yonge will put you at Eaton Center and Dundas Square in under 20 minutes, and it is a pleasant walk in the summer. The room was a King Sized with a balcony, and while the view was nothing spectacular, it was very nice to take my morning coffee outside. Breakfast in the Yonge Street Grill is a bit pricey at about 15 a head, and honestly the selection is rather unimpressive. There was an omlette station, breads, several meats (bacon, sausage) and pancakes/french toast/waffles. Typical hotel food. I would highly recommend this hotel for someone who wants to be downtown, but not in the heart of the Central Biz district, and if the GLBT Nightlife is key to you, I have not found a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: bluemmlabz222
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice, but nothing special. If you're looking for a clean, friendly, up-to-date hotel, this one is great, but it's nothing over the top. The rooms are typical rooms, but the location is great. So many restaurants and shops within walking distance. It's three short subway stops to CN tower and they have daily tours to take you to Niagra Falls and back. The wi fi in the room is really slow, but not a huge deal.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain For The Location”
Reviews.Author: jimmyschippy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on the final leg of our Ontario trip and found this hotel to have the immediate wow factor as you entered. A great lobby and very pleasant and helpful staff. Although we arrived earlier than planned we were given a room immediately overlooking Yonge Street. The room was modern but a little on the small side but was clean and comfortable. Like the Renaissance, which we stayed at earlier on our trip to Toronto, there was no safe in the room which is a bit of an inconvenience. The hotel is Wi-Fi but if you don't have your laptop with you there can be a queue for the one PC in the lobby, and more often than not there is. The hotel pool is a bit small, but the jacuzzi is large and the gym is well equipped. The hotel is located close to the Eaton Centre and all the eateries you could ever need. The College Station on the Subway line is just around the corner which makes exploring the rest of central Toronto a breeze. I did find the rate we paid to be a little steep but it fit nicely into our schedule. With a littlle more forward planning I'm sure that there are some good deals to be had at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly maintained - stay away”
Reviews.Author: Endeavy
Reviews.Content: Here are the reasons why I'd never choose the downtown Toronto Courtyard Mariott: - Long lineup (waited more than 40 minutes) to use the one (1) computer terminal with internet service (couldn't use the paid wifi in my room since it was slower than dial-up). There is no excuse why the Courtyard downtown Mariott can't have more than 1 computer station. People behind me waiting to print their boarding passes were complaining and said they were never staying at the downtown Courtyard again. - My room: floor near bathroom (near vanity and closet) was completely wet. I had to use all of my towels to lay them down on the floor to be able to soak up water and get to the bathroom, leaving me with only a couple of hand towels. - My bed: Yellow (pee) stains were found on the white linens. Don't think they've ever heard of bleach. - Check out lines were long - only 1 representative during rush check out time. Poorly managed.

Reviews.Title: “Justtt great!”
Reviews.Author: Averill42
Reviews.Content: Service we received was perfect from all staff, nothing to much for them. The room was very spacious & had everything you would need whilst away. We loved the location & I myself a woman first time in Canada went across to the all night store all alone & felt very safe. We had a brilliant day at Niagara falls. What I liked best was all of it, what i liked least NOTHING....Thank you Canada Love your country & all you people.....xx

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful”
Reviews.Author: Bignell76
Reviews.Content: Stayed there early may for two days and found the hotel really nice, clean and a great location for Yonge St. Staff helpful as I had broken a bit off my tooth and they tried to find me a dentist ringing round etc. Got it fixed within 1/2 hr (dentist above Drugmart next door!) Liked it so much we booked two more days at the end of our holiday. Our room was on the 5th floor at the front the 1st time we stayed and I have to say I found the traffic a bit loud at night but a nice room all the same. Our second room was a few doors away from our 1st but I didnt like the layout of this one as much, but still all very good & clean. Lovely soft beds and loads of pillows. Would definately recommend this hotel if u wanna see Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: hairybearmark
Reviews.Content: Checking-in was remarkable fast and easy. Reception had 2 members of staff on it with no guests waiting to be checked in when I got there. My room was only one floor up in the north part of the hotel with the receptionist telling me it was a quiet room. She was right as well! I was over looking a tree-lined sidestreet and there wasn't a noise from the for the entire length of my stay. Lovely king size bed in my room. The size of my room still left lots of space for walking round it/luggage/other furniture as well. Room also had a large flat-screen television in it. I have to agree with other reviewers about the sink not being in the bathroom. Very odd! Bathroom looked a bit dated, but was otherwise clean and no complaints. Didn't use the restaurants while I was there, so can't comment. Used the pool which was fine. Location of the hotel is great. One block north or south of subway stations and plenty of shops/restaurants to take your pick of. Will definitely stop there again

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: pd09
Reviews.Content: My parents and I spent a night at this Courtyard during our trip to Toronto and the Niagara region. Overall it was a great place to stay and the location is unbeatable. It was right in the middle of the city, just a block away from Yonge and College. In fact it was across the street from the apartment building where I used to live when I went to UofT. The room wasn't the biggest but it was clean and bright. Towels were all there and the washroom was very clean. The beds were very comfortable and I had a great sleep. Nothing really more could I ask for. One tip: parking is quite expensive at the hotel--$30 per day with no in-and-out privileges. I parked right next door just one block north at the Green P at Yonge and Wellsley for a lot cheaper even with frequent ins and outs.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for downtown, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: rachelopps
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Courtyard twice whilst on business, but over a weekend so I could do some sightseeing. It has a good location, near to restaurants etc. The Eaton Centre, and Toronto's main shopping areas are mostly a 10 minute walk away. The first time that I stayed, I had a lovely comfortable room with the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The second time, I had a strange room in the corner of the building which was a weird L-shape. Almost like it had been made into the room at the last minute. Service was average, when I asked how to get to the airport I was told that I should get a taxi. This worked out quite expensive, around $60 including taxes, I later found out that I could have got the airport shuttle from just outside the hotel for a third of the price, but I was not told about this. I am a Silver Elite Marriott member and on my last day there was feeling unwell, so I called Reception to ask if I could check out a few hours late. They informed me that I could only check out one hour late. There wasn't much flexibility. Overall the hotel is average standard, nothing fancy but it is a Courtyard brand. Fine if you just need a city crash pad, not as nice as some of the other Marriott properties.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, stayed here many times”
Reviews.Author: klein3
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here on multiple occasions and love the hotel. It is very clean and the service we get is great. It is in a fairly central location to the Eaton centre and everything we are interested in. We book a king size bed and the rooms are a good size. We had room 1610 this time and it was one of there prestigious rooms we were told. There was a robe and slippers in the room, and the slippers we were allowed to keep. We book under the CAA rate and it was $99 with the breakfast buffet included in the morning for a Saturday night. Overall very good hotel and we w ill stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not entirely the best value...”
Reviews.Author: cal_dude7
Reviews.Content: Went for a stay at the Courtyard Marriott Toronto for a weekend stay with my girlfriend. Check in was ok, asked if there were any opportunities for potential upgrades based on occupancy (hey, it never hurts to ask!), just to be told there were no upgrades available but that he would assign us one of his "favorite rooms". At first I thought, ok, maybe that means a) a good view or b) a bit of extra space. After a elevator ride up to our room (which was actually kind of cool considering the elevator had a huge lit up picture of the Toronto Skyline the size of the back wall in it), we found out it was actually c) NEITHER!. Upon entrance we immediately were greeted by being within a couple feet of the foot of our bed, and the view from our hotel room (7th floor), overlooked a side street with a view of what looked to be a loading zone/dumpster. Still hoping to make the best of an initially poor impression, I went to lie on the bed. My back was greeted with one of the least comfortable mattresses I've been on. I know it is branded as a Courtyard property, but in all my positive experiences with Marriott hotels, this was a shock, as I expected at the very least a comfortable bed. The bathroom was also basic at best, a bit small. Not wanting to waste a 3 night stay in Toronto in a hotel that I felt wasn't up to standard, we checked out, got our deposit refunded ($150 per night on top of your rate for incidentals is a crime, and is not charged anywhere else!) and found alternate accommodations Overall the location was still good, there was nothing wrong with the check in process, and I'm sure had I stayed the facilities and restaurants looked good. But the rooms themselves are worth maybe 1/3 what you pay, since they are 1/3 the size of most hotel rooms offered elsewhere. If location is your main/only priority, this may do...

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Clean”
Reviews.Author: jmvon
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews and book this hotel. I must say that the reviews were right. Great location makes it easy to walk around the city. The rooms are a nice size and very clean. Our entire group enjoyed the breakfast buffet. The staff was friendly especially Kola, the front desk rep. I would stay here again. The only downside is the expensive valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: Lubiere
Reviews.Content: Booked directly from Marriott online and got a superb deal: 99$CAN and if payed with Visa, you get a 25$ Visa Card. Check in was very friendly and attentive. Got upgraded to a King bed/balcony room. The room was a bit strange, with a long corridor leading to the bedroom, however, that implies you will not hear noise from the hallway. The bed was comfie, good pillows. There is a 47 in. LCD TV (no digital channels though). The bathroom was small and plain, and the sink was outside, in the corridor, a bit Holiday Inn style. Telephone was 1$ a call. Wifi is free. Bathrobe is a nice touch. Parking is quite expensive, as noted in other reviews. I didnt partake in the breakfast buffet (14$) as there is plenty of restaurants on Yonge St (24 hours McDo in front of hotel). The subway is one block away (College). The gym was excellent, with 4 treadmills, 3 ellipticals (both with LCD TV), free weight and machines. The pool is long and narrow, so its a bit difficult to do laps when other patrons are in there. The jacuzzi is large, but not powerful. Overall, this is excellent value for Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, central, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Halinmich
Reviews.Content: Not a five star, but for the $$ can't be beat--solid service, central location, nice lounge. No long waits at reception even during peak hours, decent concierge service, fast elevators, good valet parking for frequent in/out. Order w/AAA rates on-line and get free breakfast buffet at Yonge Street Grill. Free high speed internet service was nice also--can't for the life of me figure out why all the high-end hotels charge $15-$20 a day for this. Rooms were also updated w/flat screens and Ipod-docking clock radios. A good, solid choice for a middle/upper-middle range traveller who's looking for a good place to stay, and wants to save their $$ for Toronto restaurants and shows. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: JSMunn
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, well located at a fair price. Only real complaint were the elevators- a bit slow for a hotel of that size. Free wired and wireless internet - less common than it should be in major hotels.. Given its location it is fairly quiet. Service was fine, very helpful front desk staff- apart from no 5 am wake-up call on our last morning. We were awake anyway but otherwise could have been a disaster!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel for the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: ishkasister
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 2 night stay for a mother and teenage daughter getaway. There was 5 of us altogether staying in adjoining rooms. Upon arrival I insisted we check the rooms for any evidence of bedbugs, fortunately there were NONE to be found!! The rooms were clean, the only thing noticeable in need of repair was some peeling wallpaper. Check in and out was efficient, the staff were all very friendly,polite,professional and knowledgeable. We had CAA vouchers for the breakfast buffet and it was pretty good. filling you up enough so as not to need a lunch, but have an early dinner instead. We had a slight issue with an older drunk gentlman hitting on the teenage girls in the lounge, but the security staff dealt with it quickly and efficiently. Our rooms were directly opposite the ice machine, therefore making it slightly noisy throughout the night. Sirens outside could be heard as well. Beds are quite comfortable, there needs to be an exhaust fan in washroom. The beautiful Keg Mansion restaurant is within easy walking distance as well as the Toronto Eaton Centre. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: muffin78
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, huge rooms, good customer service, excellent rates (we paid $109/night which is a bargain for a downtown hotel). My only complaint is the rudeness of our fellow guests - screaming drunks running up and down the halls all night. This is not a frat-house, people!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: thomas9969
Reviews.Content: Great hotel & Great location. This hotel is in the heart of downtown close to all the action. It is about a 25 minute drive from the airport but close to everything; shopping, restaurants, bars & clubs, subway station & etc... Free internet - No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “OK place to stay. Central location”
Reviews.Author: churchmouse33
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a few blocks from Eaton Centre on Yonge Street. Loads of restaurants, cafe's in the area (but none -except for pizza place - open after 10p.m.!!!) Try Brownhouse on Yonge Street, excellent food, good price - half price martini's on Thursday!!!! We requested two queen bed room and we got a huge room on the 12th floor....two good sized clean beds, new carpets, flat screen TV, free WI FI , room comfortable and warm (it was minus 27c when we arrived) clean but plain bathroom..sink and coffee maker in seperate area..could control heating and could have opened a window!!!Didn't use the pool or dining room, we ate breakfast downtown. Car parking expensive, we used the public car park across from the hotel in Wood Street which cost $8 early bird parking for the day and the same for overnight..Lobby pleasant, nothing special but armchairs and space. Check in took minutes only and bell boy was always on hand to assist. All staff we met were pleasant and helpful.Would use again if we wanted to stay downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: BM2009
Reviews.Content: I'm a business man and I saw a lot of hotels this year. But this is the worse I've seen so far. The rooms are old, the internet is never working properly (neither with wire or wireless) and the service is not very good. Even if I had paid for the "prestige package", they would not replace the bottles of water in my room everyday (as they said they would at the front desk when i arrived). The parking is 30$ a day. They charge the same price than high class hotel I've been at, but it's really not worth it. I really don't recommand.

Reviews.Title: “Great room for $99!”
Reviews.Author: HabsFan21
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel for the price. Booked 2 nights for $99/night. Excellent gym. New equipment. Every treadmill/elliptical has it's own built in televisions with cable, so bring some headphones! Small rectangular pool, hot tub, and small wadding pool. Room was decent size. LCD flat screen television. Bed was ok. I had a room on the Younge Street side in the North tower. It was a little noisy at times due to the fire station across the street. Quieted down around 9:45 PM. Hot Breakfast buffet will run you $17. Decent spread. More fresh fruit would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not my cup of tea. Ugly, dated, unclean.”
Reviews.Author: happytravelpal
Reviews.Content: Check in was fast. Front desk staff pleasant. Arrived at room and the bathroom reeked of smoke and the bedroom had a stale smell to it. Asked to change rooms. New room did not smell of smoke. Decor was dated. Green spotty carpet? Bed and pillows were comfortable. There was a flat screen tv, desk, free wireless internet. The bathroom was tiny. It had a toilet and shower/tub. The vanity was on the outside of the actual bathroom. I thought the room and bathroom could have been cleaner. There was a big black hair stuck to the shower wall and a rust stair trickling down the tiles from the hand rail in the shower. No free breakfast. Checkout was easy. The bell man who stored our bags told us he would get us a taxi to the airport. Upon return at the time we were leaving he led us to a limo. Needless to say we did not want to pay the extra cash for the limo but then had no choice due to the time. I was upset that we were forced into this deal and obviously the bell man was getting a cut out of it. I would not recommend this hotel to travellers to Toronto. I have stayed at Courtyard's before and after this stay, will certainly not be staying at another of their properties again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: leonard-TRIP
Reviews.Content: excellent location , walking distance to everywhere even in cold weather, didn't use subway at all ( which was close ) Were there for international bowl. The only complaint was additional charge of $ 15 for each boy for breafast,. Average buffet . Everything in the City is expensive, 3 beer , 2 soda and nachos - $ 50 -local bar The noise on younge street is loud , but no different then other main street locations in other citys,

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: CanadianExBrit
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel from 23rd to 27th December 2008. Downtown location with easy access to shops, restaurants and subway suited us well. The room was spacious, well furnished, clean and quiet. Restaurant breakfast very satisfactory, staff helpful. We plan to return on our next visit to Toronto in February.

Reviews.Title: “Super deal, central to everything”
Reviews.Author: dwirthwein
Reviews.Content: Just got back from two nights at this propery - via a super $94CDN a night (around $77USD) AAA rate - booked on Courtyard site - which included a daily breakfast buffet for 2 adults (listed at $17/each on the menu). Though I would have loved to have stayed at the even nicer Marriott Eaton Centre, where we've stayed many times, it would have been crazy to upgrade to that hotel vs. this one at this price --- under $80USD at a name-brand Marriott property in downtown Toronto w/breakfast. buffet... can't be beat. Even with a $30CDN/night valet parking charge added in ($25 for self-park) - we spent significantly less than anything approaching the quality and location of this hotel. Hotel is located on the east side of Yonge Street, just about an 8-10 minute walk (or two subway stops) south of the Bloor Street shopping area and perhaps another 10 minute walk north of the Eaton Centre shopping mall. College subway stop is one short block south - perhaps a 2 minute walk - and a 24 hour food/pharmacy is between hotel and subway - a great place to pick up drinks and snacks on your way back home. Between just the subway and walking - you can get pretty much anywhere in downtown Toronto in 15-20 minutes, tops... - if not much less. Hotel has recently - within a few years - been redone - and public areas are sparkling. Rooms are nicely updated - including especially comfy, newly-plush Marriott bedding w/pillowtop mattress/pad plus a mid-sized flat-screen TV. Hotel and rooms, however, are decades old and only so much they could do to the smallish overall size and small and not-so-redone bathroom and sink area (outside bath/toilet area). There is a desk w/free internet (cabled or wireless) - but a club chair barely fit between our 2nd queen bed and the window... Minor issues.... As for the "free" breakfast - it would have saved us another $34 ($17x2) on the 2nd day - had it not been so mediocre on the first.... I'm sure some folks probably love any free, hot breakfast buffet - but we're much more about quality than "free" - so were fine to seek out our own food, at our own cost for 2 adults and a child, on day 2 -- since the room was a great deal with or without the breakfast thrown in (which we didn't even realize when we booked the room) - but we at least tried on day one. Overall, unless you are expecting Four Seasons comfort and luxury - this hotel will suit most folks very well, especially if food is thrown in. The location is as good as any for what we like to do - shop, eat, museum... Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, & Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Papaya9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in late December '08 and had a pleasant experience. The staff was very nice and helpful. The room was decently-sized, bright and clean. Great location in central Toronto. We stayed in the south tower which was fine. The Gym and pool are very adequate. Parking is best done self-serve in the garage across the street from the hotel entrance, on Wood St. You pay the machine for parking (Either Canadian funds or credit card) and put the receipt on your dashboard. This is the cheapest way to park unless you don't mind paying $30/day for valet plus tips. One negative I have to report was the clueless person who was in the room next to us that literally slammed his/her door from 3-4am one night. After literally yelling for the person to stop the slamming, they stopped doing so by and large! I often wonder if people of this nature are simply stupid/unsophisticated! All in all, it is a decent hotel and we got a very good rate under $90/night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Studio1402
Reviews.Content: A generic big-box hotel, but in a perfect location (for our purposes), and at a great price. We were able to secure a room facing (quieter) east. The hotel is a very short block north of the College Street subway, with plenty of food options around it. The building is older (though renovated in 2007); soundproofing is not perfect (i.e., you can hear doors closing in the hallway), but no complaints given the price we were paying.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Toronto!! One of the best hotels around!”
Reviews.Author: KiwiKatie
Reviews.Content: What can I say other than, this is one of the best hotels around on every level. Customer service is fantastic, hotel cleanliness is exceptionally high. All associates were friendly at all times, especially the reception staff. The gentleman at the bell desk organised our transfer to the airport and was very helpful. The gentleman in the gift shop was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is busy ALL the time and it runs like a well oiled machine! Excellent loaction, free internet in reception, I work in management in hotels and could not fault the hotel or staff and you usually find that you are harder than the average guest, I walked awy wishing some of my staff were more like the Courtyards staff!! Wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Courtyard...long review!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelloverOntario
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on Friday and Saturday night , in early December. We had 2 connecting rooms, and were traveling with our 4 kids and 2 of their friends. The review will be point form...hopefully easier to write and to read!! Finding the hotel and parking: - found it easier to turn onto Church Street, then head north a few feet so we could turn right off of Younge St.. -The street right before hotel is Wood St....this is where you turn right. -had hubby drop us and luggage off at front door, and he headed across street to Parklink, city parking...underground. Hotel charges $30.00 per night to park valet, or $25.00 self park...both of there are in the same lot, adjacent to hotel....outdoor parking. The covered parking right across Wood Street (you can see it from front of hotel...very close) was a total of $16.00 for entire weekend (Friday 5:30pm until Sunday 1:00pm). I think it is cheaper on the weekend than during the week, but certainly NOT 30.00 per 24hrs. Check in: -we booked directly with hotel and took copies of our confirmation...no problems -arrived about 5:30pm, and check in attendant didn't know if he had any connecting rooms. I told him as long as we were close it would be fine....but he kept at it, and found us one. -lobby was fairly busy...lots of people checking in, and lots of airline staff checking out -cookies were available at front desk -there were a few nice couches and chairs in lobby, but because it was so busy, it wasn't really enough -there are 2 towers...north and south. North has 7 floors, and the south 17. To get from one to the other, you need to go through the lobby area. -we were in north tower 3rd floor....connecting rooms -asked if we had a laptop, they offer wireless...but you need an access code The room: -looked like the pictures on their website -clean and no odors -we had 2 queens, an armchair by the window, a comfy desk chair and fairly large desk -LCD TV, worked well -dresser had 4 drawers and was spacious -mirrored closet doors with hangers that are easy to take off and use -sink and mirror separate from the bath and toilet...had blow dryer. Counter area was quite small, and the coffee maker was there as well. We did not use the coffee maker. -bath/toilet area quite small, but clean. Pressure was good, and tub drained well. - amenities...shampoo, conditioner, lotion, body bar and face bar -offered many lamps/lights and a big window, so light was not a problem -noise....the first night there was a lot of traffic noise...sirens, etc., but probably because we were on a low floor. A higher one would have helped with this. Also, there were MANY Christmas parties going on right underneath us in their ballrooms. We could hear the bass thumping until about 2:00AM both nights. The first night it bothered me, but the 2nd night it did not...I must've been used to it. Again, a higher floor would have helped. Pool and fitness area: -long and somewhat narrow pool...pretty cool water. Cold actually...great for after a workout, but cold for kids...and me!!! -hot, large hot tub, but jets are very mild, no real bubbles...which I actually liked, but not typical -small, shallow children's pool...quite cool. -hot tub and kiddy pool were tiled and looked very clean, but pool was cement or something, and seemed very discoloured. The water seemed clean, so we went for it. It did look odd however, like the surface of the pool needed repainting. It looked kind of green. - there were several upright chairs, loungers, and small tables around the pool -fitness centre overlooked the pool area - female change rooms were spacious and had a big rack of towels. - 2 showers...1 handicapped. Both were large and offered soap and shampoo in dispensers. Water was nice and hot. - had 2 blow dryers, and 3 sinks, as well as 2 toilet stalls -male change rooms had towels, showers, soap, shampoo,etc...but I don't know the set up -fitness centre had treadmills, and a bunch of other machines(sorry...don't know the names). Free weights, exercise ball,etc. - the machines all had a screen to watch TV, and there were earbud phones to use...and keep. They were in plastic bags in a basket near the front door -there were cups and a cold water machine as well as towels - a key card was needed to get into the pool/fitness area, then again to get into the fitness room door -there were no signs about an age limit, but when I called the front desk, I was told 18 -area seemed very modern and clean ****note about this area...as we were in the north tower, and the pool was in the south tower, we had to trek with the kids...in their swimsuits and cover ups) , through the lobby area, past several ballrooms, and right past a restaurant to get there. It did feel awkward...and cold on the way back!! I would definitely ask to stay in south tower next time...then it's just an elevator ride.***** Restaurant/Lounges There was a lounge, but we did not use it, so we cannot comment. I did see a TV in there and it seemed quite spacious. - the only time we used the restaurant was for breakfast. The rate for the cold buffet was $13.95 and for the hot buffet $16.95. It was half price for kids 6 - 12, and I think under 6 was free. -We would never pay that much for breakfast, but luckily breakfast was included for 2 adults each room, each night because of CAA rate. -breakfast has typical pastries, toasts, bagels, muffins, etc. Milk, chocolate milk, coffee, tea, and juice are included. Yogourt, cereals, granola, fruit salad, pineapple, pear, oranges, grapefruit bowls,etc. Also...hot food...scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, ham, potato cakes, hash, beans, pancakes....rock hard pucks...were not good, french toast. They also has fresh, do it yourself waffles with strawberry sauce and whipped cream...YUM!!!!, also hot syrup. Had a chef making custom omelets(sp??). choices...bacon bits, sausage, ham, onions, green peppers, mushrooms, spinach, tomatoes, cheese,...full egg, or egg white only. These were very good,***** but a note to those with allergies or vegetarians.... he makes 2 at a time, and uses the same spatula for both. So speak up if that is a concern**** - if you have the AAA/CAA breakfast rate, you just sign breakfast to your room, and the front desk staff will deduct 2 adult prices. Tips are extra. Surrounding Area: - area seemed very safe, right on busy Younge Street. Some of us were walking home about 11:00pm Saturday night and had no concerns. -just outside the hotel...on Younge Street, there is a Pizza Pizza....STAY AWAY!!!! We had a couple of different slices, both tasteless and burnt hard. My hubby brought them back to the room for the kids and I....even my kids would not eat them. Before I had a chance to tell the older kids not to go there, they did. They said their pizza slices were old and hard as well...and felt somewhat sick after eating the breadsticks. - there is a 24HR McDonald's kittie corner to the Pizza place. -24 hour Shoppers Drugmart a few minutes walk south on Younge Street - of course, lots of other restaurants within a few minutes walk...Swiss Chalet, Bistros etc. Check Out: -Express check out papers under our door on check out morning,. No mistakes, but went to desk as I always do before leaving. - one note...we booked 2 rooms, all under the same family, but had 2 different confirmation #'s, and 2 separate bills. This might be typical...I don't usually book 2 rooms. This was a very busy hotel....meetings, parties, conferences, etc, but still seemed comfortable ( except when coming of going from the pool!!!). Staff were all friendly. I would definitely stay here again. It was modern, clean and upscale. Sorry for the loooong review!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again...”
Reviews.Author: mkhamilton02
Reviews.Content: Booked through priceline, checked reveiws on tripadvisor (generally am VERY satisfied with the accuracy), and decided the Courtyard by Marriot was a good hotel choice for downtown Toronto. To start the trip off when we were checking in I overheard the lady at the checkin talking to another employee about how she had to "upgrade a priceline reservation" and laughing about it hysterically. Okayyy... so I didn't think too much about it. However, it's pretty evident that they reserve the lower floors in the south tower for priceline reservations. The room was small, the sink was located on the opposite side of the miniature sized room than the bathroom. The toilet hadn't been cleaned properly before arriving (think curly hairs on seat...), staff was rude when asking for an hour late checkout on a sunday. Asked for wash cloths because house keeping forgot to replace ours, waited an hour and never received them. Asked for champagne glasses... waited 20 minutes, nothing. Called again and received the "they're on their way" response. Another 20 minutes go by... called again and received the immediate interruption and "HE HAS ALREADY LEFT" response. An hour for champagne glasses?? I would have gladly used the 1 coffee cup they had in the room had I known it was such a hassle. And when they finally did arrive, they weren't champagne glasses, they were wine glasses. Housekeeping also failed to replace toiletries, so Sunday morning we awoke with not enough lotion, soap, shampoo & conditioner. Not wanting to "disturb the housekeeping" I decided to make do and not call them. I think writing a review is a much more effective way to go about things. The entire morning the house keeping staff would prop the door open with the deadbolt hook so that the door wouldn't shut behind them. Every 5 minutes you could hear the door slam up against the deadbolt lock.... this started happening at 9 am and didn't stop until 11am. Now, even I know it's not good for the door frame to do that.. so I'm not sure why house keeping would do such a thing, aside from disturbing guests! I also think they advertise that they have in-room safes located in the room, which is untrue. All in all this hotel was moderately clean, decent location, but terrible staff!! Please stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Our stand-by for good value, downtown Toronto accomodations”
Reviews.Author: mark_ottawa
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times over the past few years and will keep coming back. Rooms are nicely furnished/appointed [classy, even], nicely sized, painfully clean, etc. Service is uniformly very strong--check-in takes a minute, if that. Location is great for shopping, theatre, museums, transit, etc. Rates are very, very good on weekends--we generally pay around $120.

Reviews.Title: “This Is The One!!!”
Reviews.Author: beekvig
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have enjoyed more than thirty overnight stays at fifteen different hotels in Toronto over the past twenty years. We both agree that the Courtyard on Yonge offers the best option for location and overall value. The hotel is a five minute walk from the Eaton Center, less than a half-mile from Bloor Street, a block away from a subway station and located right in the middle of the action of downtown Toronto. Self parking at the garage across the street is your best option. It is only $4/ day on the weekends. (The hotel charges up to $30 per day on weekdays.) If you want a convenient place to get something to cheap to eat, check out College Park located a block away. It has a food court and a complete grocery store. Toronto offers a number of luxury hotels but most are located in the business district. Unless you want to be near the theater district or Rogers Center, the Courtyard is a short walk or drive to most of the city's highlights.

Reviews.Title: “Very competent staff!”
Reviews.Author: DinsdalePiranha
Reviews.Content: The staff was the most competent I've ever seen. Check-in may have take 90 seconds from the time we went to the desk til the clerk handed us our keycards. The staff were cheerful, very welcoming and fast! As others have mentioned, the entrance is a bit off the main street. You can exit directly onto Yonge Street from the doors near the South elevators, but you can't enter that way. The lobby is clean and there are always quite a few valet parking attendants and bellmen to assist at the door. One of the elevators was out of service during our stay, but it was appropriately marked and didn't cause any real inconvenience. Our room on the 6th floor (beside the ice machine) was remarkably quiet. We didn't hear a thing from other guests or the ice machine. The room was quite enormous and our king-sized bed and love seat looked quite small and we had a ton of open space...truly, we had room to do cartwheels. The carpet was new and everything was clean and working properly. The only real issue we had was with the bed. The bed seemed like it was "done"...it squeaked badly and was both hard and saggy. The linens were lovely and soft. We couldn't get the "wake up call" feature on the phone to work, but the alarm clock worked perfectly. Express check out was a breeze and the hotel kept our luggage for us (at no charge) til late afternoon. They also offered late checkout, but since we really just needed a place for our luggage, we didn't make use of that.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: cngw
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Courtyard Downtown Toronto is located at the corner of Yonge and Wood streets. The location is excellent for accessing all that downtown Toronto has to offer. The Eaton Centre shopping mall is an easy 8 minute walk and the College Subway is one very short block away. An earlier review indicated that the location was somewhat dubious with odd persons lingering around - I didn't see or experience anything of that nature. The hotel itself appears to have been recently renovated complete with a building facelift. The lobby is tastefully designed, modern and clean and is a good reflection of what my room on the 16th (members) floor was to offer. Check-in was a breeze and I observed that they handled check-in and check-out quite efficiently - even at peak evening time. The King room on the 16th floor was extremely spacious - i don't think I'd even been in a hotel room with a corridor! It was extremely clean - fresh spotless bed linen, new carpets, the furniture was in good shape and the air-conditioner worked well (albeit a tad noisy) and very quiet. The decor is standard Marriott - don't expect boutique hotel style here - but was perfectly acceptable and relatively new. The 26" LCD TV is now standard as well as the in-room coffee maker, bottled water and the very reliable and adequate complimentary Internet service. The balcony is fully accessible to let in that breath of fresh air, when needed. The oddest thing was the bathroom - while completely adequate with shower, tub and WC - the sink, faucet and mirror are located down the corridor! Took a bit getting used - the bedroom slippers (mine) - and the plush shower mantle (complimentary) - really came in handy! Breakfast was a big - and good - surprise - a full buffet from 06:30 and I didn't have to wait for a table on any morning. If one is in a rush, there is complimentary take-away coffee and tea in the mornings as well. All staff were extremely courteous, knowledgeable, helpful and professional - a refreshing difference! All in all, Marriott Courtyard Downtown is a very good hotel - i wouldn't hesitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bud75
Reviews.Content: Nice room. Large enough that 3 of us were not bumping into each other. Very clean. Very good service. All of the staff were helpful and friendly. Breakfast buffet was the best I've seen in any hotel. Service here was also very good. Great locaton, very close to subway. Good selection of reasonably priced restaurants in walking distance. Neighborhood is not the greatest but seems to be on the upswing. I felt safe at all hours.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, Value, Excellent Service - Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Rick64
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I visited Toronto on 31st August 2008, and had booked a King Room for 3 nights at the Courtyard by Marriott Downtown through Hotels.com. After a six-and-a-half hour flight from the UK, we arrived at the Marriott to an excellent welcome from the man on Reception. He could not have been more helpful, and our check-in took just a couple of minutes. Our room was very spacious and clean, and was equipped with a large flat screen television. The bed was huge and extremely comfy. Maid service was excellent also, and we had a daily newspaper delivered every morning free of charge. Downstairs, in the lobby, free coffee was available every morning, which I collected and took back up to our room. Although we had coffee making facilities in our room, the coffee was only decaf. We ate breakfast out the first day at a place called Great Eggspectations on Younge Street. It serves nice food, and not overpriced. However, we found that the hotel was offering a buffet breakfast slightly cheaper so we decided to try that. The buffet offered everything from breads, pastries, fresh fruit, yoghurts, all kinds of hot food, and you could even get the chef to cook your own omelette to order. I had some mixed fruit to start with followed by a full breakfast, of bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, fried potatoes, tomato, and beans. It was the best scrambled egg that I have ever tasted without a doubt.... Needless to say, we repeated breakfast on our last morning in Toronto at the Marriott â€“ value for money definitely! The location of the hotel is good, although a long walk from the CN Tower (about 35 mins). The Eaton shopping centre and Dundas Square are only a short walk. Transport links are good too with the subway running to and from the harbour end of town, and the streetcars running across town. Everything is walkable though... Recommendations â€“ CN Tower, Harbour Cruise to the islands, catch a streetcar along College Street to Spadina Ave (Chinatown), good bargains. We travelled to Niagara Falls using Greyhound Bus from Bay Street bus terminal, 2 minutes in taxi from hotel. Would I stay at the Marriott Downtown again â€“ ABSOLUTELY RECOMMENDED !!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel-great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: srrmsu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Courtyard Toronto Downtown for two nights, over Labor Day weekend, 2008. The hotel was in a great location, and the breakfast buffet, of which the cost was included in our room, was outstanding. They had everything you could ever dream of for breakfast. Our only problem was that we did the "self-park" option in the parking garage across the street from the hotel. When we returned to our car two days later, we found two parking violation tickets on the vehicle, stating that we had not registered the vehicle. Well we did register the vehicle through the hotel valet service. We gave the valet service people the two violations, along with a copy of our hotel invoice, indicating we had paid for the parking service, and they said they would take care of it. It scares me a little bit to think we may have two parking violations in a foreign country, but it remains to be seen, and we are hoping they will indeed take care of the violations. Overall, I would definitely stay at this hotel again. The location was very convenient to the subway station, the rooms were large, and the breakfast buffet was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “wasnt impressed at all!”
Reviews.Author: loridixon
