Reviews.Content: My Fiancee and I attended a concert in Toronto, saw the ad for Court yard Marriott on a site here rooms looked huge, hotel was beautiful so we booked the room for a night. We got there realized we had to pay more just to park our car over night (25 canadian) Got to our room and it was nothing like what we saw in the picture online....the building on the outside wasnt even the same. We werent impressed at all. Wont be staying there again thats for sure! Good thing the concert was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay, too much traffic”
Reviews.Author: UpsAndDowns27
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard Toronto Downtown in January 2008, during a weeklong business trip. As usual, the corporate travel agent provided "preferred" selections and I had to pick. I like my Marriott hotels, so the Courtyard it was! The location was close to Eaton Centre and many interesting bars and restaurants. It was so easy to walk to dinner or find something to do in the evening. That was a definite plus. With so many nice places to eat nearby, we never dined in the hotel restaurant. I did take advantage of the free coffee in the lobby in the mornings, and it was surprisingly good. One drawback was that there were obvious drug deals going on right outside the hotel. While I was never approached, it was unnerving to look out my windows and see that sort of activity. I was told by local colleagues that the area is not the best. They charged an arm and a leg for parking - I think $20 or $30 CDN per day. While I realize that any hotel in a major city will charge for parking, it did seem a bit extreme. My days on this trip were spent out in the suburbs, not in the city, and next time I will stay at a hotel in the 'burbs to avoid an hourlong drive to and from the hotel each morning and evening. When I booked the hotel, I underestimated the time it would take to reach the work site. There was road work going on nearby that complicated the driving situation even more. The room was pleasant, with a very comfortable bed. The bathroom had been recently remodeled. Free internet access was fast. The TV had the usual channels. It was your typical Courtyard guestroom - the consistency across the chain is why I continue to book at Marriott properties. As I said, due to my work taking me out to the suburbs I will not return to the Courtyard Toronto Downtown on business. If I take a leisure trip to Toronto, however, I would definitely consider it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: stuwho19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last summer when we were on vacation in Canada. The hotel was really nice and was only a ten minute walk from the Eton centre. The rooms were a good size and the staff were pretty friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel with good cardio equipment slow elevators and dusty rooms”
Reviews.Author: TDHVirginia
Reviews.Content: I booked a two queen bed room at the Courtyard Downtown Toronto on Hotwire. When my wife checked in she was given a one king bed room. I complained, and the hotel quickly found a two queen room for us (two adults and two kids: 13 and 11). Overall, we were satisfied. The rooms were comfortable and quiet. The hotel was generally clean, although the surfaces of the wood furniture in the room were very dusty, an oversight which suprised me. The elevators are very slow. The workout facility is NICE: approximately 10 pieces of gym-quality cardio equipment, dumbells, a pulley machine and a locker room complete with showers. The indoor pool was very small. The jets on the whirlpool were broken. We never ate a meal at the hotel although we got coffee (strong!!) from the lobby every morning. We walked everywhere: Chinatown, Hockey Hall of Fame and Roger's Centre. Long walks to be sure, but if you are in shape you should not have a problem. We did not use the hotel parking. Instead, we parked at a public lot behind the hotel. Saved a little money, but you have to buy a daily permit which you must display on the dash of your vehicle. If you go to Chinatown, go to Lee Garden on Spadina Street, EXCELLENT FOOD. Also, you can save money on many Toronto attractions by buying your tickets at Shopper's Drug Mart. There are many in the downtown area, the one close to the hotel is open 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Robbery in hotel restaurant”
Reviews.Author: LenaG
Reviews.Content: I was having breakfast in the restaurant of Courtyard Marriott before taking a taxi to the airport. I had all my most important things: passport, wallet, cell phone in my purse, since I was ready to leave the hotel and fly back to the US. My purse was stolen from the back of the chair, while I was sitting in the chair, I never left it unattended. Although police arrived promptly, the hotel management absolutely refused to check the kitchen or to questions waitresses or people who work on the floor in the restaurant. There were not that many people in the restaurant that morning and there is always a possibility the robbery was done by somebody who worked there. Long story short, I have nothing bad to say about the hotel, my week-long business stay was just fine, however, ALWAYS have an eye on your belongings! :)

Reviews.Title: “Typical Courtyard in center”
Reviews.Author: Whatsfordinner5
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in July. Large central Toronto location: short walk to university and around the corner from Church St scene. Close to subway.Rooms clean, though medicinal smelling. Usual attentive Marriott staff. Parking available, though expensive. (We used public lot around the corner.) Free Internet access; public computer in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Service, and Big Rooms for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: mjf365
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard was one of the better hotels I have stayed at. It was very centrally located to a subway stop, shopping (Eaton Centre), restaurants, the University, and other points of interest in Toronto. The staff was very friendly especially the bell hops and valets. I enjoyed the room as it was very spacious, clean, and had a great and quiet view of the street. The price was just right because I got it through priceline for just $65. Wireless internet was included and was fast for the most part but would only work in certain parts in the room. The only thing that would have made it perfect was if breakfast was included and parking was not $30 a day. Other than that, I had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel and wouldn't mind staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VacationLover2_8
Reviews.Content: Suprise, July 1st is Canada Day. Toronto was slammed with people and things to do. Hotel was full, but we had a great stay. Beds very comfortable. Asked for hight floor, extra pillows and towels prior to arrival (on Marriott site). Room was on the top floor with lots of pillows and towels. Nice gym area. Huge hot breakfast buffet included with room price, lots of good food. Very central downtown location. Not your typical Courtyard Marriott, obviously a bigger hotel name in past history. Staff friendly. Price was right. Half price parking if you just pull into the lot to the right of the hotel entrance and pay the lot attendant directly.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: 4NN1E
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room #509. Good size, comfy room. Everything in working condition. Good selection of buffet breakfast (although not included in room rate), very friendly restaurant staff. Located in Downtown Yonge but without the noise. Walking distance from Eaton Centre, cafes/ coffee shops/ restaurants, shoppers drug mart. Taxis readily available just outside the hotel lobby. Friendly and helpful staff at the tourism counter (thanks Jennifer!). Within the route of one of hop on-hop off tour bus service. Definitely will come back here!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Courtyard in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Flower47Nevada
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel visiting family, Niagara Falls, and CN Tower from June 30th through July 3rd. The rooms were huge which was unusual for a Courtyard and were also clean and nice. The beds were very comfortable with plenty of pillows. Bathrooms were also very clean and great water pressure. Staff were very couteous and helpful with giving us connecting rooms on a higher floors - I think being a Marriott Rewards Member definitely was a plus. They have a great buffet breakfast with pastries, omelettes, cereal, etc. It was a great start to our two week vacation on the East Coast and we would definitely stay here again if visiting Toronto. This hotel is located in a perfect location and within walking distance to restaurants and Eaton Center. We also got a great AAA rate through the hotel. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Covenient location, good service, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: ukjingai
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during an event at the Metro Convention Centre. The location of hotel is very convenient, it is a few minutes walk from College TTC station in the busy downtown shopping district. The staff were friendly, and the room was clean and large, with a tidy service. The only problem was that one of the elevators was broken, so you had to wait until forever for a ride. Hope that they will fix it. Compared to a few other hotels in the area, e.g. Delta Chelsea or Holiday Inn, where my friends stayed, the hotel offers better rates and apparently better service including breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “central - and the best breakfast”
Reviews.Author: planettom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two times in different rooms. Both rooms were big, clean and the view was nice. The last time the internet connection was bad in my room, but I moved to the hotel lobby. The pool area was without windows, but okay. But the important point, I got there the best breakfast in my holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: spark3075
Reviews.Content: I just recently came back from my stay at the Courtyard (June 23-25) and I cannot say anything bad about this place. Location was excellent, superb staff, nice spacious, clean rooms and delicious breakfast buffet. The hotel is located blocks from the Eaton Centre which is a HUGE mall. Nearby are restaurants and shops, even a small grocery store. I am so pleased with my stay that I highly recommend it to anyone looking to go to Toronto. I also booked the Gray Line tour of Toronto which I picked up about 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect”
Reviews.Author: traveler0008
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here during the Pride Festival and it was close to everything and the service was excellent. We stayed five nights, the room was clean, breakfast was the only meal we ate here and it a full service buffet. We both love to walk and the Eaton Center (shopping mall) was about six blocks, we later took a cab to the CNN tower and walked to the waterfront to enjoy the shore and then walked back to our room. The Hotel had an onsite sightseeing tour individual to help if you wanted to know about or book a tour of Toronto. I have traveled frequently and definitely give this my best. There was a pool and workout room downstairs but we didn't use it. There was staff around at all hours even in the morning (1-4am) to answer any question we might have.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Rabbit74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard Marriott for one night on May 5th/08. I am a loyal Marriott guest, mainly because of the consistency of the Marriott brand in Canada. This hotel was no exception! Everything was fine with the check in and the girl who checked me in was very friendly and professional. The room was a little smaller than one of the modern hotels, but still a good size. Room was spotless, and comfortable. The only thing that I find could have use updating in the whole room was the bathroom. The paint was peeled a tiny bit on the bathtub in my room, but that would be my only issue with this stay. (I know, very minor) I didn't eat in the restaurant, due to a busy schedule... but I did notice that there were also many restaurants in the area, both fast food and finer-dining. The location of this hotel makes it one of the best in downtown Toronto, if you are here on a shopping trip, or want something close to all the action. I will, without a doubt, be coming back to this property on subsequent visits to Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for great hotel downtown”
Reviews.Author: wannabefreqtraveler
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel to stay at while we attended my sister-in-law's wedding - the Courtyard was a really great deal for $142 per night, including breakfast! The breakfast is Marriott food (yuck), but there is something for everyone - custom omelets or eggs, waffles, pancakes, potatoes, yogurt, cereal - and really good service. I don't know that I would pay for the breakfast though - $18 on the weekends. There is a Second Cup coffee shop located in the same building (on Yonge Street) - I would rather eat there for $5, although the coffee isn't as good as at other Second Cups. The room is a basic hotel room, although the beds and pillows are extra comfortable. There was even a small window that opened for fresh air. And they gave us nice comforters when we asked for extra blankets. We parked our rental car there everyday for $30 valet parking. The valets were great - we were always coming and going - because of visiting family all over town. The parking is expensive, but what are you going to do? If you are new to Toronto, don't rent a car, stay at the Courtyard and hoof it to all the sights - you are close to everything there. Although the taxi ride from the airport is $55, so renting a car may still be an option. All around, this is a great hotel if you can get a good price and/or if you are new to Toronto and want to check out the downtown by foot. Parking and traffic are atrocious, so I recommend staying here if you want to see the sights - the CN tower, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: HR Dude
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the center of town. It is within walking distance of major shopping centers and many entertainment venues. The transit company which is nearby runs a relaible service that connects you to many other places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: TxMbr
Reviews.Content: After our sub-par night at Comfort Suites, we were far better accommodated at the Courtyard. It's a very well-kept property, in a less shady area and the entire facility really is smoke-free. We got a great deal - possibly because of the very last-minute booking - that ended up being cheaper than the first place was anyway. The hotel is also conveniently located across from College Park metro stop and is a good midpoint/walking distance to some great shopping in the Youngstown/Bloor area as well as the Eaton Centre. We'd stay here again if our travels ever need to bring us back to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Functional chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: fatboytom
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night. Can't say anything bad about the hotel, it's a clean hotel (which has just been rennovated) in a reasonable location (although to get downtown you probablly want to catch the Subway which is a block away). Friendly staff upon arrival, free wi-fi and a pool (which I didn't use). If you can get a good deal stay here, but think more inspiring places to stay exist in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AmyHikes
Reviews.Content: This hotel's staff was very friendly and helpful. It was in a great location, very close to the shopping center, hockey hall of fame and baseball field. Nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “some positives and some negatives”
Reviews.Author: ktowntravllr
Reviews.Content: Overall a fine experience. I'd stay here again if it was the cheapest (which it was for what we wanted on this trip). Positives - location was handy for the subway (about a block away) and for Yonge Street. The room was large and relatively quiet. We were on the top (17th) floor so don't know about soundproofing from above. Room was clean and comfortable. Common areas nice. Breakfast buffet which came with the price of our room was very good - very large selection of hot/cold foods - the price listed was $15 or $16 dollars, which is a lot for what it is. If I had to pay, I'd go elsewhere. Negatives - wifi signal was weak throughout the hotel, and I was never able to get a strong enough signal for my wifi enabled phone to check my e-mail. Pool was cold - I'm not super picky here, but there were some kids who got to the pool at the same time as us, and they didn't even want to get in!. Hot tub was too hot - we tried it for a few minutes and it left a red water line on our bodies. We always pay a bit extra for a hotel with a pool, so this was a pretty big disappointment for us. The biggest negative had to be the parking, or I think more accurately the hotel and staff's dishonesty in my opinion regarding this. They charge $25 for self park, and $30 for valet - no problem, free market. As soon as we pulled up a valet came over and wanted to know which option we chose, so they could bill it to our room. I said no, I wanted to check out other parking lots (free market), and asked them about the one that was about 6 feet from where I was sitting in my vehicle. He said he 'didn't know anything about it' and walked away. When we went to check in we asked the front desk staff about alternative parking, and she said she really didn't know of any, and when we pressed she suggested our vehicle really wouldn't be safe anywhere other than the hotel lot. We left and right across the street is a self park where we paid $14 or 26 hours! I actually think it is the same lot the hotel uses for self park, but there are machines where you can buy tickets as well in the lot. There was also a sign that said the lot was patrolled. So, if it was cheap I'd stay here again, but I certainly would not pay for the hotel parking.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Prone2Pusillanimous
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a family vacation. This hotel was very nice, clean and updated. We were very happy there. It was a nice relaxing and comfortable oasis for our hectic Toronoto adventures. Felt the staff was very competent, not overly friendly but very professional. Hotel is located in a great part of town with lots of things to do nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Canbound
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just 1 night and was very impressed with the hotel and the rate. The room was excellent, clean, comfortable and very spacious especially for a city hotel. The facilities and restaurant were of a good standard, helpful staff and a short walk to the subway. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Visitors
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are excellent, comfortable beds and very spacious rooms. Excellent internet access. Good location, close to restaurants and shopping. Short walk to airport shuttle. Great laundry facilities for those who want to do their own laundry and no charge, excellent for families.

Reviews.Title: “Post-Christmas in the City”
Reviews.Author: IceSkater76
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a really good location, near the College subway station (Be sure to get a DayPass for a group - $7-9). We originally went to this hotel on our anniversary when it was still a HoJo. It was a bit nicer. However, they did have problems with the fire alarm system. One day it was while we were out around 5 PM, and then the next morning at 5 AM. THAT was a problem for us, especially having to go up and down the stairs to/from the 11th floor! Anyways, other than that, be sure to visit Greektown. Cool restaurants and shops and convenient to the subway. Shopping is best down off of Queen/King. Eaton Centre is okay, but usually crowded. Bloor/Yorkville is very upscale. The squirrels are black in Toronto (neat), the beer is good, and attending a Leafs game isn't worth the ticket price, although we support the Leafs anyway. A visit to the University of Toronto is also cool and on your way to Little Italy. Never pass up a donut in Toronto! Geaux Leafs!

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: tokyo2507
Reviews.Content: After having my $500 shoes ruined by the hotel the shoeshining service (black polish on cream leather), they tried to "fix" them at a local shoesmith. A concierge attendant actually said, "Relax, we'll take care of it." But they didn't. It took three months of my life before they finally decided to compensate us for a night's stay. The "director of rooms" was finally convinced to do so after I demanded correspondence with their general manager. If you wish to be treated like "the bad guy," then go for this one. If only I stayed at the Four Seasons just accross the street. The general manager would have personally taken care of such a blunder without wasting my time.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, Huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: DisneyHeather
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Feb 2007 to visit some friends. Location was excellent about 5-7 mins walk from hotel to Eaton Centre. Good restuarants nearby. The rooms are huge!! We had a king size bed, and a sofa and desk area. It was amazing the biggest hotel room I have ever stayed in! Overall really good value for money and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CanadaJeff
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during the Grey Cup event. The hotel is one block north of the subway and within easy walking distance of many great restaurants and stores. They will recommend and make reservations in the lobby for you...they sent us to a wonderful Italian restaurant!!! Express check out...called down for the car and it was brought up straight away. Everything was perfect...we will stay again when in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Mid-Priced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iverge
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very well located, around the corner from the vibrant gay village. Plenty of choice in eating out from Greek, Italian to Thai there's something for everyone. 24hr pharmacy is at the hotels door step perfect for picking up drinks, snacks or toiletries. Shopping (Eaton Centre) is just down the street. I Reserved two rooms with two double beds and was given a very large corner room. All rooms come with FREE internet, wired or WiFi. Staff was very friendly and the rooms were very clean. Perfect for someone who wants to be close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Grey Cup - Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Joebaba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Downtown Courtyard for 6 days in late November â€“ we were in town for the Grey Cup. The stay was excellent in all ways, with just a couple of small complaints. Checkin was very quick â€“ they just needed a credit card and we were on our way. The room was a single king (as ordered). The room itself was a little smallish, but not a big deal. I suspect itâ€™s like most bigger city downtown rooms. The bed was excellent â€“ very comfortable and the linen was very nice. There was a fair bit of street noise from Yonge street (our room faced Yonge). If you are a light sleeper you might want to ask for a room away from Yonge Street. The curtains provided for a very dark room. The shower was great â€“ quite large and a nice shower spray. The bathroom sink is away from the bathroom itself. You might like or dislike this arrangement. I like it because it means one can shower while the other is shaving or doing makeup etc. You might feel differently. The exercise room was excellent â€“ 4 lifestyle treadmills with TVs â€“ and some weight machines. The room was large and clean. We didnâ€™t use the pool but we did look at it and checked the water. It was good, but I must admit it was the narrowest pool Iâ€™d ever seen. It would have been good for swimming laps, but not very good for water polo or other games. The hot tub looked good. We had breakfast every morning (included) and the buffet was marvelous. Omelettes cooked to order â€“ a Belgian waffle machine â€“ all sorts of fresh fruit â€“ scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, little quiches â€“ cereals yogurt. It was all fresh, warm and nicely presented. We had drinks in the lounge that evening after our team won the Grey Cup. It was fine with lots of choice and good service. The area is good â€“ itâ€™s three full blocks to the Eatonâ€™s Centre â€“ took us about 10 minutes to walk. There are lots of fast food restaurants in the area. I didnâ€™t see any â€œbetterâ€� restaurants, but I wasnâ€™t looking very hard for them. We never felt unsafe walking in the area, even after dark. The hotel is one block from the College street subway station. From there it is about a 10 minute subway ride to Skydome (right near Lake Ontario), or about 25 minutes to Yorkdale Mall at the other end of the line. As to complaints, we had twoâ€¦. 1. The building has 4 elevators (it is a 20 plus floor tower) and they were working on the elevators and had more than one out of service. This made for very slow elevator service. We used the stairs when going down. After our second day there, all the elevators were working and service was fine. 2. The wireless internet access is sketchy at best. The best speed I could muster was 11mbs, and it would freeze and become unusable about every 5 minutes. So I switched to wired access. This was much better, but would also freeze once or twice a day. Fortunately, I knew how to reset the access, but Iâ€™m afraid many people would have been without access. The room price was about right. It was a little pricey but it was Grey Cup week. All in all I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again if I was in downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard marriott”
Reviews.Author: dublinerca
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Courtyard marriott on Yonge St. and I must say our experience was great. Staff was accommodating, the pool area was very clean and the rooms were extremely presentable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: RECOMMENDED. Directly on Yonge Street, it's a standard issue Courtyard, close to gay district and a central spot to much in Toronto. Check-in quick, room in good condition, exactly what you might expect to find in any Courtyard worldwide. My room was high & not facing main street and was comfortable and quiet. Yes the neighborhood is a bit seedy, but this is Canada and crowds of people at all hours makes for safety. Plenty of area restaurants to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: TechWriterCor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard Toronto Downtown from November 9 through November 11. From reading the reviews on this site, I thought this hotel was going to be great. It was just ok. The location wasn't as close to Eaton Centre as advertised. It is about a 15 minute walk (kind of far in the winter or if you want to buy a lot). We got the breakfast buffet included in the rate. The breakfast was average, but nothing great. We ate dinner at the hotel one night and it took over an hour for a burger and they weren't even busy. The front desk staff were ok, but always seemed like they were too busy to help anyone/frustrated. The room was great - we had a room with two double beds and a pull out sofa. The room did not have the advertised flat screen TV though. The exercise room was terrific for a Courtyard! There were TV monitors on just about all of the equipment. The pool was very, very small, but the hot tub was nice. I don't think I would stay here again. It is worth it to pay the extra money to stay at the Eaton Centre Marriott or a higher class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: snowshoe_bunnie
Reviews.Content: Initially I had been a little skeptical, since it was a Courtyard, but I booked it because I got a good rate (78usd), and at that time they claimed to have been newly renovated. It was a nice surprise when I found the hotel to be very clean comfortable, although the room I had was small, even though on my booking it said 1 king bed, it turned out to be a queen (wasn't a big deal to me though). Check-in and check-out at the front desk was efficient. The downtown location was also extremely convenient. I have no complaints about this hotel and will definitely stay here again if I visit Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome. Clean, luxurious and professional staff”
Reviews.Author: junyea
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely clean, and the staff is awesome (very professional). They put fresh bakes chocolate chip cookies everyday. The location is to die for. 2 blocks north of the Eaton Centre (major mall, with subway system access) 4 blocks south of high end clothing stores. The hotel is located on a major street called Yonge Street. You can walk almost everywhere from here. The area, immediately around the hotel is clean and safe. The gay area, The Village, is only one block east from the hotel. You feel safe walking there at night, and safe when returning to the hotel at sunrise. The photo's that are found on the websites of the hotel are accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Handy locaion - ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paula202
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to Toronto and the previous 2 times we have stayed in the Grand Hotel on Jarvis Street but this time we decided to try the Courtyard after reading many good reviews. Getting there - we flew into Lester B Pearson and as we weren't hiring a car we had pre-arranged transfers to and from the airport. The transfers were with the Airport Express bus which doesn't stop at the Courtyard so we had to get off at the Delta Chelsea and walk a few blocks - not great with luggage. Checking in - this was seamless, no trouble at all. The lobby is lovely very spacious and although there is no safe in the room you can access a safety deposit box free of charge and staff were always helpful when needing to access this. The Room - the room was clean and quite spacious with 2 queen beds, the pillows were quite uncomfortable and it would be worth checking if others are available. The bathroom is tiny, you can't sit on the toilet without banging your leg on the toilet paper holder. The sink is outside the bathroom and while I can see advantages of this there is also little privacy. There is adequate storage space for 2 people. There is no fridge in the room but an ice machine is available on each floor. The hotel offers free internet access - only if you have a laptop - if you need to use a computer in the business lounge there is a charge of $4.99 for 30 minutes. Breakfast costs $14.00 but we had breakfast in the many eating places around the hotel so I can't comment on this, in fact we only ate in the hotel once and this was room service which was reasonable and very good. Location - the location was very good, close to most places and although parts of Yonge St can be seedy you never feel unsafe as its always busy, we went to a concert at the Air Canada Centre and walked there and back without incident. Overall the hotel is clean and not too noisy considering the location but there are other hotels which offer a lot more complimentary services which should be considered also.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ParkLane
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in July 2007. Hotel is in very convenient location, but be aware that it is on the edge of the sleezy section of Yonge Street. Not that we were hassled in any way. A few minutes walk from fashionable Yorkville with its cofffee / restaurant culture and about twenty minutes to the CBD. Hotel has undergone refurbishment and rooms were comfortable and of good size. We were on 10th flor and it is best to ask for room overlooking the side streets where there is less traffic. We were not disturbed however. Front desk staff very helpful. Breakfast was buffet and was overall value for money. Overall view is that it was value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot to Stay in TO”
Reviews.Author: tell_me_how
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in April. The hotel was warm, comfortable and clean. Large comfortable beds and quiet rooms. We were right next to the lift but couldn't hear it. Free wifi is fast and reliable. The hotel is on the main street in the centre of the city. It's convenient to a couple of subway stations. And a great base to explore Toronto from. There are a plenty of good retaurants around (including a great korean bbq place) and convenience stores are handy. Yes there's a couple of strip clubs a block or so from the hotel but it is the centre of the city so it's always busy. We never felt unsafe. Car parking is expensive but there's a cheaper carpark next to the hotel. The pool is indoors, very small and filled with kids when I saw it so I wasn't tempted. The staff were very helpful, arranging car rentals for us and even finding and returning my ipod that I left in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem on Yonge Street”
Reviews.Author: ESK1M0
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with the Downtown Toronto Mariott Courtyard. The check-in was hassel-free, even though we arrived before the typical 3pm check-in time. The front desk associates were pleasant and accommodating. The room was large and clean. The beds were surprisingly comfortable with many, many pillows. The bathroom was a good size and was clean. There wasn't much in the way of a view, but I didn't expect much as the hotel was on Yonge Street. The housekeeping staff were friendly and efficient. Check-out was effortless. This hotel is very close to shops, transit (tram/streetcar and subway) and other amenities. My only complaint was that my room did not have a kitchenette.

Reviews.Title: “very good choice”
Reviews.Author: mahwahmaddy
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our 2 nite stay . When we checked -in the person at the front desk was most helpful and courteous in answering all our questions. The bed was very comfortable and i was happy that they don't use bedspreads Got a very reasonable AAA rate and on top of it the delicious buffet breakfast was included in the price. Normally it would have been $ 14.95 a person. The location was good and I would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “You lucky people! Well done on choosing the Courtyard!”
Reviews.Author: Squeeky_in_Guz
Reviews.Content: Primarily in Toronto to watch Aston Villa play Toronto FC in a pre season friendly (this is no reflection of my taste of things in general!) my best mate and I decided to head for a central hotel so as to make the most of the other night spots in the town. Not only was the location sound, but the levels of service were fantastic. Situated on one of the major high streets in Toronto you have easy access to night clubs, wine bars, old fashioned pubs. The tram cars operate from just a few hundred yards away to take you along College Street and the metro is within spitting distance to get you to the other busy areas including the Harbour and the Entertainment District. The rooms were very well laid out and clean and the facilities suberb. The restaurant was ok as was the bar but you have a wealth of other places to go not far from the hotel. The pool and gym facilities were highly valued, despite the hangovers from the night before. Staff wise you couldn't ask for better. Helpful, polite, courteous. The concerge at the front of house was superb in giving tourist advice on where to go and what to see. The cleaning staff were thorough and provided their service at your convienience - not theirs as with so many other hotels I have stayed at. Overall, a top place to stay, whether it be business or pleasure, singles, famililes or couples. I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: savvytravelfan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 12 night stay at the Courtyard Marriott in downtown Toronto. We were in Toronto for a family wedding combined with a holiday and wanted somewhere comfortable but not overpriced since we were staying such a long time. This hotel proved to be more than suitable. We booked a King suite and the room was spacious and airy with the lounge area separated from the bedroom. The bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I'd slept in and the room very cool, clean and tastefully decorated in a basic way. The room was also pretty quiet and we heard little noise from other rooms - the only real sound we heard was the sound of the air conditioning unit but we soon got used to that! The hotel had obviously been recently renovated as the carpets and paintwork were fresh. We didn't try the restaurant as there are so many good places to eat in Toronto, but the bar meals were fine. The hotel is centrally placed on Yonge Street and very handy for the Eaton centre if you like shopping. However it was easy to get to most places from the hotel. All in all, though not a luxiourious hotel, it was very comfortable place to stay for our trip and also good value - I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this great hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “very ordinary hotel, but the bed was great!!!”
Reviews.Author: xiv
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Courtyard from July 11th to July 14th. I found the hotel very ordinary, but I suppose that's the standard of Marriot hotels. The staff at the frontdesk did their jobs effectively, but without a smile or a friendly word. (I am a very polite and smiling person, and I almost always get smiles in return, but not here. I had the same experience when I stayed at a Marriot hotel in New York last fall). I had got a very nice price, 164 Can $ incl. breakfast. My room was newly renovated, but still smelled like an old ashtray. I also wondered (for myself though) about why they had chosen to decorate the place making it look like a worn out hotelroom form the eighties, but suppose their taste is just terrible different from mine. The bed was just great and comfy, almost better than home. The room was clean, with new towels daily. The wash basin placed in a corner of the room instead of in the bathroom was a bit strange, but OK. I would have preferred it in the bath room. Breakfast had a lot choices, but was a bit tasteless. The last morning I ordered an omelette cooked while waiting, and it tasted just great!! Location is great, in the middle of Yonge Street, close to everything. The reason for my stay was business, and from Yonge Street 490 to 890 were I spent my days it took about 15 minutes walking. I managed to visit one of the many theatreplays (because of the Fringe which was going on at the time) and do som sightseeing on a hop on/hop off bus my last day. Toronto is just great, great, great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel near the gay district -- remodel to be done at end of July”
Reviews.Author: Jet-Setter-SF
Reviews.Content: For North America, this is a nice Coiurtyard hotel. I've stayed at worse Courtyards in the US and better Courtyards in Europe. This one in Toronto is in the middle. The hotel was in the midst of a remodel. Work progressed quickly while I was there and they said it would be complete by mid July. Looked nice even though it was in progress. The guest rooms were done already, but I can tell you that the "non-smoking" policy was new. The first room they put me in was nice and big, with new furniture and carpet, but it still smelled like an ashtray. I have some status with Marriott, but still they said I couldn't move. After a couple polite calls to the manager they found a room for me -- one that was "non-smoking" before they switched the entire hotel to non-smoking. Smaller but better. One plus: air conditioning worked great,. The bar in the hotel closed early and room service ended at 10:00. Biggest complaint was the lack of mini-bar. Maybe this is due to a local ordinance, but still annoying. The local booze store closed early, so I was stuck with local bars to get my buzz on. The restaurant and bar seemed dismal and I found nearby establishments happy to cater to me. The hotel is on the fringe of the gay neighborhood, so there were many bars providing diversion (to the north and east). And if you're not gay, lots of straight bars as well. The Yonge street environs were definitely catering to the out-of-towners. I also found diversion on an Irish pub crawl with colleagues from Finland and Ireland toward the south west. (Note to self: avoid pub crawls with Finns and Irishmen.) As for the hotel, the bed was comfy. The windows don't really open, but you can slide a mini-window open for a few inches of fresh air. Conference facilities in the basement were maze-like. But the big plus was free internet in the rooms. Maybe you're all used to it, but I'm used to paying $30 USD in London for the privilege.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: 1Jetgirl
Reviews.Content: This property is in the downtown area and faces on to Yonge, a busy main downtown street, but the sides and rear of the building face primarily a quiet residential area. I would choose a room that does not face Yonge since there is some noise (sirens, some traffic) but it isn't bad. The carpet, bed linens, etc. all appear to have been recently updated, the window has a small section that will open. It is about a half of a block from a YMCA, and there is a small, nice grocery nearby and a Thai restaurant and a steak restaurant on the side street. I think that the parking charges were $25Can daily/$30Can valet.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable hotel for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: juviall
Reviews.Content: I originally tried to find a reasonable downtown hotel for less than $200 a night. No way! So I increased my budget criterion and hit on the Marriott Courtyard at about $225. This is a great price for downtown Toronto. The hotel is located just north of College, so at the north end of the downtown strip. Despite being on Yonge Street, the room was very quiet -- I was on the 7th floor at the back of the the hotel. The hotel is presently being renovated but this is a minor inconvenience. The rooms are spacious, clean and have very nice bed linens. The staff were attentive and courteous. When a mistake was made, they were quick to correct it. Altogether, an excellent experience. Just stay away from the hotel restaurant -- which like most hotel restaurants charges a premium for mediocre food.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JayD2006
Reviews.Content: I stayed almost a week in this nice hotel and like it. The room was clean and spacious with all the amenities, well kept by an efficient housekeeping personel. The only thing I didn't like is the fact that the sink was by the wardrobe in the other end rather in the bathroom. The front desk was very helpful and answered all my requests. Valet parking was awesome eventhough you have to pay 30 CAD per a day, but if you want cheaper parking try the self parking next door almost half the price. The location is great, you can walk and tour the whole downtown area without any transportation. It's a good idea if you want to explore the hundreds of restaurants, sightseeings and do shopping. It was also a good value for the money and definitely I will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: zeezaxa
Reviews.Content: My finance and I stayed from may 19 to the 20. I believe we got the cheapest room in the place at 139.00. We did the valet parking at $30 because if anything happens to your car they take the responsibility and to him it was worth it. We told the person at the desk to charge it to the room. The location was great it was a 2 min drive from where we had to be. The stores were fun to look through. The hotel does not allow pets but I saw a purse sized dog leaving and on the way to our room there was a small dog barking and a lady in the room shhhshing it. We also thought we smelled cigarettes at night it is a no smoking hotel. Our room was very clean and smelled fine so I guess the rules do apply to most. The sink so far from the toilet was odd and a bit annoying. You have to leave the bathroom and go to the other side of the room by the closet and the mirror and sink are their. Our room was on the second floor and faced the street on a Saturday night I recommend ear plugs the hotel was quiet it was just the sirens since it is on a main street. But it is downtown so not really surprised. We did get room service that night and it was fast friendly and tasted good. Breakfast was not incl we asked them to charge it to the room. Upon checkout we had to wait for them to put the breakfast on the bill then we went to pick up the car and the parking was not on the bill like we asked but both times it was quickly and politely fixed. Service would have been excellent if not for this slight problem. All in all not bad I have stayed in better but then I have payed more.

Reviews.Title: “pleased with the Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: StChris
Reviews.Content: This hotel has nice rooms with coffee maker. There is a lap pool and a hot hot tub. The buffet breakfast is good. You can get eggs cooked to order. We had the breakfast included in our rate. The subway(metro) is close by. You can use it to get to the airport (bus transfer necessary) for just $2.75. This is a solid three-star-plus hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: J&LSwindon
Reviews.Content: What a little gem of a hotel! We booked on the basis of a number of reviews here on Trip Advisor, and we are glad we did! We had a room on the 14th Floor, which had been rennovated. Very clean, spacious and the bed was very comfortable. We did read that the bar opening times were a little odd. We didn't find this and always found it to be open except perhaps just after lunch. We had breakfast in the restaurant at $15pp. The buffet style arrangement was again very good. In terms of location, the hotel is quite a few blocks from the waterfront, however we walked this on a couple of ocassions (20 minutes) or we took the subway (5-10 minutes). The subway is excellent and I would thoroughly recommend using this. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone and we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay this past weekend”
Reviews.Author: mtlnorm
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights, sixth floor, completely renovated room. Basic king room. Clean, comfortable. The new beds are super comfy. Staff was great, always helpful. Excellent location. Will stay next time in Toronto. Paid $80US a night on Priceline. Note: went to "Hoops Sports Bar and Grill" across the street for dinner on Saturday night. Horrible food, warm beer and very slow service - avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexstu8
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, good sized well equipped rooms and very convenient location. There are however a couple of small concerns we found. The first is the entrance, if you walk to the hotel from for example the airport bus stop the entrance is a the back of the hotel and not too well signed. The second concern is the bar opening times are not what you may expect in a hotel, there are times when it is closed or closes when you are just in the mood. There are however a good few bars within walking distance (the sports bar on Yonge Street is a good choice if you like TV sports). The underground system is yards away as is the streetcar. A short walk down Yonge Street and you are at the Eaton centre and access to the path system. Walk up Yonge Street and there are plenty of shops and bars to discover. West towards the University area there is more to discover. If you head east from the hotel you enter a gay neighbourhood which is a bit of a surprise if you are not expecting it. All in all this is a good hotel in a fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: BandBAlways
Reviews.Content: You are on Yonge Street and are less than a 10 minute walk from all the 'alternative' hotspots on Church, the Canon Theater and the Eatons Center. The rooms are a good size and the food in the hotel is well prepared. The pool is smaller, but provides the r&r you are looking for. We've stayed at many hotels on the TO area and will stay here again many times in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Yorkie0274
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Courtyard Marriott Downtown on Yonge Street. The room was great, staff friendly and helpful. Location ideal. We walked to the CN Tower, Eaton centre and all the downtown locations. We were on the 15th floor which has been renovated. They are renovating a floor each week, starting at the top. Don't be concerned, no noise or disruption. Most guests did not know it was taking place. We only knew because we were told. I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: WearyWorkTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend for a little get-away in the city with my wife and grandson. Friendly staff, good food and fun pool(s). For $140 Canadian a night you can't beat it. Great value for the money and an excellent location!

Reviews.Title: “Too pricy !”
Reviews.Author: warminup
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband on a business trip so we stayed here for 2 nights. (Feb). We booked this hotel soley because of the location to his job site. I booked direct a couple of days before, and paid $161 with CAA rate, no breakfast.. We arrived late and check in was painless & polite. They did not ask for CAA card(don't have one) and included breakfast each morning for no extra charge. The heater was not working, but it was very late and we were in bed for the night before we realized, so we called down for an extra blanket. They brought us a cotton sheet the first time, so I called back and they brought us a duvet. They did offer to have maintenance look at the heater. Room was king sized bed with a man made duvet(fake), lots of pillows of every size. Very small room & very unatractive with only 1 picture. Reminded me of a hospital room. You could almost touch the door from one side of the bed and the window from the other. The bathroom was located at the foot of the bed. It had a shower & toilet only. The sink & coat closet were in a corridor at the foot of the bed also. Very inconvienent & unsanitary. The fan in the bathroom did not work so it made all the windows steam up and wrecked our view. The towels were very soft, and there was a small bottle of shampoo. The carpet was worn & dirty and you had to keep your shoes on. I called down for a new room in the am, and they did not hesitate and promptly moved us to the 11th floor. Bigger room, yet unique like the last one. The bathroom (with toilet & shower) were right beside the front door. Down the hall 10 more feet were the coat closet & sink. Down the hall 10 more feet was the bedroom. It was larger than the last room and the carpet was less used and vacumed. (I met a guy in the elevator who told me he was contracted to replace ALL carpets on all floors). The white sheets were in need of replacement, as they were discolored and no longer white. There was a very small balcony and we could see the CN tower. The windows were very drafty but the heat worked well so it wasn't a problem. Regular parking was $20(if even available). They do not guarantee it, and additional parking was 2 blocks away. Valet parking was $25. Breakfast was incredible ! If you didn't have time for a sit down, they had a small area where you could just grab & go, with variety, coffee and bottled juices. Employees were all smiling, friendly & helpful. The location is great. 10 minute walk took me the the Eatons Centre, with lots of great shops along the way. Lots of restaurants you could walk to, but no 'chains' if that is what you are looking for. I would not stay here again as I think it was overpriced, and the rooms have no 'home' appeal with very poor layouts. There are other choices close. I saw the Delta Chelsea which I am sure would of been a better choice for a cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Emer78
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Toronto and we were not disappointed. The hotel staff were always very helpful, with one member of staff on hand to provide any tourist information. The hotel was in good condition and the rooms were lovely. Being from England, we're not used to such large rooms! The breakfast was good, but we only ate there once, as we like to visit as many different restaurants/bars/cafes whenever we travel. We did think the drinks in the bar were a little expensive ($20 for a bottle of beer and a glass of wine), but the hotel is a stones throw from a number of bars. We will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: martin080251
Reviews.Content: this stay at this marriot was part of a last minute holiday to see the niagara falls and then on to quebec city. so we stayed for just 2 nites. i Emailed ahead and requested a room high as possible thus enhancing any views. i rec. an immed. answer telling me that rooms allocated was on a first come first served basis.. luckily our flight from london arr. midday so via taxi we could check as soon as we arrived ie 1pm ish. we . requested . the highest room avail. and got the 17th (top is 18 floors). everything was absolutely perfect..warm.....ultra clean.... spacious.... and efficient. all for equiv. of Â£60 per nite. for the 2 of us . would get such value in london. flat walk to CN tower (30 mins steady walk.)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for location, price, and room...”
Reviews.Author: brickbark
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week for business, and I've stayed here before. While it isn't the most lavish hotel I've stayed at, it is clean, well-kept, fairly nice, and in a PERFECT location to everything in the city (across the street from the subway line, restaurants, etc.). It's also steps away from Eaton Centre and the Gay Villiage, and is in a safe area as well. The beds are fairly comfortable and the rooms have all your standard things. I did find that a lot of families stayed at the hotel, so the fitness room and pool was often filled with children (kind of annoying, but bearable). Overall, I would recommend this over most other hotels in the city, should you wish to have a decent priced hotel with most amenitites that is in a GREAT location. Book on the website and ask for the AAA rate on there (even if you don't have a card...they don't check). Also, if you book through the website, they will usually include the breakfast buffet, which was VERY good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...decent Visit”
Reviews.Author: JimAtlanta
Reviews.Content: This was a repeat trip to this hotel. Its location is perfect for me as I like being close to multiple areas. However, I get so frustrated with hotels that forget about taking care of the guests. The hotel room was great. Had a suite and enjoyed the space. The toilet ran...a lot.....but mostly everything with the room was great. I even was able to enjoy the health club and pool area. My biggest frustration continues to be the exessive fee for parking and fees. $25.00 a day for parking is absurd. It should be 1/2 that. Self-parking is off property. Further...the restaurant service really annoyed me. The buffet breakfast was shotty, dirty, and not well-kept. It was the holidays and I guess they thought they could slack off. Most annoying was the music during breakfast. It was loud Rap and Rock during breakfast. I would have enjoyed some nice Christmas classical or something relaxing in the morning. The staff seemed to dance to it....at least they were happy. I may or may not return. I'll look for other campatible locations next time, first.

Reviews.Title: “friendly & helpful”
Reviews.Author: wineluvr
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time staying, and we will do it again. There were 3 of us: 2 adults and a 10 yr old. Room was fine and quiet with 2 queen beds and enough room. 2nd floor facing North. Fitness ctr had 6 walking or stepping machines and 1 multi-weight machine. Pool was great for laps. Whirlpool was warm and there was a small kiddy pool. Pool was well ventilated and I sat there reading for 90 minutes while the 10 yr old played. Valet staff and conceirge were great. In/out parking was $25, with the car in a locked warm garage. Many airlines book at the hotel. Many languages heard at breakfast. At dinner we spent over 2 hours talking to a charming couple from Portsmouth on their honeymoon. Hotel is in a great tourist location. Wendy's in the same building, McDonalds across the street. Drugstore 50 ft South. College streetcar and subway 1/2 block away. Walking distance to Bloor or Eaton Ctr for shopping. Plenty of restaurants in quick walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: peflores
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel so disregard all those reviews that critize the lack of jacuzzi, etc, because if you want that go to the Hyatt or the JW Marriott not the Courtyard. This hotel delivers what it promise, period. Clean rooms, good breakfast and fast and efficient service. If you go to Toronto, on business, on a normal budget rather than honeymoon, this is definitely the place to go. Great location by the way (walking distance to Bloor Street).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, horrible service”
Reviews.Author: molsoncanadianboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel will charge you an amount that you would expect for NYC or Chicago yet the value is not there. The rooms are basic, need upgrading. From what I remember no pool, sauna, jaquzzi, but it did have a smalll excercise room. They charge you for parking, valet is $20 dollars CDN. If you have a complain, good luck winning with the manager, It took me 3 long distance phone calls and I finally gave up and called Marriott headquarters for help. They did, luckily for me.

Reviews.Title: “High price buys adequate comfort in a 'happening' central location”
Reviews.Author: NW_Raven
Reviews.Content: For a week's stay on business in downtown Toronto, the Courtyard Marriott gave me just enough comfort in a great central location. The hotel is on Yonge Street, one block from College subway station. This is within walking distance of the downtown business and shopping districts. In Toronto, the subway is a safe and convenient way to get around. You don't need a car. In fact, it seemed better to be on foot in this part of town. The nearby areas on Yonge and Church Streets were alive with people all day and evening. There are many cafes, bars, and restaurants of all types and quality close by. Lots to do and see here and always people around. Fortunately, the hotel's main entrance is not on busy Yonge Street but around back. Here, the driveway is wide, well-lit, and well-staffed by doormen and valets. Taxis and airport limosines are always available. In fact, I saw several air crews using the hotel. The lobby is stylish and open and a good place to meet acquaintances. The lobby bar is well-laid out with comfortable seating and a view of the street. This hotel has a large number of rooms in two towers. Fortunately, the breakfast room was large enough to handle a full hotel, and there always seemed to be a staff member available. Overall, the place felt well-run. The breakfast buffet was above average in quality and environment. For $15, you get the buffet and eggs cooked to order in front of you. Some of the best seats look directly onto Yonge Street and the crowds walking to work. Apparently, this hotel used to be a Howard Johnson and my room betrayed a little of this heritage. While the decor was newish, the size and layout seemed more like a motor hotel. My double queen room had a lot of extra space. The toilet and shower were separate from a nook containing a wash basin and mirror. Closet space was minimal. Ventilation and air conditioning was provided by a very noisy, motel-like air-con unit. Also, a ventilation fan in the hallway squeaked constantly. In the hallway, an ice machine emitted a constant roar. Fortunately, the bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: halopes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Courtyard by Marriott Toronto for 7 nights. Location is great â€“ right in the center of Yonge Street, downtown. One can easily notice the construction is not recent â€“ there are some lightly damaged walls, corridors, etc. Other than that, architecture is majestic - 17 floors, 4 or 5 elevators in the south tower. You get the feeling you are staying in a big hotel in a big city. The rooms are very big and so are the beds â€“ also extremely comfortable. My room was just in front of the elevators and sometimes I could hear the *blimp* warning that the elevator had arrived. Breakfast was excellent but I found it strange that they didnâ€™t have cheese (maybe a Canadian thing). On the other side, eggs were cooked right there, as per your demand, making it a wonderful breakfast. Staff was very helpful. I definitely recommend staying at this hotel whether you are on vacation or travelling on business.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LadyVol-VB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I "won" this hotel via Priceline for $70/night CAD (which included taxes). Our 3 nights were uneventful so that was good. I thought it was odd that the toilet and shower were in their own room (i.e. the bathroom) and the sink was in the bedroom, about 10 steps from the bathroom, but we made due. It was nice that the laundry facility was free, including the detergent, but it was difficult to find. The exercise room looked very nice, but we never got around to using it since we walked so much all over Toronto. Wireless didn't work for either of us, but the ethernet cable did. Like my husband said, "The Toronto hotel didn't make much of an impression on me either way." As a frequent traveler and knowing that we got a great deal, I think that is a good thing! The location was great and we loved all of the ethnic restaurants within steps of the hotel on Yonge Street. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Five star staff at the four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Connecting passengers
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that should be the leader in how do you arrange a excellent hotel experience. Although this is a big hotel the staff is polite and friendly but not intrusive. They work effectively at the back ground but they make you feel that you are the main character as a customer. Or how do you see that the person in charce at the reception comes to shake hands with you and wishes you pleasant home journey while you are waiting your car from the valet parking? I think Courtyad Marriott Toronto is more like a four star hotel than only three star . They have big good rooms and a good restaurant too. One of the best hotel experience ever!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but don't care about complaints!”
Reviews.Author: melatr
Reviews.Content: I booked on their website and paid rack rate. I wanted internet access in my room on the TV, but it never worked. I politely asked why after having logged on a few times to be told it didn't exist? When I asked why I had a keyboard under my TV, they had no answer and ignored further questions. My stay included breakfast, which was an extra charge and not worth the cost. When I went to breakfast one morning with only a few guests in the dining room, they sat me at the furtherest table away from the buffet. When I asked if we could move to a closer table, I was told I would get use to walking back and forth? Strange attitude since I travel often and work in the Hospitality Industry. Asking for the managers name brought me a suggestion to call the corporate office. This is my first time at writing a negative review, but I will stay elsewhere upon my return to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Had no complaints”
Reviews.Author: AnnieGD
Reviews.Content: Have recently spent 4 nights at the Courtyard in Toronto. We were delighted with it. Clean, lovely comfy beds and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fine”
Reviews.Author: Glasgow_Member06
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for travellers who want value for money from a hotel in a good location. As another reviewer remarked, this part of Yonge St is a bit tacky but walk a few blocks up or down and the outlook improves dramatically - upmarket shops on Bloor St or, in the other drection, the enormous Eaton Centre. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. You don't often get desk clerks or bar staff laughing and joking with you. We emailed requesting a non-smoking, quiet kingsize and got one. Our room was in the south tower on the tenth floor and overlooked Yonge St with a view of the CN Tower. The room was spacious, well-decorated and clean but I don't like the arrangement of having the washbasin in the room (albeit in a closet off it) rather than in the bathroom. My only other downer was that the the lifts deposit you on each floor in a rather narrow, 'tired' corridor. No real sense of 'arrival'. There is a welcoming bar off the lobby serving meals. Our maid was thorough and kept the room clean and tidy. There is a subway station one block down Yonge St giving you access to the whole city's public transport system which is a great way of getting about. I am happy to recommend this hotel and would have no hesitation returning.

Reviews.Title: “could have been better”
Reviews.Author: bctravelers
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 nights at Courtyard Mariott on Yonge St. Staff was fine, no complaints. The room was a less than what we expected. A little small for what we are used to in other hotels of matching quality. I think there were two parts to hotel and we got the old part, but I felt like we paid for the newer area. Good location, close to Eaton Center, Dundas Square and many more places. Probably would try for another hotel if and when we return.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: centralcalifornia
Reviews.Content: Our family has visited Toronto quite a few times. We have always stayed by the Pearson Airport. This time we stayed in the city and loved it. The empoyee's where great. Great Valet service. Rooms where very nice. We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good value; good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient to the University of Toronto, Ryerson University, the Royal Ontario Museum, the Bloor Street midtown shopping area, and a subway stop (College, which is less than a block away). The area of Yonge Street below Bloor in which the hotel sits is a melange of mostly tacky shops and restaurants frequented by students on budgets, though there are some nice exceptions. Mostly, to find good restaurants outside the hotel, one needs to walk a few blocks west or north into the midtown district or take a cab or subway to the financial or theater districts. No big deal. The hotel has a good restaurant and large and friendly bar. There are coffee shops (accessible from outside) in the same building and one block south. I second earlier travelers' comments about the friendliness of the staff, from front desk to car valets to housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Expect a good stay here”
Reviews.Author: tvchip
Reviews.Content: Thanks to tripadvisor posters, I booked a one-night stay at the Toronto Courtyard Downtown on Yonge St. This hotel is in the middle of downtown, easy to get anywhere. We had 2 adults and 2 kids, and we all fit quite nicely into a large 2-queen room. Other hotels might be more interesting or have more features, but this hotel had everything we needed, in an upscale (if not luxurious) environment.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in downtown T.O.”
Reviews.Author: BeeGees
Reviews.Content: Just came back from staying at this hotel for a conference. We chose this hotel based on the reviews on this website. The price is excellent compared to other hotels in the area. It is very clean and the staff were all very friendly. We used the valet parking service, although expensive, but very convenient. The valet staff were excellent. The decor in the hotel is reasonable. The rooms are very clean! The king bed was very comfortable, a dream to sleep in. We stayed in an upper floor room, which faced onto Yonge and it was very quiet at night, except for once we heard a loud siren. Quite a nice surprise. Housekeeping was very consistent and thorough. We also had the breakfast included in our price, and the buffet was excellent! An amazing selection and very fresh. A nice way to start the day. The last thing is that broadband internet is included in the room, great for business travelers. I had trouble hooking up the second night and called the help number which sorted out the problem over the phone in a timely fashion, about 15 minutes. Our only complaint was that the toilet/bath/shower was located in a separate room from the sink? down a little hall since we were a corner room - which seemed a bit odd at first. Highly recommend this hotel for people looking for a clean, fairly spacious room in the heart of downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “OVERALL A NICE STAY AT A GREAT PRICE.”
Reviews.Author: ALZI
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my four night stay at the Courtyard - as others have mentioned locaton is ideal 2 minutes to College subway stop, 15 minutes to CN Tower/Skydome etc. The airport express bus drops off and picks up every twenty minutes at Delta Chelsea Hotel which is five minutes walk away. Checking in and out was rapid, allocated a double room was which was spotless and spacious with a comfortable bed and large TV with approx 55 channels. My only gripe is that the toilet did not flush properly so I phoned housekeeping who said they would send someone up to fix it which they did. However the next day it was still not working and overflowed slightly but as it was my last day I was not as angry as I should have been. I mentioned it upon checking out and they did apologise but I have to knock off a point for it. Also came back one day during the afternoon to pick something up from my room only to see a cleaning lady in the next room sat on the bed watching TV - hope that room wasn't being used by someone !!! I did not eat at the hotel but there are countless places nearby - Fran's over the street, Golden Griddle round the corner, Tim Hortons, Starbucks, Mcdonalds etc opposite. One thing is definite you won't be stuck for dining choices in the city - it is very cosmopolitan. Plenty of theatres - I saw Hair having obtained a cheap ticket from TO Tix which is on Dundas Square not inside Eaton Centre as some guide books state. Also check out Jeff Healey's live music club which cost only ten dollars to get in - sadly Jeff was unable to appear due to illness. For those wanting a quiet night there is a cinema two minutes away on Carlton Street. Lots of other hotel amenities included pool and gym which I did not try and a tour desk who I had to notify of a pre booked Niagara Falls trip. It was a pity about the toilet incident otherwise five points would have been awarded. However I forgive this as a blip and would book this hotel again provided simliar incidents did not occur.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location!Location!”
Reviews.Author: yk11
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Near to the subway and streetcars, which were clean and quick. Everything is a quick walk or a few stops away. The hotel was clean, safe, and quiet. The bed's were the best I've slept on in a hotel in a long time. Even the restaurant was good. Dinner was delicious, and the breakfast buffet was good if you like a big breakfast. There are MANY coffee places around for a quick coffee and something. Would recommend this hotel and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Best 3 star hotel in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: JillChang
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend always stay here when he is in Toronto. Always had a great experience. It is very convenient, right on subway line, and only a couple of stops to most downtown locations. Nice restaurants nearby. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great value, very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: jen2RochesterNy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the courtyard for the weekend. As others have mentioned, the parking was quite expensive, however we will be taking advantage of the parking across the street next time. For the price (we always use priceline for toronto) you get a clean, comfortable hotel in a great location. We love walking and this is a great location to visit Bloor, church, the university and of course the entertainment district. We even walk down to the harborfront from here. staff was friendly and concierge helped us make arrangements to take the fast ferry back to rochester d/t car trouble. The bed was VERY comfortable, room was large. we faced yonge street but it was very quiet. We didnt eat at the restaurant in the hotel, instead ate breakfast at Fran's across the street. We go to toronto 2-3 times every year, we always stay at 3 or 4 star hotels and the courtyard is right up there we will definately go back

Reviews.Title: “very pleased”
Reviews.Author: jls82801
Reviews.Content: after having a very unpleasant experience at the days hotel across the street, we left and checked into this mariott it was much nicer! Rooms are very clean and spacious! I would definitely stay at this hotel again! GREAT LOCATION!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, good location and very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Happyhippo
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the hotel in mid February on route home to UK. The staff at this hotel were as friendly and helpful as anywhere I have stayed in the world. Comfortable and very clean rooms. Good location close to Subway Station. Good internett access and availability. Food in the restaurant was excellent for breakfast and evening meal. Very good value and thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Marketing Surchage”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just so you know - the hotel charges a daily fee for Toronto marketing that they add to the bill on checkout. They call it a government tax when I asked for an explanation, but when I asked for documentation, it turned out to be a fee that the hotel charges me for their marketing purposes. All Toronto hotels seem to participate in this, so if you must go there, you can't avoid it. Of course, you also pay the government sales taxes for this fee as well as all other room charges. Just thought you should know. Other than this, the hotel is OK and pretty much average.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice rooms, a 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: fauberte
Reviews.Content: I will recommend to anybody this Courtyard. Well located in downtown. One block from the subway station. Close to highways. Walkable distance to any attractions. Free High Speed internet in the rooms, nice service, nice buffet. Nothing spectacular but everything efficient. The only catch: The parking...When you entered the hotel, you basically have to used either the very expensive valet or an expensive parking lot across the street. Don't bothers with Parking. Just use the cheaper parking lot just in front of the hotel(5$ a day instead of 20$).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tracy19288
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Courtyard Marriott we got a great deal through Travelocity. We went for a girls weekend of shopping and seeing the sights. We both thought this hotel was great. It was in a very good location. The subway station is just around the block very close and convenient. There are also the street cars there to take along College Street which was nice. Even in the cold weather it was not a bad walk to the subway station. We felt safe walking at night. The staff at the front desk were extremly nice and helpful. Since we had never been to Toronto they recommended some good restaurants and places to see. The room that we had was very clean and beds were comfortable. I would recommend this to others especially if you can find a good price on the room. I would recommend seeing Little Italy and Queen Street (Fashion District) if you have never been before. It was a fun area with good restaurants. Also if you are on a budget I recommend taking a bus from the airport. We took an airport bus at the airport that connected us to the Toronto subway. It was only $2.50. It is a longer way to get there but worth the amount you pay. Airport express was going to be $15 a person and a taxi was $46 for both. We chose to try the bus ride to the "Rocket" subway. We used the money we saved for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money but....”
Reviews.Author: dalems
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Courtyard for 2 nights and have mixed feelings about it. Like the other review stated, we also could hear a faint beeping at all times. While not noticable during the day, it could be heard at night. It did not keep us awake but it was still annoying and should not be there. The valet parking was a little expensive, but acceptable for a large city hotel. The Courtyard is a block from the nearest subway station and was a cold walk in January. In the summer it wouldn't have bothered us. I would probably try somewhere else next time but for the price it was a fair deal

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Marriott standards”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the first time while in TO on business, rate was very reasonable @ $109 / night. I have always been fan of Marriott Hotels for business travel and this is the first to lack the quality of service usually promised by the trademark. I thought I had stumbled onto a great deal but would happily pay more for less chaotic accommodations or better service. Being a large, franchise hotel I kept my expectations reasonable. It is not a luxury property but seemed suitable for a short stay with not much time spent at the property. Self parking is across the street in an unmanned garage with no security and the hotel offers no escort although I was a woman travelling alone and returning in the evening. I opted for valet which was very pricy. I was checked into a room that matched the requests of my reservation but hosted a constant beeping noise that seemed to be coming from inside the walls. After calling front desk a very nice member of the engineering team visited and let me know that all of the rooms ending in the number 21 beep because of gas lines (?). I requested another room and was moved down the hall. This room had no beep but also lacked hot water. The same member of the engineering team visited again, went to the bathroom and ran the water while playing with the faucet for about 15 minutes. Before he left he showed me that there was hot water and he reported that the problem was fixed. The next morning, no hot water. Via phon, an impatient front desk agent told me that only way to get hot water was to run the tap for 15 minutes or more. I do think that a quiet room with operational shower is an unreasonable expectation and per the chain's motto it was to be exceeded. It does not surprise me that the staff does not inquire of the quality my stay upon departure but when I summarized my stay they also did not seem to care at all about any of the problems I had experienced. Both of the gentlemen at the front desk just stared at me, waiting for me to leave. I don't think I would be writing this or that I would care about water or beeps if the staff had been nicer to me.
