I canâ€™t recommend this hotel and hope Marriott has a secret shopper program in place. They have so many great properties with fabulous staff but this is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Functional hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: SkyeTraveler
Reviews.Content: There are two reasons to stay here. The first is that you get a great location relative to the money you spend. (Through Expedia, I paid $117 U.S. per night for a room in December.) Second, the bed is surprisingly comfortable. Otherwise, this is a functional, no-nonsense chain hotel. The service is attentive and friendly. There is a restaurant, but it struck me as expensive for what you get, and there are many other options within reasonable walking distance. I was here on business, so it was a good hotel for that purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Price and location”
Reviews.Author: WestCanTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a real value-for-money hotel in downtown Toronto. The location can't be bettered ... one block to the subway, four blocks to the Eaton Centre, about six blocks to the high end shopping on Bloor Street, with the Harbourfront, museums, and other things all still within walking distance. The rooms are pretty standard, but large. The new beds are super comfortable. Room service available. Free internet in a room off the main level bar. On the marriott website, there's usually a good rate for a bed and breakfast stay--which includes the full breakfast buffet for two. (To pay for that for two in the restaurant is around $35) This is well worthwhile, because it's an above average buffet with lots of selection, including an omelette station for made-to-order eggs. I've stayed there many times and always found the service enthusiastic and helpful. On this last stay, the website rate with breakfast was cheaper than the "special rate" at the Delta Chelsea for room only, as part of the conference I was attending there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LucyLopper
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights before moving onto Niagara, Rooms spacy and very comfortable. Excellent friendly staff. Restaurant seemed expensive but a good range of food. Great idea having coffee in the lobby for guests each morning, (rooms have coffee makers but offer powdered milk !) I would definatley stay there again, My only concern was the beggars in Youge Street, but they dont harras you, We walked from Harbourfront to the hotel in less than 1 hour, including windowshopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We found the downtown Courtyard to be a good value for a center city hotel. It does not have the cachet of the Yorke or Intercontinental but it worked out fine for us. We liked the location for its proximity to downtown attractions, public transit and the gay part of town. The bed was comfortable and, even facing Younge Street, the room was quiet. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: SL.123
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel for our summer holiday. Rooms are of a good size & were ideal for a family of 4. Rooms are clean & comfortable with daily room service. Staff are friendly & helpful. The information desk is particularly helpful when booking trips. Good location on Yonge Street near a subway station & within easy walking distance to the Eaton Centre or Bloor Street. The restaurant is good for all meals & is competitive. A Golden Griddle & Frans are close if you want to have breakfast out. The gym is well equipped & the pool is small but fine if not too busy. There is a small baby pool. The hotel has a self-service laundry, which is very useful if staying for more than a few nights. Very pleased with this hotel & when we are back in Toronto would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: BillyTTroon_Scotland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from totonto and thought the Marriott was great. The location was ideal and it was only about 400m from the eaton shopping centre. The room was large and well furnished, the beds are fantastic. Staff are all very helpful and breakfast at the buffet is delicious and plentiful. We will stay there again when we go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beds really comfy”
Reviews.Author: oldertraveller
Reviews.Content: The whole package was great, but the beds are really the most comfortable ever. We had a room on the top (17th) floor with 2 queen beds, very spacious and clean. We also found the buffet breakfast good value with lots of healthy options like fruit in quantity and oatmeal as well as all the usual eggs etc. We found the staff helpful and friendly and the Market shop in the Foyer was useful. The location is quite central and handy for the subway although Yonge Street is a bit seedy, but not threatening. We would certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ericcon
Reviews.Content: A group of 5 of us stayed at this hotel only last week. This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The rooms were spotless and quite plush and the rest of the hotel was just the same. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. We ate breakfast there every morning and always had the $14.50 buffet which we thought was extremely good value and the food was excellent. We had a couple of drinks in the bar on a couple of nights and even though it was a bit pricey, it was good and the staff were really friendly. Would definitely go again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Gay? Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There is nothing about his hotel that will knock your socks off but it's clean, relatively new and in a very convenient location if you're gay. It's right behind Church St. which is where all the gay bars and restaurants are. This place is also close to a lot of the other things Toronto is known for. I can't imagine anyone having many complaints about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mistermix
Reviews.Content: I used tripadvisor to research my recent stay in Toronto and you guys were right about this hotel. I think it is a remarkable value for the money. The property is well-located, fairly new, and well kept. There's bell service, room service and a decent restaurant on site. The desk staff is courteous and helpful - we arrived at 11:00 a.m., well before the 3:00 check-in time, but we were given a room as soon as we arrived. During our August 2005 stay, the 134 CAD (AAA) rate included a free buffet breakfast for two along with the room. The free breakfast was pretty good. The only downside, as mentioned by others, is that the pool is tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Forwarder
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Marriott Courtyard for 4 nights in July. We were using Marriott Reward points. We had a great time in Toronto, the hotel was clean and quite. We used the pool twice, found it clean and refreshing. We never eat any meals at the hotel so I can not comment on that. There are lots of restaurants within 5 minutes walking distance. The hotel staff was pleasant and always helpful. There is a Metro (Subway) Entrance only two blocks away which we used regularly. We also walked from the hotel to the center of town around the Eaton Center took about 15 minutes. The only negative comment I would make is I think the hotel should offer Free parking for Hotel Guests. They don't, and it was cheaper to park in a City Parking Lot next door then use the hotel's parking. We would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Very VERY Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: hypnoticrichard
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel from a list of American Airlines last-minute getaways. It was a GREAT choice! Right in the heart of the action, Yonge street is very ecclectic but safe. Within walking distance of averyting. Great Sushi place just on the north side of the hotel. Shop till you drop in this part of town for everything! I do think some of the sidestreet neighborhoods should not be traveled alone late at night, but then again, do you really want to walk in any major downtown alone late at night? Also, they have the Marriott beds, which in my opinion are the most comfortable of any hotel chain. This hotel was a cut above th average courtyard in terms of service, price and location. However, parking at $20 a day is lame, but free high speed internet made me happy. Some carpets, hallways a little dated, but clean and nice. This will by my choice again!

Reviews.Title: “Been here twice, not sure why I came back!”
Reviews.Author: iamthespark
Reviews.Content: Both times they were not able to give us the room we reserved. The two rooms we've stayed in were barren! Two Beds, and a huge open area with nothing, should have been more tables or a mini-bar, but just blankness. Wtih the same price we paid, we could have stayed at the hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel- Toronto ain't what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: travelluvr
Reviews.Content: Great hotel- clean, comfy beds, quiet location and friendly staff- really off a side street- not right on Yonge. A/c was loud but just kept fan on and was cool enough- A power outage managed to distrupt a good nights sleep and kept us up from 3am on- who could sleep with the piercing alarm and managers announcements- they did what they had to but it was just loud.. Not their fault. Toronto isn't what it used to be- I remember a clean city- immaculate with out all the sx shops and billboards advertising it. We had to dodge piles of vomit on the sidewalk coming home from Blueman Group- gross!! They were still there the next day. Are there any places to get a good breakfast on a Sunday morning that isn't in a hotel? We walked south down Yonge- had to go 2 blocks just to find power on- and didn't find a place that looked decent until well past Eaton- near King and then we settled on Tim Hortons- I do remember this as a problem before. All in all- I don't know how soon we will go back to Toronto- there aren't the first rate plays like there used to be- Annie get your Gun- come on!? maybe a Yankees game- but that's it.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: Hollander
Reviews.Content: For 159 Canadian Dollars we enjoyed 8 nights in a very comfortable, clean hotel, which absolutely contributed to a great stay in Toronto. The room: In a big double-room with a big comfortable kingsize bed, 2 decent pillows per person (a first in our experience since usually you get a crappy pillow with the thickness of a towel), good matrass. The room was spacious and hosted a desk with big business chair, a two-seater + other chair. Free wired and wireless Internet connection, though the wireless version didn't work most of the time. A minor gripe though. Bathroom with shower bath and toilet, sink was outside the room. Convenient for when two persons have to get ready at the same time, awkward when you want to wash your hands after going to the loo. A working airco, though you cannot decide yourself which temperature. And curtains that really darkened the room. Hardly noise problems, despite that we had a room opposing the elevator. And most importantly, it was really, really clean and well maintained. And if you want the change the bed linnen and towels everyday. Outstanding. Hotel: The people hosting the frontdesk are capable, friendly and helpful. Everything is clean and looks in perfect order. There should be a swimmingpool and fitnessroom, though we didnt use that. We did use the roomservice though. Twice we ate in (Yonge Street Grill). The food is pretty good, a very nice burger and fries, two delicious rice dishes with cocos and chicken/fish. Delivered by a very friendly guy in 30 -60 mins. Breakfast is standard not included. Not a problem, at walking distance (i.e. less than 5 mins across the street) you will already find 3 breakfast places. Either Starbucks or the much cheaper Tim Horton chain are excellent alternatives. Especially Tim Horton is really cheap. For 2 cappucino, and 3 muffins you pay about $6.50. If you prefer to pay for breakfast at the hotel is that ofcourse entirely up to you. Location: Courtyard is located at Yonge Street, which holds the record for being the longest street in the world. The entrance however is at Wood St. (a side street of Yonge). The closest subway station is College, a block or two away (a short stroll, 5 - 10 mins). Conveniently there are several groceries stores closeby. I would advice you Dominion (24 hrs open), which is located at Collegepark below Winners (again 5 mins away), which is also the place where you could get on the subway or enter the underground PATH. There is also a small foodcourt down there, but nothing special. Handy if you decide to eat in your hotelroom. They do make fresh and tasty pizzas there as well and are well assorted. However, Yonge has a gritty edge to it (as does most of Toronto). It certainly is not unsafe, at least not to our impression, but Yonge has a mix of grocery shops, sex-shops, (sex)clubs, decent bars, audio, books, restaurants (all kinds and all levels), art-galleries, malls, a Scientology church... so for all walks of life. Who you will encounter there as well. Nothing shocking if you regularly visit bigger towns, but if you come from a small rural town or you visit with very young children, you might find that a problem. If you stay south of Courtyard it is even less of a problem, since I think only the Zanzibar club is noticeably there. Apart from that, the location is great. Basically everything is at walking distance, as is public transport. Oh, when you arrive at Pearson Airport and you want to use the Toronto Airport Express (probably the best idea price/convenience ratio wise), that bus stops at the Delta Chelsea, which is 2 blocks away from the Courtyard by Marriot at a side street of Yonge. Overall, the hotel was an absolute delight and we recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daisiegee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 9th to 14th July, and had a terrible experience at check in due to a mistake by the travel agent. This was handled really nicely by the front desk staff however and they were extremely helpful. We were given a King room on the 17th floor. Not a terrific view, but the room was immaculate, the bed very comfortable, and the bed linens superb. The bathroom was spotless, but the sink being outside the bathroom was a bit odd, and took some getting used to! Loads of storage space, free internet access, and large desk. The hotel's public areas are very smart. There's a business area where you can use a PC and printer. Although we didn't use the dining rooms at all, we did go into the bar one evening and it was very pleasant. Very close to transport links and there's a lovely italian restaurant on Elm St, just a short walk down Yonge. If I were to return to Toronto, I'd definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: WERTTraveler
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at other Courtyards, I expected basic, but clean and well organized, accommodations. In fact, this hotel seems like a full blown Marriott at Courtyard prices. The lobby was inviting, expansive, and classical music played softly in the background. The staff was courteous, efficient, and helpful. Our room, although at the lowest rate, had a nice view and was impeccably clean. It was a pleasure to return to every day. We had a few quibbles: the bathroom was a little tight and Internet service was a little sluggish. However, we left the hotel very impressed and ready to return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot in the city!”
Reviews.Author: royski69
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a convention June 30 thru July 4. Purchased a $7 transit pass for 4 days (through our convention)......which was perfect! This hotel is 1/4 block from the "College" station of the TTC Subway. Very easy to get to the convention center via Union Station subway stop. We had reserved (and requested) a non-smoking King room on a high floor. They gave us a non-smoking King room on the 10th floor, corner room with a balcony over-looking Yonge street! Awesome views! Room was clean, comfortable, and accomodating. Bathroom with tub-shower and toilet were separate from a sink and clothes-closet in the hall. We didn't use the small pool, hot tub, and fitness center in the lower-floor, but they looked OK. We had the breakfast buffet in the hotel restaurant one morning---not good. This is the only reason I didn't give this hotel 5 stars! Location on Yonge street is very convenient....for conventioneers, business people, and tourists. It's all there! And you don't need to rent a car. One hint: Take the TTC (Subway/bus) between the airport and downtown. Cost is CAD$2.50 vs. CAD$20 each way. Takes a little bit longer, but very convenient. Could actually be quicker if roads are gridlocked with traffic. Pictures attached are the views from our balcony.

Reviews.Title: “A real winner!”
Reviews.Author: Sooz2
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a gorgeous and enormous lobby, is newly refurbished, was quiet, super clean, and had the best beds ever! (We are pretty fussy and a bit hard to please, but this was great. I haven't given anything 5 stars...I'm saving that for something out of this world!) The restaurant was exceptionally good (we had excellent dinners there--twice). The location is very good and we are SO glad we took a tour, arranged by the hotel, that picked us up right at the front door. (What a fantastic city! Who knew?) We had a very reasonable rate, free high speed internet--overall it's an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went there with a friend for a mothers night away, we were very excited when the front dest staff told us they were giving us a great room. When we got up there it was awful the beds were half made and room was dirty. We called down and they said they would change our room, so we grab our stuff and went down to get the key to our new room. When we got in the room it was worse then the first, so once again we called down and let them know the room was unacceptable, they said they would get back to us, but after 20 mins we grab our stuff and went down to get a new room. Finally the room they gave us was clean and we could unpack. It took an hour and a half from time we got there until we got the third room. They did give us complamentery breakfast but I think they could have given a little more considering how little time us moms actually get for ourselves we really don't want to spend it changing rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Carter052
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Marriott Courtyard in Downtown Toronto for 4 nights and it was one of the best hotels we have stayed in. The room was huge with two king size beds, a large desk, comfortable chair, television etc. The whole hotel was immaculately clean and the staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. The food in the restaurant was excellent! The buffet breakfast was the best we have ever had in a hotel and was excellent value for money at all you can eat for $14.50. The restaurant and room service menu is the same price, and again the food is first rate. We didn't have time to use the leisure facilities but the swimming pool and gym were clean and well organised. It is conveniently located for restaurants, shopping and sightseeing. It takes about 10 minutes to walk to the Eaton Centre or the Bloor-Yorkville shopping district. A wonderful hotel and we wouldn't hesitate to book this again!
